reviews.review_text: My first impression of this phone was that it’s a great phone which rival’s phones that cost double its price. Both the build quality and display are premium. Initially, I was a little worried about purchasing a phone with something other than stock Android on it since that’s what my previous phone (a Nexus 5x) was running, but the EMUI interface isn’t bad at all and I didn’t consider it a downgrade once I used it. The Honor 7x ships with a little bloatware installed, most of which can be removed. Some apps such as SwiftKey cannot be uninstalled, although you can set the default to the Google keyboard app instead. The phone also ships with a clear case that’s good enough to use until you know you’re going to keep the phone. I spent almost an entire day getting everything setup only to later discover that the Honor 7x is not compatible with Fitbit devices. It will not sync no matter what and searching for the problem reveals that everyone else with this phone is experiencing the same problem. I'm not sure if it’s a problem with the phone or Fitbit. Based on my research, both the Bluetooth and Wi-Fi share the same antenna on this phone. Anytime the phone is restarted, the Bluetooth is automatically disabled and has to be re-enabled. Pros include a beautiful and large screen with small bezels, great performance, and premium build quality. Cons include no NFC (used for mobile payments), no 5G Wi-Fi support, and Micro-USB instead of USB-C. Sadly, I had to return the phone due to a lack of compatibility with my Fitbit Charge 2. My recommendation to anyone purchasing this phone is to test it with your Bluetooth devices before investing a significant amount of time configuring everything else.
reviews.review_author: Mike F Robbins Honor Device USA

reviews.review_text: I really wanted this phone to be my replacement. Sadly it couldn't handle my day to day tasks. This phone would lag really bad when it came to social Media (Snapchat, Facebook, Instagram). But the camera was really bad. At least for my unit it was. I would take photos with natural sunlight lighting and the images would still come out washed out. I was also having mic issues with mine. People on the other side of the phone said I sounded faint or far away from my phone. When in reality my head was next to the mic. I really wanted this phone to be my current phone. But it came with too many issues. I already requested a refund and received. I don't blame the phone or the manafacturer, because it's a mid-range phone not a high end phone. I really wanted to like this phone but I couldn't.
reviews.review_header: Really wanted to like this but....

reviews.review_text: The worst purchase I could make, the phone slows down. And now in just 2 months the loudspeaker will be damaged. I do not recommend it at all.
reviews.review_header: The worst purchase I could make

reviews.review_text: I've been using the blue version for 3 weeks now (I purchased directly from Honor's site). This is my first android phone in 5 years so here are my comments: The build quality is very good, screen looks very good (except in direct sunlight), the fingerprint scanner is super quick. I have quite a few games on my phone, the only one that lags at all is the simpsons tapped out. The phone came with a really nice slim clear phone case which is awesome. Camera is decent, phone is fast, EMUI (Huawei's android skin) is cool for me and easy to customize....basically for $200, you can't beat the quality of this phone. Now on to my complaints. The 32 GB isn't enough for me, so I bought a 32GB SD card in the 2nd SIM slot for my music. I uploaded all my music to google Play Music from itunes which wasn't too difficult. The somewhat annoying part was that you have to go into the settings on Play Music to have the music download directly to the SD card, as the storage management doesn't let you transfer between your internal drive and SD card. The only thing I've been able to download directly to the SD card is music and photos. I haven't been able to find out how to transfer apps to the SD card, which is somewhat frustrating as it shouldn't be that hard to figure out. The SD Card/Internal drive storage management and lack of NFC are my only real complaints about the phone, and the only reason I can't give the phone 5 stars.
reviews.review_header: I would give it 4.5 stars if I could, great phone with some minor complaints.

reviews.review_text: I really liked the phone but within 12 hours it went into a permanent update that it never recovered from. I had to return it the next day. It was such an easy phone to use and activate. Too bad that happened.

I bought this phone directly from Honor before amazon had it weeks ago. This phone is great. For the price its looks and feels way more expensive. Truly a bargain. All aluminum build with a nice feel in the hand. Not too heavy or light. The cameras are great. Now, how often do you see a dual camera on a budget phone that actually takes good pictures or dual cameras at all? This one does!!! The screen is a site to behold. 5.93 inches in a $200 phone with the new 18:9 modern design ....wow. If you want a budget phone with flagship features....definitely get this one.

Update: changing to 2 stars after weeks of use for two reasons: Screen: touch screen very non responsive. If you swipe down from top of the screen to access settings menu it would work 7 out of 10 times, the other 3 times it either does not respond at all or swipes right back up. Very erratic behavior when surfing websites (many accidental likes on Facebook when I am no where near the like button on the touchscreen). Typing numbers take many tries especially the numbers on the edges. After sale support: abysmal. I talked to honor about the issue above and their response: send in the phone, we will take 2 weeks besides shipping time to look into whether we can fix this or not. From a (former) hardcore Honor fan: you blew it this time. This will be my last Honor device. Honor 5x started the tradition of true “budget” smart phones with a metal design and a fingerprint sensor which were rarely seen on any phone with close price tag at that time. This was followed with Honor 6x which was a huge hit and changed the expectation for any phone with similar price range. You no longer must settle for cheap plastic or one hour screen on time battery. Honor 6x was a definitive improvement over the honor 5x, and I gave it 5 stars on my review when it was first released about a year ago. Honor is doing it again! In lines with the same tradition, Honor 7x is yet another “budget-premium” phone with contemporary design and low-price tag. How does it compare to its predecessor? Un-boxing and accessories Honor still going with the standard (almost identical) box. Nothing fancy. Like always, it is much easier to find accessories for the older phone but this is unlikely to last long. One major difference: Honor decided to oddly enough skip the preinstalled screen protector it had installed on Honor 6x. Being a new phone with no widespread accessories (no screen protector available even on their own web store!) coupled with a lack of oleophobic coating makes this a weird department to cut costs. They still included a standard clear plastic case but this was a bummer. Off to a bumpy start! Design Perfect! Whatever honor is doing, they should keep it up. The design has progressed over time and while Honor 6x was gorgeous, I liked the longer body and curved corners on this one. And that blue shade is something you find on an 800+ phone. Some may not like the two camera bumps on the back but to me the phone is much more than you can ask for in this price range. Just look at it next to G5 plus and you will see the difference! Processor, RAM and performance Honor 5x had the more widely known Snapdragon 617, while Honor 6x had Kirin 655. Honor 7x is using the next in line Kirin 659. Performance continues to be adequate for everyday use. You will not notice a significant difference coming from Honor 6x, but my last device before this was Mate 9 and the difference is noticeable. Compared to how Honor 6x felt when it was first released, 7x feels slower. I feel that the 659 is more shifted towards saving battery life. It is not for power users, but should be fine for everyone else! Despite having more RAM, it does not seem to be able to handle more apps at the same time in the background compared to 6x. Overall it does not feel like an upgrade over the 6x. Screen Screen is adequate as well, but it also does not feel like an upgrade over the 6x. colors are less saturated, and apps do not yet take advantage of the extra length. Auto brightness seems to struggle more than that of 6x. Touch control also is not as accurate as 6x. Occasionally the touchscreen did not respond to my down swipe and I had to try a few times to get the settings bar down. It can get frustrating at times. Camera a Major update over 6x. Honor seems to have mastered the budget two camera settings and this combination is really working for me. Pictures are on bar with any above average phone camera. They are not pixel or note 8 quality but they are much better than 6x. Software EMUI 5 is still the same. Performance is good in general with a few annoying quirks. It was disappointing to have it with Android 7 but Honor did follow through on their promises when it comes to updates in the past so let’s hope Android 8 is not delayed for much longer. Meanwhile EMUI 5.1 is still very acceptable, much lighter than most other skin but far away from pure android. Battery The main reason I spent 2 out of the last 3 years with an Honor device as my main driver is the battery. Like I said in my 6x review, it will not last 2 days, 3 days or longer. You will not get 10 hours of screen on time. But again, that is not what I am looking for in a phone. I am looking for a phone that can give me few hours (3-5 at least of screen on time) to check my emails and browse internet, may be the occasional game or two, and not drain itself to death when I am not using it. I do not get good reception in my work area where I spend several hours a day and this seems to suck the life out of every battery I tried, so my phone would go from 100 in the morning to 40 or so while not being used but rarely. Not any more with Honor 5x, 6x and now 7x. I am still able to go home with 50 – 60% + with moderate usage and 2-3 hours screen on time. Again, It lacks true quick charging but it charged to 100% in about two hours (Same for 6x). Bravo honor! Miscellaneous Fingerprint scanner is still exceptional. It is by far the fastest I have ever used and rarely fails. It is fully compatible with T mobile and AT and T just like 6x and LTE is still excellent: I get around 10-15 mg download speed in a major metro area on both T mobile and ATT It does have double sim, the second sim doubles as an SD card slot in both Still using USB 2 for a charger. To me this is a plus. I have 10+ USB 2 chargers around my house and do not intend to buy another 10 chargers unless I have to. Verdict This is an excellent phone but it does not feel like an overall update over 6x. 6x seems to be performing a touch better, “usable” screen area is essentially the same, battery seems to be the same, fingerprint scanners and software is the same. 7x on the other hand looks better and has a far better camera. They are both going for $200 on amazon so you will not go wrong with either. Personally, I cannot imagine why would I pay $600-800 in a phone. You are definitely not getting 3-4 times the value with those phones. For everyday use, you cannot ask for better.
reviews.review_header: Good phone but not an update over 6X, one fatal flaw, bad customer support

reviews.review_text: No long and terrible review like most of the dorks here. Here's the low down: - Pretty screen - Terrible wifi speed when Bluetooth is on - The blue is sexy - Fingerprint scanner FTW!!! BOOM!!!

Overall for the price, a great experience. The battery life is generous, the camera is completely fine in the daytime, and the daily experience is good. It runs all my social media, email, and work apps just fine. The screen is perfectly fine. I'd say that the phone is aggressive in how much it dims the screen at times. If you manually turn up the brightness, it is completely visible in direct sunlight. I would say to any prospective buyers, do some things to help yourself. The stock launcher has a setting to close apps as you lock the phone. Adjust ones you frequently use to stay open. I found that making them reload from the disk vs RAM makes a big difference with commonly used apps. Make sure to use a sd card and set it as the default storage location. For the first week it seemed extremely choppy. Now it's fine. I want to have to buy a flagship out of habit but honestly... I just don't need more phone than this for what I do.
reviews.review_header: Great phone. Adjust some minor settigngs for a big difference.

reviews.review_text: Great phone I waiting a month to get it on Amazon and it is worth a lot more then 199. I needed a new phone as since updating my iPhone 6s Plus that phone is resetting and really slow . I am not spending $900 on a new Apple 8 or Samsung. I am very happy with this phone . There is the news that huawaei phones may be spying on you that came out yesterday. Well I got news for you the NSA spies on you with the iPhone and all android phones . Verizon was going to carry this phone but was pressured not to at the last minute. I researched this phone for 6 months before buying it. My recommendation get it

Wow, I bought this phone for my wife initially but it was taking longer than I wanted to wait so bought the Le Pro 3 too, it came quicker. Well I thought I was going to return this phone because I and my wife fell for the Le Pro 3 so hard, but once I played with this phone, it was over. it doesn't have as much of the little tweaks as the Le Pro 3 but it is rock solid, actually Rockstar solid. The camera is slightly better than the Pro 3, and the feel is also a little better. The UI reminds me of Nova Launcher, it is quick, has enough geek tweaks to keep me occupied for a while. I like this phone so much that I parked my Galaxy S7. The one big deal so far for me has been the slow motion movie, it is subpar, it seems to drop a couple of f stops (depending on how you view f stops) the images got super dark when I chose slow motion and the software did not recognize the beginning set point. I will reconsider if i want to take a star away for that, i will see if there is an App to address that issue ( another reason I love androids, there is generally an alternative to solve a problem). I will update after using this while out with friends and family, but there is no way I am parting with this phone even with it's slight shortcoming.
reviews.review_header: The camera is slightly better than the Pro 3

reviews.review_text: I needed the "best bang for the $" and after about a month of heavy online research and reviews I decided on this 7x... I LOVE IT! I do not require or want the new flagship device as I just do not use a phone enough to justify $1K on a phone but I wanted a good looking phone. I am happy to repot this phone looks like a very expensive phone! The huge 18:9 screen just shouts expensive! I needed a good camera, I needed a minimum of 32 gb and a minimum 3 gb ram so this 7x delivers. On my 1st day of using my phone "more than normal" as its new, I am at 57% at the end of the evening so looks like the battery life will be great for my normal use and will give me much more than a full day. UPDATE: I have now had the phone a few weeks and with my light to average use ( I do not live on my phone) I noticed I was on day 3, 8 hours and still had a little battery left! So I know with how I use my phone, I will never be searching for a charger! I am on t-mobil and happy to report the phone works well ( my other phones did not as I am in a bad t-mobil location) The voice over 4G does work and the voice quality is MUCH better than any phone I have used. T-Mobil WiFi calling does not work with this phone. I have been using T-Mobil purchased phones with T-Mobil versions of Android and or iPhones but T-Mobil WIFI calling only works on iPhones and T-Mobil devices. After searching T-mobil does have a App ( T-Mobil DIGITS) That allows calling / texting via a internet connection so I expect the WIFI calling will be a non-issue for me. I did use WIFI calling the few times I vacation in the mountains with no cell signal but now that I have a Digits app I'm okay. This phone wifi will only do 2.4 ghz, not 5.0 ghz but I have improved my home wifi with a mesh system and I find most hotspots around town use the 2.4. My phone is very fast however when I do a wifi speed test I do not get the speed I do with a 5.0 ghz phone but the 7X phone is actually a faster phone? I would like to see dual band WIFI and I considered another brand because of only 2.4 but the other brand at this price point did not have this beautiful screen size so I am very happy I purchased this phone. When purchasing this phone I also wanted a case and a glass screen protector, These Amazon products fit PERFECT and love them as much as the phone! Huawei Honor 7X case, Yuanling [Shock Resistant] Carbon Fiber Soft TPU Brushed Texture Phone case Anti-fingerprint Flexible Full-body Protective Cover For Huawei Honor 7X smartphone (Blue) This glass protector fits PERFECT with no bubbles and went on EZ, Best glass protector I have ever used so if you are buying the 7x, this is the one to buy! [2 Pack]Huawei Honor 7X Screen Protector,Setber [Full Coverage][2.5D Arc Edges][9 Hardness][Anti-Scratch][Anti-fingerprint][HD Clear]Tempered Glass Screen Protector for Huawei Honor 7X -Blue At this price point , My thoughts are with this grade of camera, battery life, edge to edge 18:9 screen ( makes phones with normal screens look ancient ) and the fact that it is reported the 7X will get the newest Android 8.0 Oreo, this phone is simply the phone to buy!
reviews.review_header: I LOVE IT! Best bang for the $ I could find!

reviews.review_text: I've had this phone for a week now and love it so far. The phone feels very solid and has a beautiful display. The fingerprint sensor on the back has worked flawlessly and it is so nice to be able to turn a phone on with just a finger touch on the back. It is blazing fast and has performed flawlessly. My son who purchased the Note 8 said he would have purchased this phone had it seen it before buying the Note. This is an exceptional phone for the money. UPDATE: After using this phone for a couple of months I still feel this is by far the best phone for the price. I've noted that it periodically needs to be rebooted. I've also had some issues with the camera responding very slowly. I checked last night and I was low on storage which may have been causing the problem with the camera. I deleted some files and apps and I will see if that fixes the camera slowness. I put a simple Spigen case on the phone and have since dropped it twice. It has sustained no damage whatsoever. It easily has enough charge for the day. I use it with a Samsung watch and so it advises me that the Samsung app is consuming a lot of power, but I have never run out. I did notice some hesitation at times when using the browser or apps. After researching the issue I found that the phone only has one antennae for both wireless and bluetooth. I turn off bluetooth when I'm not using it and that alleviates the problem. One antennae is the price of a higher end phone at a low price. Everybody I have showed the phone to has been impressed with its solid feel and nice screen. I was disappointed to see a big box store drop the Huawei line. I believe it is under pressure from other phone makers that want to keep the price elevated. Again, if you want a really good phone at an affordable price - this is the phone for you.

Swapped nano SIM chip from my Windows phone and inserted a new MicroSD chip before turning on and it a booted up just fine. Going from tiles to icons required a little learning curve but that too went smoothly. Loaded Outlook containing all my Contacts and Calendars. Down loaded numerous Apps from Google Play. Downloaded Alexa App and serveral IOT Apps with no usage problems at all. I use both Google and Bing as well as the Edge browser and the One Drive cloud if desired. Finger print scanner is fast but a dual security of a Pin number can be used too. When turning on the phone you have a choice to finger print scanner or tap the screen and input a Pin number. All in all, this phone is a great value. It did come with a clear flexible case in addition.

I ordered this phone direct from Huawei out of their Texas headquarters. Tried to order here @ Amazon but it’s been sold out. To be honest the phone feels like a real true premium build quality. The interface runs smooth and have no issues so far. I bought my wife the Honor 6x for Christmas and was really surprised by the look and feel and it’s performance. So I waited for the Honor 7 to be released and so I got one. To be honest these are great quality phones. I use to be in a jump program with Tmobile where I traded in my device up 2 times a year, but I paid $150 a month for 2 phones lines and the ability to do this. I’ve had all the Samsung Notes, and one I phone 7 plus (I hated). So I know what a quality of phone experience is. Since Tmobile made made it’s jump customers start paying $150-$250 down to upgrade I jumped ship and went to Metro PCS and bought my phones outright. I originally bought a Moto G5 Plus w/ Amazon bloatware which ran fine, and no issues. I wanted a premium feel phone. I believe I got that in this Honor 7x. Don’t worry about the Government and the public ridicule of Huawei. They’ve been here for a long time in the US, also selling phones around the globe )3rd largest phone manufacture in the world). I phones and Galaxy phones are also built in China. As long as it’s a quality build I have no problem buying it. I rather pay $200 than $800-$1100. I’m looking forward to next year’s Honor 8x. Hopefully they’ll have 5ghz wifi in an update or in next years model.

Purchased this phone as a replacement for a One Plus Two phone that took an unfortunate water bath. I was looking for a phone that would do everything well for someone who does not game heavily on the phone and does not really require a high end chip set. The build quality of the phone is excellent with a beautiful screen and well laid out buttons and fingerprint sensor. The phone looks like a $800 phone. The performance of the phone is fine with no issues after two weeks of use. There is no lag when switching screens and the camera works quickly producing very nice images. Not sure I am in love with the 18:9 screen ratio. The screen seems slightly narrow for typing but it does help The bottom line is that is this phone represents the best value in the smartphone market today and it rivals the performance of phones costing $400. You are certainly giving up performance and speed when comparing it to more expensive phones. You could buy 4 of these phones or 1 Apple or Samsung phone. And those phones are NOT four times better than this phone. The raw processing speed maybe that much better...but not the rest of the phone. If your looking for a good smartphone that looks great....this is it. And your not going to be crushed if something happens to it.
reviews.review_header: The build quality of the phone is excellent with a beautiful screen and well laid out buttons ...

reviews.review_text: My previous phone was a Moto X, and I literally despised everything about it, and started researching for the best phone under $250. The honor 7 had the best specs and very favorable reviews. I've now had it for almost 3 months and I absolutely love everything about it. Fast and easy to use, and incredible battery life! I use it constantly, often browsing or playing a game while listening to audiobooks or music, and I have to remind myself to go ahead and charge it every few days, even though it rarely gets below 50%. I've also dropped it dozens of times without any issue. Calls are crystal clear. External speaker is great, I had actually bought an Anker Bluetooth speaker, but returned it, because (at least for audiobooks) I preferred the phone speaker. Love the large screen too. Overall a great phone, and nothing comes close to it in terms of value for the money.

Love this phone I got it back in December from Huawei official site, I have not had any issues with it and loving the battery life!!! I had the HTC M9 before this and I can say this is a way better phone and Oreo update will come out soon. All in all a great phone for the price. Im using Textra sms app and Gboard for keyboard.

We had an Honor 5x we grew tired of. I still went for the 6x and that pleased me enough to have my wife get a 7x when the Moto G5 sucked software wise. Man I'm jealous. Nice screen quality, lag not noticed as per the wife. Screen size is what WE like, we are both around 6 feet tall and have zero problems with the 6" screens though this is just under that. We'd actually like a bigger screen but can't be so picky at this beautiful price. I have concerns that Huawei is not loved by our government but... that concern is pretty vague considering so much of our stuff is made in China anyway. And I can't afford to be buying a LG or Samsung and still love myself. I have a Samsung tablet so what am I saying... Hah! Love it. If they added some more color variations such as silver or rose gold they might look even more pimp and sell out all day every day. Maybe.
reviews.review_header: Price, screen size and quality, speed are legit
reviews.review_author: J. E. Rivera Honor Device USA

reviews.review_text: I purchased my phone directly from the HiHonor website and I have no regrets!!! This phone does everything and more that I need a phone to do. I have had a Samsung Galaxy and the Moto Pure X and they both had issues. I am on my phone everyday for my business and I had lagging issues with other phones. I have everything installed and a few additional Apps, I have Instagram, Twitter, Facebook, Fitbit, Banking apps, Amazon, Ebay and the list goes on and on. NOT one moment of lagging!!! That is a massive improvement!!! I would not hesitate to get this phone. If you want a phone that looks and feels like a high end phone without breaking the bank, this is the phone for you. As far as the no NFC or Quick Charge. That was not a huge deal breaker for me. I never use NFC and this battery with heavy usage keeps up. It charges fast enough for me, honestly if I charge it at about 30% it only takes 30 mins. That is pretty fast. Really the only thing that may be a deal breaker is that it is not very loud if you have hearing problems. One speaker at the bottom. Again not a deal breaker for me. I usually use a Bluetooth speaker and actually prefer that. It is loud enough for me when I receive calls. I honestly would recommend this phone to anyone. It works great on Cricket, My carrier. Do not wait to get this phone. Save your money and get this awesome phone!!!

Love it! I purchased the red directly from Honor's website. The good- Looks great, operates smooth and lag free, you can uninstall any of the small amount of bloatware there is, (leaving just over 2 gb free of ram) the battery is great, (I can go almost 2 days) screen is great, phone has great reception on At&t, WiFi reception is great although you only get 2.4 GHz, camera is good in most situations and the camera app has all sorts of goodies, it comes with a clear tpu case, and finally the audio output via Bluetooth it very loud and the sound is quality. The bad- if you are coming from a flagship device from 2016 or 2017 the camera could be better (but for 200 dollars it's very good). Also, the lack of 5ghz WiFi is a let down. All in all for 200 dollars it is fully capable of replacing a flagship phone, you couldn't want for much else.

Very disapointed with this phone. I did buy two phones and both have the same "freeze" problems two or three times daily. I had the Huawei Mate 8 and then the Mate 9 and they are excellent phones but no this one. My mistake changing the Oneplus 5T for this crap.

Unfortunately, i'm going to have to return this phone. I wanted to love it, everything about it seemed perfect. Large display, great battery, nearly vanilla android, dual camera, dual sim, speedy processor for the price. It seemed like a dream come true! Except, for one extremely important thing: This phone does not have 5G Wifi. I will admit, i honestly did not even look at this spec when i was researching the phone, but it virtually cripples the phone. I live in an apartment building in downtown Austin, the phone is completely unusable when on Wifi. 2G Wifi works fine if there is not a lot of wifi signals around you, but in an urban setting with routers everywhere, it is so slow i can't even load google without waiting for a minute. Email doesn't work, pages don't load, app store is unusable....just forget about it. As soon as i turn Wifi off it springs to life, but unfortunately without the wifi i can't install updates, or install many apps, or do anything useful really without crippling my data plan. Huawei, i wanted to be a believer and i really thought i had found a great phone, but i guess you get what you pay for. Cheers.
reviews.review_header: No 5G Wifi, makes it unusable in a congested area

reviews.review_text: I must say this is a excellent budget phone. We picked 1 up from honor in Dec. Received Dec 20th. I use a galaxy s7 wife uses the honor. But I used the honor 7x for a few days prior to giving it to her. The battery lasted my normal all day use with plenty left over. Possibly 1.5 days. While I charge my galaxy s7 2-3x a day. Only cons for me is no wireless charging. And mine had a small scratch on the back when I received. Cons for others No usb c No fast charging No nfc The performance of the phone is very good. The camera works great. I'm looking @ getting myself a honor 7x or better. Then giving the s7 to our 2.5yr old. Also I rated 4 stars mainly due to the scratch. Now need to find a good screen protector and case.

This is an update to my original review. It's middle of March and I'm still in love with this phone. My latest project is using it as an alternative to an Oculus Rift. The phone's gyro got turned on in February in an update and that got me to thinking, "could I do VR with a $200 phone?". I play Elite Dangerous and while the game is definitely a processor hog it's not too bad on my oldish PC with a fairly old graphics card. So could I attach a VR rig to this and have it work ok? I'm not going to spring for an Oculus just to find out, but maybe the 7X could help me. So I downloaded Kinoni VR which streams video from the PC and the KinoVR app for Android and that gave me the video connection between my PC and the phone. I downloaded FaceTrackNoIR to take the gyro data from Kinoni and put it in a form that Steam/ED understands and then turn on side by side VR in the ED graphics driver and holy crap it works. Top tip, turn off Bluetooth while you're doing this because the 7x doesn't have 5GHz but with BT off 2.4GHZ works fine. I ordered an ETVR head mount from Amazon for $39 because it's good quality and it has integrated headphones and the net result is that I have a pretty good wireless VR rig that I can play my favourite game on. When I'm finished I slip the 7x out of the headset, turn on BT for my watch and the 7x reverts to being my daily driver. All for $200. Now explain to me again why I need the IPhone 10? Jan 2018. This is a wonderful phone. It's my second Huawei device (GX8) and I really appreciate everything about this phone. Basically you can boil down every review into; It runs and feels like a flagship phone except the 3D gaming performance is a bit average. That's it. If you don't play high end 3D games on your phone (Why would you, that's what a PC is for.) Then the Huawei Honor 7X is all the phone you will want. Especially if you slap in a 64GB SD card. BTW I really like the EMUI enhancements. It's kinda like Android plus. Mines black with a black Niilkin slim case, very cool and stealthy. For $200 it's absolutely ridiculous. Watch the reviews, they struggle to find bad things to say. This phone is an embarrassment to Samsung and Apple.
reviews.review_header: Looks and feel like a flagship. Costs $200. *Updated* Now with added VR!

reviews.review_text: Great phone at a great price! I have been using this phone for over a month now and it is a fantastic phone for the price, it is a Rock solid phone in terms of performance, wifi is not the fastest, but adequate, the screen is the best feature, it is big and bright. The phone does slow down a bit with a lot of apps running, but the phone is solid. Battery life is great, phone lasts all day with typical usage. Phone is supposed to receive Oreo update soon, but this is great phone with or without Android 8.0
reviews.review_header: Great phone at a great price

reviews.review_text: Husband, logged into wife's account. I purchased this unlocked Huawei last week to replaced my LG. I've had an iPhone and Samsung in the past and all smartphones have their up's & downs. This being my first Huawei I was a little skeptical however the reviews provided me some encouragement. I really like the design and although not as wide as my LG, it still fit in my leather phone case, which is a personal "perk' for me. Setup was a cinch. The device instructions are EASY to understand. It took a while since I had a ton of information to move over (12g) but when the process was all done, the two phones practically mirrored one another. All my contacts, photos, etc were there. Fast! Did I mention fast?! A big difference from my LG, which I have no complaints over other than when the memory capped, it was DONE. The Huawei is the most programmable phone I've had. You can set your preference on just about anything. My one negative on this and it may be operator error, is I can't seem to figure out how to set an individual text-tone. Ringtones, yes, but texting.....? The Huawei has an "easy eye" feature that blocks out the blue light for easy reading. Wonderful addition! So much so that my wife, having a history of Migraines, purchased her own Huawei and it's on the way. This feature and the matte screen protector, I purchased, reduces the glare considerably. Another added feature I like is the dual sim. With this option I will be able to purchase a prepaid SIM card for when we travel outside of the U.S. on our vacations. No more adding the international plan or buying a cheap burn-phone when I get off the plane. This phone has a dual camera function and, for me, it takes great pics. I'm not a photographer so as long as what I snap is clear, I'm good. Overall, I am very happy with my purchase and would recommend the Honor 7 to anyone.
reviews.review_header: Great phone for the money! You can't go wrong giving this gem a try!!!

reviews.review_text: Good Phone I have no complaints....oh yes just one wish it had a 5 gig wifi....but other than that I love it it's light weight...and the camera is decent...good job Huawei...oh and I got mine from Huawei they give you 2 extra cases with it

The phone itself is overall well made despite it's known flaws of lack of NFC, and 5g wifi support. The real problem is with the Bluetooth and wifi being run simultaneously. As other reviews have noted this problem seems to be affecting all devices running the current os. Essentially with playing a podcast or Pandora thru your Bluetooth speakers and run a speedtest while on wifi, my network speed went down from 50mbps to 0.01. Pausing the music mid-song shoots the number back up again and vise versa. I highly recommend people wait to purchase this phone until something as obvious as antenna power management is properly addressed. I really wanted to love this phone but unless there is a fix and soon, it will be on the return shipment next week.
reviews.review_header: DO NOT BUY UNTIL HUAWEI FIXES BLUETOOTH+WIFI ISSUES

reviews.review_text: Best 18:9 display in the market in the sub $200. Specs, design and performance at this price is second to none. Period. You can surely compare it to flagship devices and you might find that does not have the same performance that a $800-$1200 phone has. However, some of it's features are fairly close. If you want a right price, capable-ready, and fully functional phone, this should be in your top choices.
Phone keep powering off during the day. Can’t find out what the reason is.

After years of running mainstream phones (iphone, Samsung, HTC, LG), I believe I can say "never again". I've only been using the 7X for a couple of weeks, but it's my new favorite. Apparently I'm not alone because my phone was back-ordered for a week or two. So far, it's been worth the wait. The phone looks and feels like a much more expensive phone. I don't do a lot of gaming, but everything I've done has worked well. If you are coming from a phone that uses a micro-SIM, you'll need to get a new SIM from your network vendor as this phone only takes a nano-Sim, but that was my only (brief) hangup. UPDATE(3/18/18): I'm still a fan of the phone, but one characteristic that could be troublesome for some buyers is the WiFi performance. First, it only supports 2.4Ghz wifi. This shouldn't be too big a deal, by itself. Secondly, the WiFi antenna is shared with the Bluetooth radio. This causes a significant decrease in WiFi performance when using Bluetooth. For instance, in my house, with Bluetooth turned off, I get speeds in the 22-25Mbps range (download). If I turn on the Bluetooth and connect my headset, that will drop to around 15-18Mbps. If I start my podcast player, so I'm actually listening to content via Bluetooth, it drops further, to the 3-7Mbps range. Since most of my content consumption is pre-downloaded content (podcasts, mostly), this doesn't affect me much, and I had not noticed until someone else with the phone (actually a nearly identical Mate SE) mentioned it, and I did my own testing.

This phone is “okay” for $200. I had the iPhone 6s before buying this phone and im extremely happy with the battery life of this 7x. Yeah sometimes it lags and its buggy to the point that you get irritated but aye... $200!.... my main complaint is that for whatever reason the headphone jack is JACKED UP! I plug in my headphones and NOTHING. Music still comes out of phones speakers and not the headset... and for a music addict like myself, this is a NOO NOOOO! This is a “brand new” device right? No excuses
1. Terrible at switching WiFi connection. 2. WiFi connection drop frequently. 3. Poor network connection in Room. 4. Expected better picture quality from 16MP+ 2MP dual camera.

It is a great product for the price with a major flaw. When you are simultaneously using Bluetooth and Wifi, the wifi speed is crippled (~1Mbps) - which makes watching any streaming service almost impossible above 144p (Again If you turn off bluetooth the wifi speed jumps back to 20Mbps on the same router). Surprisingly it is not a problem when using LTE + bluetooth, where speeds are great over Tmobile (no VoLTE? - it was automatic on Nokia 6). Some people mentioned slowdown but more towards 10Mbps range on wifi + bluetooth (i would have been totally happy with that). I tested it on a google wifi router. Otherwise the phone is fantastic. Great ergonomics, reasonably fast, good battery life, great screen with color temperature adjustments (although like my vizio tv in very dark scenes it has this gray banding - but it is 200$). The build quality is close to iphone 7. The dual sim feature (unlike in the nokia 6) is useless here in the US as it is not simultaneous 3G/4G (there is no 2G service for calls here any way). The camera is definitely better than the nokia 6 and other 200$ android phones. No NFC, No Fast Charging and micro USB (Again all forgivable for 200$), If not for that single flaw it would be a 5 star easily. If bluetooth + wifi is not important for you, i dont think there is a phone under 400$ that can match it. PS: I had to RMA the phone as i was close to the 15 day return window. looks like the issue is again spotty from the comments below. https://forums.androidcentral.com/honor-7x/857396-extremely-slow-wi-fi-usa-model-7x.html There are few more threads. So check if you have issues.
reviews.review_header: Bluetooth + Wifi simultaneous use issue -- Otherwise superb

reviews.review_text: I was extremely disappointed as soon as I gave it to my daughter it fell and the screen cracked so bad I couldn't believe it. When I checked to see how much it cost to get fixed it was almost as much as the phone.

I've had this phone for a few months. Ordered it off of the hihonor website because it was back-ordered here. Since my Nexus 5x had bootlooped I couldn't wait a week+ for it to get here. Here is my review: Performance 7/10 ------------------ Does 90% of what I need it to when I need it. I am by no means a power user, I have no social media apps on my phone and use it to mostly check the news, navigate, and make calls. Biggest gripes is the occasional hang up on apps, where it will not load data when I tell it to. For example, sometimes I'll click on a link and nothing will happen. It's not an app problem, but a problem with the phone. Phone gets really bogged down if you are trying to run multiple apps at once (ie phone navigation, listening to an audiobook over bluetooth, checking messages). As many others have mentioned the camera is VERY slow. I am not exaggerating when I say it takes 10-15 seconds for the app to fully fire up and allow you to take pictures. Don't expect to capture any kodak moments with this phone. Interface/OS 8/10 ------------ I didn't really like EMUI, so I downloaded the nova launcher. A lot more slick. After making that change early on, I'm still waiting on the EMUI 8 update which I have yet to get. However, I am not going to complain much for a phone that does what I need it to do. Price 10/10 -------- Probably best bang for your buck even after the complaints to performance. Will make calls when I need to and call quality is good. That should be most of the reason you need this phone. Uses google maps just fine and I have few problems running any single app. Not having a USB-C doesn't bother me, as most of my other devices are still the old USB standard. It's nice to be able to travel and use one type of cord for my PS4 controller, phone, and tablet again. I've never been caught in a bind because my phone takes 2 hours to fully charge instead of one. . . Final Thoughts: I am not feeding into the phone consumerism nonsense, where it is now the norm to spend $600-1000 on a phone every 2-3 years. I hope Huawei can stick to releasing quality phones for under $400 in the U.S. I plan on using them for as long as I can.

I rarely ever review, but I'm so disappointed with this phone. First off the FBI ,and CIA, have both issued warnings about using Huwaie phones. Secondly, this phone is so buggy!! I really wanted to like it , the display is great, the design is flawless, and camera is good when it works correctly. With all that said the problem lies within. The phone just doesn't work well at all. It's so slow while on the internet, it stalls out a lot, the charge is lackluster, taking pictures is a chore and can take up to 30 seconds to work correctly , and typing can drive a sane person into an asylum.I hope I purchased a defective phone, but given the warnings from the FBI I'm returning it , and never looking back.
reviews.review_header: but I'm so disappointed with this phone

reviews.review_text: Damn near perfect $200 phone. I had a few glitches to work out but they were primarily a function of me ignoring the instructions. The camera is a little weak - but good enough for almost every use I have. An excellent $200 phone..Absolute best $200 phone I have ever seen or used.

Pros: it actually works. It has good battery life. Cons: the fingerprint sensor isn't very good. It can only use 2GB of the 3GB ram. The touchscreen keyboard is sketchy, the swipe function is more miss than hit. The autocorrect is terrible. It drops wifi with no warning. The screen isn't optimised for apps, none work in full screen mode.

I bought this phone off eBay brand new for 254 because at the time the Honour store and Amazon were both out of stock of the phone. Everything works well except the Bluetooth, I had to download a third party app from the play store in order to connect to my Bluetooth speaker, it will not connect to any Bluetooth devices using the software it comes with and that really sucks. Also when you are paired the WiFi slows down significantly. Also the phone unlocks with the fingerprint sensor but can't be locked with it.

I don’t will be a put a large review this phone is good is fast but have 2 problems. 1 Bluetooth don’t connect with my sonata 2017 automatically every time I going to my car I need set up connection manually is very annoying. 2 screen is very good but smug with nothing all time I need clean for keep sharp. I work for celular store I have a bunch of smartphones like iPhone X xiaomi mi a1 pixel 2 and more . This phone is good I can use this for my daily driver but is the connection trough Bluetooth in the car is important for you look other phone. Just for be clear I bought the red edition from honor website I recommend buy th phone from amazon because the return process from honor USA is very slow. I am still waiting for the rma and label from more than 12 hours.

PRO's -Good resolution display -bright -light, thin -small bezels -fingerprint sensor is lightning fast -good camera -easy to use UI CON's -NEEDS MORE RAM! only has 3gb and it will slow down like crazy if you have more than a few windows open at one time (Huawai, if you read this review, this needs to by fixed like ASAP, at least offer a 4-8gb model, even if they are more pricey.) -not the best viewing angles -speaker isn't very good -difficult to hold in one hand (large) -I have issues setting the wallpaper, every few days it resets the lockscreen for a few hours and then fixes itself -can't get rid of google search bar on home screen SO... SHOULD YOU BUY IT? My answer would be that if you want to spend less that $300 on a phone then yes, buy it. It is a great phone even if it were priced much higher. In my eyes, it competes with the Iphone 6s (before they started slowing them down).
reviews.review_header: only has 3gb and it will slow down like crazy if you have more than a few windows ...

reviews.review_text: This is a nicely designed device. The screen is large and colors pop, the body is all metal, and the fingerprint sensor and camera are great. Unfortunately, after about a month of use, I can't recommend this. I don't use my device for gaming, just videos, email and social media. It has slowed down so horribly in the short time I've had it. Snapchat and Facebook regularly crash. Having more than an app or two open brings the speed to a crawl. This is the second phone I've purchased from Huawei, the first being the 5X, and neither have had great, or even good, performance. I'd try out the Moto G5S or something comparable. Overall, not worth the buy. Don't be fooled by the low price tag and fancy body.

I absolutely love this phone! I was skeptical about buying it at first, because I have never ordered a phone online before. & I never thought I'd start by buying one off this app. but I am so glad I made this purchase. the camera's are good, the shipping starts fast & mine was delivered right on time. the battery life is AMAZING. I wake up at 7am every day, go to work for 8 hours & when I leave work my battery is only on 92% most days, sometimes it's higher! and then I don't have to charge it until I go to bed. I absolutely would recommend this phone to anyone! very good quality and great looking phone great for people on a budget or for people who just don't like paying $700+ for a good phone.
reviews.review_header: i love it! great phone for a great price!

reviews.review_text: Love my 7X. All the bells and whistles of a flagship but without the cost. Big improvement over my Samsung Galaxy Note 3 that I had for 4 years. Looking forward to receiving the 8.0 update that is supposed to be coming soon as of January 25th. Should make the experience that much better once it's upgraded to Oreo.

If I could, I'd give this 3.5 stars. I do recommend this phone, though, so I rounded up. The big benefit to this phone is its cameras. Honor 7x has as good of cameras as I've seen in this price range. I've had a couple of $180 phones (ZTE Blade X Max and LG Stylo 3), and the camera quality between those cameras and Honor 7x is night and day. Pictures are brighter, clearer, and less likely to blur when there is movement. Camera quality is very important to me, which is why I love this phone so much. The operation is decent. With my previous midrange-price phones, getting texts to go through was sometimes hit or miss. I haven't missed any texts or calls, so I am VERY happy about that. As far as app operation goes... games can be a *bit* slow at times, but I've had zero issue with video or audio streaming. Battery life could be much better. It's slow to charge, thanks to the fact the charger is connected to micro USB instead of USB-c, and it drains more quickly than other cameras I've had in the same price range. Conclusion: You'll get your calls and texts perfectly, your pics will look great for the price you paid, but you're gonna want an external battery if you're out at about all day.
reviews.review_header: Great Cameras, Decent Operation, Meh Battery

reviews.review_text: Will update as I use it

Look people, if you have money to spend $800 (at least) for the latest phone then you don't need to look at this phone. $200 for a great smartphone is incredible, I pre-ordered this phone in January and have had it for a couple weeks. I only use 1 sim chip, I'm not a heavy gamer and I use most of my data on LTE so this phone is perfect. Playing Boom Beach for 2 hours a day and using apps throughout the day (email, music, text, etc) I use about half the battery life. I have preferred Google phones for years but the prices are ridiculous now. The phone's preloaded Apps look like iPhone's but are Android underneath. I'm not a fan of iPhones so this was annoying but you can load your Google messaging, and other Apps like I did. Having an iPhone 8 myself I think Apple users could transition to Android with this phone and save at least $300 (from the SE). Read the other reviews about WiFi 5 and returns as these don't affect me. If you get a lemon that's unfortunate as Apple is far superior in customer service than anyone out there, so that's the biggest risk.
reviews.review_header: $200 NEW Smartphone? Best deal out there

reviews.review_text: Big, beautiful screen. Fast processor. Good camera. High end looks and feels for $200. Really impressed!

I agree with everyone who has said this phone is a bargain at $200. I'm glad I bought it. Just reviewing to add some extra info for those who are considering it: I use Mint Sim, and it seems to work just as well as my old iPhone did on this carrier. Bluetooth use does indeed slow the wifi to nearly unusable speeds. (This has been my biggest disappointment.) Video color doesn't always seem true. People often look too orangey. The camera app sometimes takes a long time to load. Despite the drawbacks, I could shatter this phone tomorrow and not curse the heavens, because I didn't take out a second mortgage to buy it.
reviews.review_header: Definite bargain, but some significant issues

reviews.review_text: Pros : beautiful screen Cons : too slow: * the camera takes forever to be ready, look dumb everytime I want to take a pic * forget about using snapchat * random freeze for all major applications : facebook, instagram, after 2 months now I'm used to put my phone with the screen on after clicking on an app and picking it up later like this I am not waiting for it to be ready * I presume some China spyware is installed Should cost 50$

I had the phone for 3 weeks and I returned it. The design and the camera are good, the best is the battery but the phone crashes a lot if you use Bluetooth or the camera and it freezes with Spotify or games. I wouldn't recommend it.
reviews.review_header: It started good but it crashed

reviews.review_text: Watch the youtube reviews. It is a great phone for the money. I switched from an iPhone 7 and haven't looked back. I love it.
reviews.review_header: Ex apple fanboy. Best phone I've ever owned.

reviews.review_text: This phone is very nice looking and has a good camera, but the software is the low mark for me. Mine gets sluggish and does not perform as well as my other Moto G5 plus. Battery life is really good. I am waiting for when there Android 8.0 comes out for it, I was real disappointed it was running 7.0 not even 7.1.1 which gave it more features. Finger print reader works great and is in a good spot for me on the back, the Moto has it on the front. For $200.00 I don't think you can go wrong. P.S. If you have 5gz wifi it will not connect only 2.4gz. Update: Phone was very unresponsive, however I unchecked close power consuming apps and it is now working fine.
reviews.review_header: This phone is very nice looking and has a good camera

reviews.review_text: I'm annoyed by the simple fact that nowhere in the description did it say it required nano sim card and now I have to wait a week to potentially two weeks for the earliest one to come in that I could find. That and now I have to transfer everything from my old phone manually which is also annoying and hey how great is it to finally have a new phone that I can't use anytime soon because of poor marketing? I could have ordered the sim card along with everything else. I'll change the review if/when I get the nano sim card and it actually works.
reviews.review_header: Not enough info included in description

reviews.review_text: Short and sweet: looks and feels great, unlocks quickly. But this phone can hardly handle a few low-intensity apps running in the background. The navigation buttons feel unresponsive and often don't listen to your input. The camera takes a good few seconds to actually open up, and I'd you're stuck in the wrong orientation, flipping it around from selfie to front facing will take yet another few seconds. By that point, the opportunity is lost or your friends are fed up with you and your phone. Flipping between apps by double tapping the square is always a clunky, rugged transition, with animations skipping several frames. Switching between keyboard languages is also clunky and slow-to-load. Coming from an iPhone digital keyboard, the auto complete is a huge step back. Misspelling a word, having it auto complete to a correctly spelled word, but it's not quite the word you're looking for, so you backspace to tweak it a bit, only to have the word revert to the original misspelled word, is way more frustrating than I thought it could ever be. These all seem like minor annoyances. They are. But when they're all working in unison it makes for a very frustrating experience.
reviews.review_header: Short and sweet: looks and feels great

reviews.review_text: Best phone period
As expected geat phone for the price

Update/Edit: After the number of issues I've had with this phone I decided to do even more research on it, including checking benchmark scores. I wish I had done that first! This phone scores abysmally! Yes, it's a $200 phone and should not perform as well as a $500 phone... but keep in mind that you're taking a HUGE performance hit. (About 1/3 to 1/5 as fast as phones in the 400-500 dollar range.) If you have all the time in the world and don't care about performance of your phone or how long it takes to open apps, particularly the camera, then go ahead and waste your money on this. --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- First off, I bought this off of hihonor.com - the manufacturer's website for their phones - because the phone was back ordered on Amazon for like a month. Having said that... this phone is simply no good. I wouldn't say I had high expectations for the phone necessarily (it's $200 after all), but I definitely didn't expect my streaming app to constantly stop or hiccup, whether on WiFi or 4G. I also didn't expect to have to wait 30 seconds or more for the camera to be ready to use, nor did I expect it to be inoperable once it was on the screen (pressing the shutter doesn't always work... sometimes it takes a LONG time to respond, sometimes it doesn't respond). Then when it does finally work the quality of pictures is subpar. Sorry, let me correct that, in full blazing daylight the pictures look great. Good color and great detail. I can see the individual strands of fur on my dogs. However, if there's a single cloud in the sky the pictures are awful. Heaven forbid you try to take night or indoor shots. Another big issue is that the alarm app. doesn't work. I have no idea why... it just doesn't. I had to download a third party alarm app. to even use the alarm on the phone. I tested this multiple times and multiple ways (alarm vs. timer, overnight vs. a few minutes, etc.) and the alarm only sounds if, and only if, you manually turn the screen on while it should be going off. So, in other words, if you don't manually turn the screen on at 6AM when the alarm goes off, you'll never know it's going off. Yup! Fun stuff. Want to turn down your phone? TOO BAD! This only lets you turn down the call volume a little bit. The lowest volume is still eardrum blastingly loud. I'm quite certain the 30 minute call I just had damaged my hearing. (Yes, this sounds like I'm being a bit dramatic but I assure you it's still very loud. And to top that off my supervisor speaks loudly, which is why I SHOULD BE ABLE TO TURN DOWN THE VOLUME... but alas, the brilliant minds at Huawei apparently know what's better for my ears than me.) Sadly I threw away the box just a couple of days ago, so now I can no longer send it back. So, basically, I'm out $200 unless I can sell it and recoup some of my losses. DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY ON THIS PHONE. Seriously. Cough up a little bit more and get a better phone. This is a shame because the V10 looks like it might be a solid phone, but due to the issues with this I simply won't ever buy it.
reviews.review_header: Awful phone. Hard pass on it.

reviews.review_text: I got my and 4 of my boys on Huawei products ( two 7x and a 8) and all of them stopped functioning, including mine after the second month. screens stop functioning, unacceptable hard half minute stuttering, you name it. Not accceptable. find another product.
reviews.review_header: I got my and 4 of my boys on Huawei ...
reviews.review_author: Christophe R. Blot Honor Device USA

reviews.review_text: My almost 2yr old Moto g5 plus takes better pics, support fast charging and has better speaker sound. Unlike this phone. (I had paid 170$ for the Moto on sale 2yrs ago) But the 7x is a good phone as well. For 200$ it's a good price. The build quality is really nice. Opens apps fast. Nice screen. Update. Had it for 2 months now and the screen has a line going across it. Don't know if that is just my one but a little disappointed.
reviews.review_header: My almost 2yr old Moto g5 plus takes better pics, support fast charging and has better speaker ...

reviews.review_text: I ordered this phone from the Honor website and I honestly loved the phone. It has a slim clean design, though a bit large. The camera was nice. I really appreciated the small things that was considered like a pedometer that I did not need to set up. They include the status of not only the phone battery but also the status of the bluetooth headphones battery. These are just two of the conveniences that I did not expect but appreciated. In the end, I had to return the phone because the apps continued to freeze up giving me a wait or quit app alert. This happened a lot when trying to use the camera. Then the EMUI would crash. To summarize, The Honor 7 was nice when it worked, but it would stop so regularly, that I could not sustain it. I reset the phone to factory settings but it still did not work. No updates seemed to help.
reviews.review_author: francesco di sarro Honor Device USA

reviews.review_text: I bought this for my wife, she loves it. She says it is much faster than her old Moto G4. I still have my Moto G4, I will be upgrading to this as soon as I can.
I checked with the Huawei support and they confirmed that this phone will never support Wifi 5 Ghz. It's a big limitation for this kind of latest phone.
reviews.review_header: Not Satisfied as it doesn't support Wifi 5Ghz

reviews.review_text: Excellent in all respects - battery life, camera, high tech, great value. I have to laugh at the Amazon trolls who put this amazing phone down! Fake news. I bought the red VD release after loving the Honor 8. Apple and Samsung, there's a new kid in town and he is good.
reviews.review_header: Excellent in all respects - battery life

reviews.review_text: Incredible phone! This is coming from a diehard iphone user. It's very responsive, excellent reception comparing with others, and a great camera. When you consider the cost, this is absolutely a no brainer.
reviews.review_header: Can't find a better phone even paying significantly more.

reviews.review_text: Amazing phone smooth operating system and great camera why spend mode when you can get more for less
Absolute value for money..... The Honor 7X does not disappoint.
Excellent product, it serves super well and they give you a cell phone case

Mostly good budget phone, but there is one worst thing. I usually listen music via Bluetooth speaker. When connected to Bluetooth and Wifi together, WiFi speed gets really slow and the bluetooth function is operated abnormally. I think this is the internal defect. I searched Google and found out why. WiFi and Bluetooth use the same 2.4 GHz, so some other phones have a same problem. If this phone supports 5 Ghz, the problem will be solved, but it doesn't support.
Very happy with this phone.
The touch screen was not working properly. Had returned the item.

Great the graphics are suitable for most games what people Don’t understand is that they are giving this product 1 star because they expect this device to run like a Samsung Galaxy S8 and unfortunately your going to have to cough up $700-$1000 for a top notch phone it’s just the way it is it’s like using a sedan to haul a boat it’s not going to be very efficient if you use this to play causal games like temple run 2 clash of clans and Snapchat Facebook Instagram Twitter this is the phone for you if You expect some great quality cámara and speakers your out of luck on this phone stop being cheap and go get yourself a galaxy S8 or a Google pixel also this is a great international phone it’s compatible all GSM carriers around the world and it’s Dual Sim so it’s a plus all this for just $200 (again if you want some top notch phone stop being a broke hoe and get a S8 or a Pixel)
reviews.review_header: Best all around phone for it’s !!PRICE-POINT!!

reviews.review_text: I liked this phone but ended up returning it. Too many cons I couldn't get past even though I loved how the phone looked. - lagged/froze often. Esp when googling or using Facebook - camera delay. I'd often miss shots bc the camera would not launch quickly enough - text/ mms issue. The msgs would not download automatically for some reason I cannot figure out. Returned it and got a G5 plus which is corny but reliable.

First of all I bought this phone back in December directly from Honor's website. Pros: Large fairly beautiful screen, very fast fingerprint sensor and a decent camera. Good build quality body. Cons: The screen material feels like plastic not glass. The worst part of the phone is the EMUI skin they put over Android 7.1.1 is very laggy. I tried everything to get the phone to run smoothly, the software comes with a lot of tools to clear memory and it still didn't help. It seems that it's just EMUI that's buggy. For instance, Twitter was extremely annoying to use because as I scrolled it would randomly sense my scrolling as selecting and I would open a tweet, same occurred on YouTube where it would randomly select a video as I was scrolling. It happened when browsing the internet, basically anywhere. I tried changing the launcher but it did nothing to help the lag and random selecting.
reviews.review_header: Nice screen, terrible software and touch response makes it laggy.

reviews.review_text: This is a good phone. It has a great screen to body ratio of around 80% and has a fast and zippy performance for regular tasks. However, the speaker does not sound good at all. I had problems understanding what was being spoken. This was for both application sounds and callers. The dual SIM cannot be used in USA with ATT or TMobile as it supports only 2G networks. In USA AT&T dropped support for 2G networks in 2016. T-Mobile does not support 2G either. So you cannot get a signal on 2G SIM, which means no calls or data... Also Huawei customer support is a joke. I called several times to their Mexico center for a return as I purchased the phone directly from Huawei Honor store (with 15 days returns). The system did not even accept the option for providing negative feedback. It could have been much better if it had better speaker, dual SIM supported at least 3G and the customer service definitely needs a major uplift. There is no NFC support as well. At the minimum, the speaker needs to be way better. I went ahead with the LG V20 which is awesome and sells for around $220.
reviews.review_header: A good phone with bad speakers and dual SIM card is useless second SIM supports only 2G

reviews.review_text: Purchased mine directly from Honor website. Had it for 2 weeks and decided to go with the Xiaomi MI A1. Here's why: Both phones are great. Loved the screen size on the 7x over the A1 but that was about it. First off, the difference in cost was $37 dollars more for the A1. For that you get 4GB of Ram compared to 3 for the 7x - 64gb of storage on the A1 compared to 32 on the 7x. 32 just won't do it for me. Pure Stock Google UI on the A1 as opposed to EMUI on 7x which means timely OS updates. The A1 has already been updated to Oreo 8.0 while who knows when Honor is going to update the 7x. Dual camera on the A1 is better than the camera on the 7x also. For $30 more it was an easy choice for me to return the 7x (which that experience in itself was a nightmare), was an easy choice!
reviews.review_header: Ok but there's a better choice for the price range

reviews.review_text: on 2nd day we got the dreaded Headphone jack bug. Phone thinks there is a headset connected. they skimped out on quality around the headset area and it's causing massive probs all around. Its with the connections inside the phone, reset wont fix.
reviews.review_header: Headphone jacks have poor solder, can cause probs

reviews.review_text: I bought this phone directly. After receiving the phone it became very clear that one of the 2 SIM only supports 2G. The return process was long and frustrating. Finally sent it back and and moved on.
reviews.review_header: great idea but off it went!

reviews.review_text: This phone indeed looks like a nice option! But be aware, I'll describe my 2 hour experience with it: just got it last week, I live outside US and need to pay shipping and taxes to get it (My cost increase)... Once with me, I must admit the phone looks nice and stylish, the screen resolution and ratio are super, the camera is mediocre but it is a $200 unit, I did the basic setup and began using it, after some seconds of inactivity it will turn OFF the screen as most phones do and here is where my issues began, I was not able to turn the screen ON again, only a forced restart will do the job. I contacted Amazon for this issue and a technician helped me to do several factory resets and the phone did not fix the issue, we did both Soft Reset and attempted a Hard Reset (Phone never show the Recovery after several attempts, this is something unacceptable for an Android phone)... We were not able to fix it and my only option now is to sent it back to get a refund (I will need to pay shipping again). All this problem makes me believe that Honor/Huawei is not a brad to trust, how can a device get into the market without proper quality assurance to validate the screen and Recovery are working fine? My advice: look into another option and save your time and money.
reviews.review_header: Honor is not a quality brand, won't trust it never again. Save your money for something better

reviews.review_text: all of my apps freeze. email, camera, photos, DJI go, work app, blue iris, whatever i throw at it. i upgraded from a $40 POS motorola phone and this 7X POS makes the cheap unlocked prepaid look awesome. a reboot clears it temporarily. i optimized it with some easy steps and still no go. i had this phone for less than 2 weeks, purchased directly from hujway store and it looks every day it looks more like its a waste of money. OS and all apps are up-to-date. next stop is a dumpster. spend your money elsewhere.

I am writing this review from using this phone as my personal one for a week. I was really excited to try this phone out and maybe replace my iPhone se with it. Here’s how it went. The pros of the phone 1. The screen is huge, vibrant and beautiful. I am seriously impressed by it and the looks of the phones metal casing. 2. The finger print reader is amazingly fast and it so much better the iPhones by far. The placement of the scanner it perfect as well. Although, this phone doesn’t support android pay...how? 3. This is a half and half. The cameras are nice but it’s kinda funny how this has an 8 mp camera compared to the iPhone se’s 2mp. Yet, the iPhone camera quality looks way better than any that this can take. Annnnd that’s it for pros lol Cons: 1 Camera: as I stated, all the hype not allot of preformance takes forever to try to get to the app and you can’t access it from the lock screen. You’ll always miss the shot. 2. Battery life: this phone drains extremely fast it’ll be dead before the day is over and that’s only light use. Occasionally texting and a couple calls. 3. GUI: the user interface is an awful experience making you go to extreme lengths to do the simplest tasks. Very little shortcuts for cameras flashlights or screenshots. Basically all the things you need to do fast. 4. Maybe one of the worst things about this phone is the vibrating motor and notifications. This phone always fails to show you that you have a text or a call. No matter what you do it never shows anything in the lock screen. You have to constantly check every single one of your apps to see if you have a new message. Example: Snapchat there is no notification and no badge app icon. You have to check the app frequently to see if you got one. The vibrations motor, when it does go off, is the lightest feather-like vibration ever. You’ll never feel it. So if you want everyone to hate you because you never reply...this phone is a good option. 5. Processor: the processor is really underpowered for what they are trying to make this phone do. Maybe this is what is causing all the other problems like short battery life (proccecor being overworked by its normal use). From day one I had this phone freeze up at least twice a day. It’s very slow trying to run or send anything. 6. Speakers: the single down firing speaker is awful. The volume is very quiet for what you would expect from a phone this size. There is absolutely no bass and from an equalizer standpoint the sound it flat. 7. Micro USB port: seriously? Micro not even USB type C? Not only that it is designed incorrectly so when you plug in a charger to it the cord will just fall out with the force of gravity on the cord. (Very fun to wake up to a phone with 3%). Also, it doesn’t support fast charging. 8. Honor? Okay this phone and it’s software is basically an iPhone 7 ripoff. Literally everything. Even the settings menu is made to look identical. To think they named this phone “honor” with the absolute lack of it. 9. Hacking. Very angry about this and it was the point in which I sent it back immediately. When you take a photo it provides a location of where it’s taken. Well when I started taking photos. Every once in awhile my phone would show that my photo was taken in China. China? I was in the U.S. not China. So my photos are being sent to China and that’s the last of that phone. I’ll upload the screenshot of the proof of this.

Got this phone barely used secondhand after my friend switched to iPhone. It was alright until it completely froze up. I've loved android phones and have always been able to figure them out. When this one bricked through, the manufacturer would never respond. Useless. I tossed it

Oh Honor you were so close but fell just short of this being the budget smartphone King three things you left out 2 being must haves No USB type c in 2018 are you serious ( makes zero sense ) and with that exclusion leads into No Fast Charging it takes at minimum two and a half hours charge from 0 - 100 % and last no NFC other than these glaring flaws its a great device the 18:9 Display is very good and provides nice saturated colors,Fast fingerprint sensor, great metal build, decents camera though no 4k video or OIS or EIS. I will be returning my phone bought (bought on honor website) and will be buying the Moto G6 Plus which will be launching sometime in Febuary Pros.
reviews.review_header: Great if you can live without the 2 big flaws

reviews.review_text: Well, What these guys dont tell you is that the Wifi is 2.4 GHz only, that means, gaming or anything will only happen at the lowest data speed rates. I fail to understand why in today's date and age would they give a device to masses without the 5G bandwidth. Liked the device but returned it the same day I got it.
reviews.review_header: No 5 GHz band, what more is it missing...?

reviews.review_text: For $200 my expectations shouldn’t be high at all but this is just awful. 1) micro usb usb pathetic. It’s 2018 2) great size screen and aspect ratio but not responsive 3) the UI looks like an iPhone. This makes the UI look super cheap. 4) camera is decent but it’s no where near other budget devices like Motorola 5) it has 4GB of RAM but runs like it has 2. Super glitchy. Don’t waste your money. Spend the extra couple bucks and either a moto G5 plus, essential phone or one plus 5T
