The speed is amazing and light-years faster than the older model (Honor 5X) and the fingerprint scanner is excellent. A quick touch to the back of the phone and it's immediately unlocked. I love that! The camera works great and is very responsive. There is hardly any delay when taking pictures. The Honor 5X I had before this one lasted a long time. I had it well over a year at least and I had dropped it numerous times on hard floors and concrete without it ever breaking the screen. I expect this one will be just as durable. If you're looking for a phone with great features, durability, and a high quality feel, this is by far the the best phone for the price.

First impressions are really great. It's fast. Ample memory. Great battery. Nice camera. Got this phone for the kid, an upgrade from a much-beloved but no longer supported Amazon FirePhone (itself maligned for all the wrong reasons, a story for another day). The camera has many features popular with the younger crowd (think: filters, background swap, beautify mode, AR ears etc). Android 7, while older, really doesn't bother me, since the latest security updates are available for this phone. We actually like the EMUI interface. May get another one for myself because it blows my older Note 4 out of the water. If anything negative arises, I will update this review. For now... highly recommended. PS Worried about spyware claims from US intelligence services and random senators? How interesting that most of these came about once Huawei surpassed Apple in terms of units sold worldwide. Politicized protectionist nonsense, if you ask me. I am really glad that Amazon didn't cave to the misinformation campaigns, unlike BestBuy, AT&T et al. I'm not buying another overpriced $900+ Apple/Sammy.
reviews.review_header: Received today. Fast. Ample storage. Great battery. Ignore the spy talk.

reviews.review_text: I bought this phone because it has a legit specs under $250 price tag and it didn't disappoint indeed. The phone is impressive compare to samsung's pricy android phones. I've been a Samsung user for years and i would choose this phone over it. The reason I give this phone 4 stars out of 5 is, it doesn't support NFC, a tool for android pay which the latest Samsung phones have. Aside from that, I don't see any advantage the pricy Samsung Galaxy phones have over this great budget phone. Lastly, with regard about the spying allegations on it's makers, I think it's ridiculous! For sure the pricy competetors out there has a real reason to get nervous about how good this company from China make their phone with a budget price tag. Samsung's phone for example is 4x more expensive. Established company phone makers here in the US doesn't want this product getting noticed I think. Spying concerns? Come on! We all know they've been doing it for years already. It's about $ concerns in my opinion. Peace!

Yes, there is something missing or not as good, but, for this price tag and what it offers, it is an excellent phone. Highly recommended. It has everything you really need. No NFC (Near Field Communications): You cannot "Google Pay" wirelessly, period; No 5Ghz WiFi (You have to stay at crowded 2.4Ghz. It is fine. You really don't feel you miss anything); No replaceable battery; No wireless/fast charging; No water-proof; No high speed USB 3.0; No stereo speakers; No gyroscope (do you really need it?); No native WiFi Calling (if you are a T-Mobile customer, you can use "T-Mobile DIGITS" doing WiFi Calling); Camera is not as good at Low Light condition, and without Image Stabilizer (but it is not bad at all and the built-in Camera app has a lot functions.16+2M dual main at f2.2 and 8M front at f2.0); Use old micro-USB port without Type-C (which I like the "old" micro-USB that I can use all my chargers and power banks.); And, it has FM radio (yes, good) using 3.5 mm audio (I like the 3.5 mm) headset (not provided) as its antenna; Great 5.93 inch 18:9 display at 1080p x 2160p, 407 ppi (though it is not OLED, great display); Beautiful metal case with clear-color soft TPU protection case; 4GB RAM with 64GB storage (still not enough storage? you can insert in a micro-SD card up to 256GB); Dual-nano-SIM (2nd SIM only for 2G); Excellent finger print sensor with gesture controls; EMUI interface is actually pretty good. You can select between drawer or standard mode; not many "other" apps (if you don't use it, you can delete or disable it.)... and it is built by HUAWEI, a big brand in China and Europe.
reviews.review_header: Excellent cost/price value. It has everything you really need.

reviews.review_text: Even cell phone pros were impressed. I had my reservations, I have had quite a few smartphones over the years, and have only owned the Nexus 6p from Huawei. They had improved significantly from the 6p. Buttons have good feel, phone is snappy, software is decent. Camera quality is pretty good, but slightly overexposed in my short time with it. Bought for my mother in law, and there was no sense in getting a $1,000 phone that will mostly be used for calling. For what it is, I could genuinely see using this phone as a daily driver if I were short on cash. Obviously I prefer my Pixel 2 XL, but I can tell you this is one darn decent phone. Battery is above my expectations as well. Screen is bright, and big. Easier on older eyes with the Android software letter increase size. If you're looking for something "good enough", this phone is a hit. Politically, I don't care what Uncle Sam says about the espionage potential of Huawei. If you are worried about that, avoid smartphones in general. Could snag up a big roll o tin foil too....
reviews.review_header: Not easy to discern from phones twice or thrice as much!

reviews.review_text: Hi everyone, this is my first review EVER on Amazon but I figured it is worth the time. I recently purchased the Huawei Mate SE - first of all, it arrived earlier than expected so that was great. Once I received it, I noticed that the phone is just a tiny bit bigger than what I am usually used to but this is no biggy - you get used to it pretty fast. I ordered it in gold and I am loving it so far - the camera is very nice and takes great, crisp pictures. I honestly bought it because I wanted a phone with a larger memory, good camera and bokeh effect (lol). This is the first time I am purchasing a Huawei phone but the reviews on here and other websites really convinced me and so far, no regrets. I do have friends that own iPhones so I can say portrait mode isn't as perfect or fast as on iPhones but the pictures do turn out pretty nice once you get the hang of it. Let's bear in mind that this is a $220 phone vs a $900-$1,000 phone. Oh and BIG PLUS! The battery life really is AMAZING, it charges super fast, and not just because it is a brand new phone. The Huawei boasts its long-lasting battery charge in its latest phones, and I can definitely confirm :) I hope this helps you make your decision - If I had had more budget, I would have gone with the Huawei Mate 9 or 10 Pro (with Leica cam and so forth) but I am so pleased with my purchase so far.
reviews.review_header: it arrived earlier than expected so that was great. Once I received it

reviews.review_text: There is no other way to put it, this is an excellent device at excellent value. The only complaint I have is the confusion with how many devices there are from Huawei for different markets. I purchased 2 phones BEFORE this one. First a Nexus 6P (more for Google, but because Huawei built this phone I was more comfortable trying a pure Huawei phone afterwards) then an Honor 7X. This is where I had some trouble, because I purchased the international version, which was not made clear as to what networks it supports in the U.S, and many different websites have conflicting information based on whether you pull up the 3GB RAM model VS the 4GB RAM model. It's difficult to have confidence in your purchase when buying elsewhere, but buying the Mate SE from Amazon definitely gave me security and confidence in the choice I was making. As for the device. WOW... I knew I wanted to get it for the extra gig of ram and the Octa-core processor, but this phone continues to impress. I haven't had a single hick-up or issue with anything so far, if it weren't for the network issue I would have never gotten rid of the 4GB RAM 7X, the Mate SE makes you very happy that Huawei is working with American distributors because this is a very underrated device. Shipped and arrived next-day, effortless sync, Android experience is smooth, and I do like the skins though I haven't changed any themes myself. Camera is ultra-responsive, finger-print is incredibly accurate and unlocks quicker than half-a second, which is hard to comprehend for the price and something I noticed was also equally responsive on the 7X. Just overall incredibly impressed. Oh and there's a free case which ships with the phone as well, which is just an unexpected plus that makes you happy you chose to support this company. In all honesty, I feel like if OnePlus weren't trying to compete on upper-tier financial markets they would be cranking out phones like this no problem, but they're missing a chance to compete with yet another market that is making unparalleled devices for an unbelievable cost. For the first time my phone has as much RAM as my laptop and I didn't pay too much...

Excellent budget phone. Practically fulfilling the needs on latest aps, camera, battery, performance, storage, ram etc. Nothing more to expect for $200. Thanks Amazon for bringing this product as many other shops don't sell Huawei phones.
reviews.review_header: Large screen, light weight, good performance and long battery life

reviews.review_text: Best budget phone in my opinion. Got to try this for half a day when it was sent after cancelling my order.(waiting for the Huawei View). As with other reviewers, this is smooth as butter, fast, and just beautiful. I read issues about the wifi slowing down when using bluetooth , which I confirmed to be true, but not that bad compared to my Note 5 which slows down too when using both. If not for the upcoming release of the other Mate 10 Pro variant, I would have kept this one. If the "View" won't impress me, I might just reorder this one again.

I wish I had heard of this company before buying all these second hand Samung/Motorola phones through craigslist just to save money, when I can buy a comparable phone brand new for a price that is cheaper. This phone is just an improved version of the Honor 7X. My review is based off replacing a Samsung Note 4 and my work phone is a Galaxy S7. Battery: The battery life is superb on this. Seeing how my Note 4 had all this bloatware and these Samsung extras out of the box. The Note 4 couldn't even last through out the day with constant usage. This phone lasts through out the day, set it down without charging it for the night and it still has power. Battery life is about the same as the S7, though. Design: Doesn't feel like a cheap, cricket phone. Feels like it has some weight, some heft to it. I am also impressed by the fingerprint technology on the back of the handset. It is much better and responsive then what the Galaxy S7 has. I never had to 'retry' my fingerprint as if it didn't register it. Communications: Haven't noticed any difference in terms of call quality or signal. Yet, my carrier is AT&T. The only concern is that the phone doesn't support 5G Wi-Fi. Camera. Unless something was wrong with my Samsung Note 4, this camera is much better than the Note, but similar to what the S7 has, or maybe even less. Display: I can't tell if this is part of the android or part of Huawei, but there are animations in the display which are interesting. From where you can see the display brightness slider move automatically to where texts seem to 'bounce' when you scroll through them. There is little bloatware and I like the drawer design of the apps. Screen is also bigger than my Note 4. Also some people state the charging cable is different, yet my cord that charges my samsung phones can charge this phone. At the end of the day, this phone can do everything a $1,200 phone can do.
reviews.review_header: Don't Let the Fact That It isn't Backed By a Big-Name Carrier Deter You!

reviews.review_text: I'm not the techno phone geek many are but I demand a lot out of my mobile experience and this phone is more than up for it. It's fast, the battery seems to last forever -- haven't gone through a full charge in a day yet -- and my overall experience using it as a phone and a computer has been very good. The camera doesn't do well in low light, but the flash is adequate. Daylight pictures are exceptional. One feature I was meh about before purchasing was the finger print scanner and dang if it isn't the handiest thing ever. I've not had it fail and it gets me inside my phone fast. Flawless. I'm older and have some vision issues, so I appreciate the large screen. The phone was not loaded with bloatware and what few little apps I didn't want I was able to get rid of without a problem. I also have had no issue with any of my favorite apps working on this device. I take all kinds of kidding at the brand and the jokes about being spied on by the Chinese are fun. But honestly I find all's fair in the marketplace and in my estimation this phone is a real winner. I've used Samsung Note 4 and Note 5's, an iphone, and plenty of Blackberry's in my time and this phone tops them all. Seriously a great piece of equipment and an exceptional buy.
reviews.review_header: Top performance for a rock bottom price.

reviews.review_text: I was originally considering the Honor 7X, then I saw this device with twice the RAM and an extra GB of RAM. After a week of use this device has been amazing. The screen is beautiful and responsive, all the apps I want to use work well. I am by no means a mobile gamer, but I do frequently use audio apps (Ex: EDJing Pro) and they work very well on this device.
reviews.review_header: Feels good in the hand, looks great, and has an unbeatable price.

reviews.review_text: Huawei continues to deliver high features at a fraction of Samsung or Apple. I needed another phone as my honor 5x was over 3 years old. I was still impressed with what my old handset could provide but outdated Android Software. Which networks; Apparently no one can read the Amazon Description GSM: In Mu'rica T-Mobile or AT&T. I use Straight Talk AT&T no issues Pros: Metal Silver Case; looks sharp and included a outer protective sleave to protect the finish. Finger Print recognizer is faster than my Honor 5X Camera what an improvement. I'm taking less fuzzy pictures Uploaded Huawei Themes; now it emulates icons similar to Samsung or Apple. Cool feature and free Screen is beautiful and battery has lasted about as long as my old honor 5X throughout the day. Struggles: I had to reinstall the GMAIL app. Got hung up trying to sign in to multiple accounts. Bluetooth seems to struggle on initial setup with headphones. Still pairing with vehicles will update. No USB C. Slow charge like my older 5X Overall I am impressed. I purchase my phones outright because I do not finance a phone for two years. Seriously, is that Phone X worth $999 that is made next door to the Huawei Chinese Factory for a quarter of the price?
reviews.review_header: Works on a GSM Network; T-Mobile or At&T

reviews.review_text: This is a very good phone - fast, excellent software and hardware. Easy to transfer settings and contents from my old phone. Work with TMobile network after I moved my sim over from my old phone. This also comes with a very nice soft transparent protection cover - No need to buy one.
reviews.review_header: Also include a nice soft transparent protection cover

reviews.review_text: PRO: Very fast, much faster than Moto G5, no problem to play games. My first phone with Kirin CPU, not sure it is the CPU or large RAM made this phone faster than Moto G5. The fingerprint scan is accurate and fast. The camera is good, both front and rear, a little overexposed some time. Charging is fast, it takes about 90 minutes to get fully charged. EMUI has a lot of features, very easy to access flashlight, calculator... Install google launcher, "Google now/feed" works. (It does not work on Moto G5). The price is great, for $229, cannot get any phone better than this. CONS: WIFI is only 2.4GHz, it will be a trouble with a lot of neighbors. MicroUSB 2.0 but not Type-C? Huawei had too many spare parts? Many pre-installed apps? I'm assuming Huawei get paid to install those apps.

It has great spec, incredible value. The only thing I don’t like is the micro usb charger port. Huawei Honor 8 introduced in 2016 already has usb c charger port. Now the best part is the metal case. It is extremely light weight. IMHO, this is the one reason to get this phone. I own Huawei Honor 8 and it has a glass case. Most of the more expensive phones use either glass or crematic for the case. They are heavy and they break easily when you drop your phone accidentally. So you are paying more for expensive phones by having greater risks. Am I a fan of Huawei’s phones? Not yet. I own Huawei Honor 8 and its battery went bad in 11 months, So I will update the review of Mate SE a year from now. In addition, for USA, Huawei 7X and Huawei Mate SE are similar but Mate SE is better. US version Mate SE = International version of 7X US version of 7X. = Trimmed spec of the international version of 7X
reviews.review_header: One reason to get this phone....

reviews.review_text: An awesome cell phone!!!. I'm thinking that Apple & Samsung & LG are terrified of the Huawei company....and especially Apple. Doing everything they can to keep Huawei OUT of the mainstream USA marketplace. Millions of Chinese citizens are 'rockin out' w/ their Huawei phones and loving it!! This is the BEST cell phn I've ever owned. @ $250.....??? Are you kidding?? You will not regret buying this phone.
reviews.review_header: I know a 'thing or two'...because I've seen a thing or two' !

reviews.review_text: I've had this phone several weeks and I love it. My battery lasts in to the second day. I surf the internet quickly and effortlessly, the camera is better then adequate, the response time is lightning quick, gaming (though I don't do much) has no lag time, and as a phone and texter absolutely no complaints. Is it as good as a flagship phone? No. There is a reason they cost three and four times as much. The thing is I don't need whatever those reasons are. And that's what you should be asking yourself. Is it ego, or do I really need that flagship phone? Because if you don't then buy this one. It's a great performer, with a fabulous display and a build that should last a very long time.
reviews.review_header: Check your ego at the door.

reviews.review_text: I got say this phone far exceeds what I expected. If you're looking for a good priced phone this is it. They're some drawbacks no NFC but I can live with that. Its going to get oreo so im excited about that. camera is good, yes is not Samsung note 8, but it takes pretty good pictures. I am happy with it.
reviews.review_header: If you're looking for a good priced phone this is it

reviews.review_text: Had it for a day and so far I'm blown away! I have been buying Huawei phones for a long time and they never disappoint. For the price it's a no brainer. I will update

Just received this phone. Very big screen, easy set up. Pretty much like any other Android phone. It's very responsive and has not skipped a beat from my prior lg g5 phone which I sent back due to a warranty issue. I love the 64 GB storage as I'm tired of fighting my lg g5 for room on the phone. Also, the battery lasts forever. It takes decent pictures but I do need a little more time with the camera to write a complete review. Over all a very surprisingly decent product!

Not much to add as far as what others have already said about this phone. I too was coming off a 3 year old Galaxy S6 Edge which is now in its time to fail period. This phone blows it away in almost every aspect and the S6 was the premium flagship that outclassed the previous versions by quite a lot. Now budget phones are beating the former best phones on the market not that long ago, truly amazing. This modified Android I actually like better then stock, it's simple and intuitive. Internet, fingerprint reader, everything is just fast! Love that it still has a straight headphone jack! Don't you dare change that please! Camera is more then good enough but I'm not a picture fanatic so it might not work for those looking for real high end photos from a phone. The AMOLED screen of the old Galaxies are still better then this but not enough to not still make this phone overall better hardware/price wise. The only con I see is not directly related to the phone, and that is case availability. I used to love that Otterbox Defender with a built in screen protector available for previous Galaxy versions. Sadly Otterbox has mostly given up on that and making cases for any other manufacturers besides Apple and Samsung. I ordered a soft pouch for extra protection. I do like that this is a plus size phone, I will never go back to smaller. Buy this phone, you will not be disappointed.

Wow I am impressed. I have an iPhone 7 which is great no complaints but got bored of it. I wanted something different and I happened to see the Huawei phone and the price was reasonable. Im disappointed with the phone selection in the US. After looking online at phones across the pond , I realized there are more devices available that we never hear of in the US. Anyway, I gambled and received it today. I've been messing with it for a few hours and am impressed with the response no lag time. Fortuantely, I already have AT&T and slipped in the Sim from my iPhone 7, no problems with the LTE and it connected to my router with no problems either. I'm just glad that I didn't have to spend $700+ for a another phone. I'll be putting my iPhone on eBay!
reviews.review_header: Took a chance and I like it

reviews.review_text: Overall, very impressed with what was done with my 229.99. Some subtle lag after the initial launch. However, the security update seems to have mitigated this issue. Construction quality also superb, metal finish seemingly premium. Unlikely to find a better deal for a smartphone of this price at this point in time. Hopefully, Huawei continues their line of budget smartphones, unlike many other companies.

I was in the market for a mid-range phone, I typically don't invest in expensive flagship phones as being in the construction industry, the more expensive the phone, the faster it seems to break, I had a ZTE grand x4 for roughly the past year and a half, and while it did everything I needed it too, I was just wanting something a little more and a little newer with more storage, I was looking at the xiaomi mi a1, but it didn't appear I would get lte wit at&t, and was also looking at the Motorola g5, but seen a g6 was about to be released and didn't want to wait, so I saw this phone while looking at unlocked phones at Best buy, but they didn't have any in stock so I ordered it from Amazon, and it was 20.00 cheaper. So far it's a great phone, and my only complaint is no USB C and fast charge, something my 70.00 ZTE had. I ordered a magnetic charge cable that should arrive tomorrow and that will hopefully take care of my dislike for micro USB. Lol. But the phone feels quality, the camera is decent, and the screen is beautiful, and has some neat features. I would definitely purchase again.

I've had the phone for a little over the week, and it's just plain awesome. I am a techy, however, I didn't want to spend $700-1000 on the new flagship phones. This has exceeded my expectations by far: the processing is extremely fast, the fingerprint is flawless, the EMUI is neat, and the camera is awesome as well. My wife has an iPhone 7 ($750) from At&t and this Mate SE beats it spec wise except for a few things. In my comparing, the iPhone 7 has 4k video recording, and 1080p recording with the front facing camera. However, the front facing camera of this Mate SE has 720p recording which is still high quality. The Mate SE does not film in 4k, however, in my opinion, it makes up for this with the variable apperture. The screen for the Mate SE is very large and has a good brightness with auto-brightness adjustment sensitivity. It is very clear and responsive to your touch. Day to day tasks are a breeze, email, internet, YouTube, etc. You will enjoy your new phone, even if your coming from the top brands. P.s. this phone has a document explorer with a great UI. I know this will come in handy for downloading files and reopening them. Overall I rate 5 🌟. You just can't beat the quality for price.
reviews.review_header: Amazing phone, amazing price. What more could you ask for?

reviews.review_text: Fantastic little phone. Huawei has set a great standard for what a budget phone should be. Extremely high build quality with a clean UI. What else could you ask for? More than adequate performance and outstanding battery life. I have purchased three Huawei phones in the last 3 months (one for each of my two kids) for less than the cost of a high-end flagship. I'm a very discriminating shopper and I can confidently say that I'm extremely pleased with the value and performance of these phones. Well done.
reviews.review_header: Super high build quality and excellent performance, a mid-range that feels anything but.

reviews.review_text: First impression, this is a thin and light phone. Screen is bright, performance is fast, not much junk loaded from the factory image. The setup gives you a way to move data and apps from another Android phone to your new phone. Camera is good, phone has a fingerprint sensor. The OS image is not too far from a stock android version. The Sim is a nano site, and the tray for the Sim can hold either a second Sim or a micro SD card to expand the storage. This phone is both carrier unlocked, and comes with a US warranty. Few negatives, does not have a knock code capability. Screen icons look pretty crappy in landscape orientation. Battery is sealed in and not replaceable similar to some other phones.
reviews.review_header: Huawei Mate SE, nice phone with value for the price

reviews.review_text: I've only been using this phone for a week, but the first impression couldn't be better. Fast, reliable and, even though I'm not a photographer, I think that pictures are more than decent. Screen is big and bright, nice resolution. Totally worth it considering the price point.
reviews.review_header: Very good phone for the price and features offered

reviews.review_text: Oh my goodness I love this phone. Why would you play 700 800-900 $1,000 for a phone when you can get this one. It's fast it's easy. I love it much more than my Samsung S6. I have Cricket as my carrier and all I did was take the SIM card out of my S6 and put it into this phone. I'm very very pleased with this phone

This device is awesome! I've had it for a few weeks now and am completely satisfied coming from a galaxy s6 active. I paid $700+ for my Galaxy s6 almost 3 years ago and was the best phone I've had until now. The screen is nice and large and pictures are great! The fingerprint scanner is instantaneous. I don't mind microUSB since I've never had type c to miss it. The phone is lagless and snappy. The battery life is ridiculous. I have had 19 hour days and I have never seen my battery lower than 50%. Incredible Buy this phone!!!!
reviews.review_header: This device is awesome! I've had it for a few weeks now ...

reviews.review_text: First reason to buy this phone, The US government said not to! Seriously this was a huge reason for me as I noticed they were dwarfing samsung in sales and getting closer to toppling I phone from #1. If you looked at the Honor 7x and wanted a extra Gb of ram and 32 more GB of storage this is a must have. It also boasts a large 5.93" screen with minimal bezel. Oh so sexy for a budget device. It has a solid build and beautiful screen. After having it for over a week I noticed most complaints were unwarranted since some people are spoiled by more robust screens. Granted this is not a "flagship level" phone but for the price it delivers above what any reasonable person would expect. The finger print sensor needed some getting used to. I have never had a phone like this before. It defiantly beet the Galaxy s4, Blu energy x plus, ZTE and other phones I have owned in function and form. I love the screen most although it is not for small handed people except for the shrink feature allowing one handed use. It even has eye comfort built right in. Love that. The US government has no real proof to there allegations since there has not even been a formal charge filed against Huewai and seriously I doubt this company would jeopardize their profit margin with such foolery. If you need a honest opinion buy it you will love it, just remember no matter how good the phone apps can still be less than perfect.
reviews.review_header: Best budget phone, the government is lying about the spying and NSA spys on us anyway.

reviews.review_text: This phone is amazing I love it,the battery life is really good been using it for 4 days now . Awesome 😘😘😘😘😘

I upgraded from an old Samsung galaxy 3 that I had been using for about 5 years. It was a huge jump, and the best choice over the Samsung phone I was looking at. I got a decently fast phone, android 7os (hopefully 8), and it came with all sorts of features. The camera was not bad.

This is an awesome phone considering the price point. I already own a blu vivo 8 and this is a much better phone in terms of performance. The mate SE runs very smooth with little to no lag. The phone just performs like a flagship phone. i really don't care that it doesn't have usb type c because all my previous phones were micro usb. except the Blu pure xr which i owned briefly. The only issue i have with the phone is the display which comes out of the box looking a little bit too warm. Luckily , this can be adjusted in the display setting menu. The colors on the display are a little bit muted and i would have loved it if it was more saturated , which would have let the colors pop out more. I wish they would have put a color saturation slider in the settings menu, honestly i don't know why phone makers don't have this option by default (The closest i have seen to it is video enhance on the note 8). This phone seems to have the same color issue with the Pixel XL 2, although google fixed that with an update. I hope Huawei will also update the color saturation and make it more vivid. This is still a fantastic phone, which i have no regrets buying. I have no problem recommending this phone. Update: I recently noticed that the brightness of the screen would automatically dim when I open apps even though I have got auto brightness set to off. Huawei needs to look into this issue.
reviews.review_header: Excellent product...only wish the display colors were more saturated

reviews.review_text: After losing my 4th iPhone to water damage (my own fault), I just couldn't justify purchasing another $700-$1000 phone. Apple makes great products,but their premium tech comes at a premium price. This forced me to look towards android. I saw this phone on amazon with exceptional ratings and I decided to take the leap. After a week of use, All I can say is Wow! What an amazing phone, especially considering the price tag. It feels like a device that's two to three times more expensive and comes loaded with a crazy amount of tech. As a longtime apple fan, I've gotta say that this is pretty amazing. The screen is beautiful, the processor is faster than my iPhone 6, the 64 gigs is more than substantial (I installed a 64g micro SD (another benefit over apple) so memory is effectively 128g), and the fingerprint sensor is faster and more effective than any sensor I've used before. It's thin, lightweight, feels good in the hand and the nav buttons are intuitive and easy to use. Perhaps my favorite feature is the battery. Even as I write this review I've been using the device pretty heavily today (at least 7 hours of moderate to heavy use) and I'm still sitting at 82% battery. That's phenomenal. The front camera is great, mostly when using the pro mode, although it's easy to wash out pics especially in high sun without adjusting the settings. The selfie camera does leave a bit to be desired (image quality seems lower than the 8mp they advertise, sometimes appearing grainy) but that's not a huge deal for me. My final caveat is the speaker. It's fine for browsing videoes and that sort of thing but don't expect it to get loud. I almost struggled to hear calls while on speaker phone with minimal-moderate background noise. It's not a huge deal since I just switched it over to the ear piece and the call quality was clear and loud. Bottom line, this is the best phone I've ever owned considering the amount of tech vs the price tag. It easily feels like a $500-$600 device. I'm a fan. PS the Chinese government has yet to contact me and my credit card accounts remain secure. I think we can stand on the huawei tech threat.
reviews.review_header: Best Phone I've ever owned. Seriously.

reviews.review_text: This phone is a great value for money. It has proven to very stable, smooth to operate and has great battery time. The camera is reasonable for the price and every other feature I need in a phone meets or exceeds my expectation. The phone feels and functions like a premium phone.

I purchased this to replace my Note 3. I enjoy it a lot. This phone has many options like turning off mobile data but keeping the regular cell services on; which my Note 3 said it did but it didn't work correctly. The pictures are wonderful and it is well designed. It tells me when apps are using a lot of battery which I like to know. Many apps are not made for such a long screen though so it asks every time I open an app to make it full screen or not (not a pop up, just an option at the bottom of the screen) which is obnoxious.

I've had this phone for one week so far. It arrived with a hairline crack, but I had to use it as my other phone was not functioning. I've ordered a replacement so hopefully it goes well with return. My review is based on the phones performance, not this crack. AT&T. It works perfectly. The camera is excellent in good lighting. Low light it lacks but for the price I certainly can't complain. The fingerprint sensor is lightning fast. It's fast. Has plenty of storage, which is expandable with the SD card. Buy this phone.

I upgraded from the Motorola Nexus 6 (2014). I wanted a phone with good specs that would be a significant upgrade, however I was not willing to pay the price of a laptop for a cellphone. I believe these Huawei phones represent an excellent value due to the current state of trade relations between the US and China. Because of political uncertainty, Huawei has had to alter their original plans of distributing their phones via popular US retailers like Best Buy. They are basically selling direct to consumer now. I'm guessing that Huawei probably has too much inventory on hand since the Best Buy deal fell through. Without marketing or any significant US brand-recognition, these phones are selling CHEAP. You might think there's something wrong with them... there's not. This is a great device! I'm considering buying a second one just to have as a backup. Huawei and Foxconn (Taiwan based manufacturer that handles a lot of the manufacturing for Apple) work closely together. I believe they even share some of the same factory space. The phone takes two SIM cards at once, it's globally unlocked, and it doesn't come with too much Huawei customization to the stock Android experience. I disabled all the Huawei apps from receiving updates and changed the default preferences back to the Google apps. The only thing I wish this phone had is wireless charging, and that I can live without for a $200 iPhone clone. Oh, it uses regular USB instead of a lightning connector, and even has a standard headphone jack... image that! Take my advice and give it a try, if you don't like it return it.
reviews.review_header: Great quality, great specs, great price.

reviews.review_text: I have this phone for about a month now and I can easily recommend you to get one. In fact, I liked so much that I bought the gold version for my younger brother. So far I haven't experienced any major lags or slowdowns. There will be some minor lags, but not so much that you'll really notice or get bothered by it. There are three things that you should consider when buying this phone which is the speaker, the ear speaker and there aren't that many good screen protectors and cases. The speaker is not that loud, but for $250 I can't complain. When making a call you might want to be in a quiet place. I found myself having trouble hearing the person, but the audio is clear. I've bought a few screen protectors and most of them don't fit or causes the rainbow edge effect. My advice is to not purchase any temper glass screen protectors for this phone.There are many cases but the quality isn't that great. Right now, I'm using this case https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B0794ZYN4D/ref=oh_aui_detailpage_o01_s00?ie=UTF8&psc=1 and although it doesn't have the best grip I like it a lot. It is a bit bulky but I like my phone to be a bit bulky so consider this when purchasing this case. Besides these three issues, this phone is fantastic and a major go. The screen is huge, the camera is decent but I don't use it that often, the phone is fast with no feelings of slowness, and the fingerprint sensor is usually accurate and really fast. So far $250 I think this is an absolute buy and a great deal. It is also said that it will be updated to Android 8.0 but don't quote me on this.

Maybe I'm not lucky got the wrong one, Problem with my issue is while surfing the web, 4 or 5 minutes will get screen freeze, then it auto restart. same as i open some apps will have the same problem. 4/GB RAM, 64GB storage sound good, with dual lens. $229. I like the price, I like Dual cameral. but something is wrong with the phone, also the fingerprint, seems useless because it still asks your password,
reviews.review_header: After I do faculty reset it works great, the problems cuz by translate data from another old phone to Huawei Mate se. now

reviews.review_text: Just got it at weekend and now is using this new phone ... Impressively moved by its high quality phone material and great looking design, lighting speed finger ID unlock feature, and long lasting battery, and sharp display image ( but weak point is when you use it at outdoor with sun Glasses on , hardly to see the displayed contents ) , and smooth app response, and great speaker sound quality , camera looks good and I think it has more space to improve , and so many other great features ( so far I don't have not have enough time to check all yet) ... Anyway, back to the POINT : This is phone is really worth to buy compare with other phones, it is really close to other expensive phones in quality and feature wise but the price is only 1/3 compare with these ''supper expensive phones - i & S '' ( I am these phones user too at same time ). GO Wow Way, expecting you bring more excitements to this market.
reviews.review_header: Supper impression with its PRICE & high Quality

reviews.review_text: I popped in my Tracfone SIM card, there you go, 4G LTE! I had troubles with other international stocks, not this one. Excellent build quality, blazing fast 2.4 GHz processor, ample storage space, smooth sound, user friendly and beautiful EMUI 5.0..... most impressive of all, the camera! See the snow scenes I took. I say the camera itself worthy the $229 I paid for! I LOVE IT! I can not believe a flagship phone costs this low! The casing feels lighter than the Mate 10 Pro, which costs much more. That is perfect for me. I strongly recommend the phone, to those can not bear infinite OS upgrades, just to welcome more bugs, and cheap tricks that slow down their devices. Good job, Huawei!
reviews.review_header: I Got My 4G LTE, Fantastic Smart Phone!

reviews.review_text: Seriously, this is the best cell phone I've had. My last phone was an LGG4 and this phone is light years better. I don't read much into the whole US government vs Huawei bs. if you are looking for a premium phone at a budget price, this is the phone to buy.

Overall solid performer. Was nice to get an upgrade of the honor 7x in sense of ram and memory. Nice having cases out lwary for it although I would like to see a full body case for the with a attached screen protector. I would say it is safe to assume it will receive 8.0 Oreo like the 7x is supposed to. It is worth the value of what u get

This phone was a huge surprise. Even the camera, that I thought wouldn't deliver, was very good enough to take good pictures. I, always thought, there is no excuse to buy a $800-$1000 phone in our time when you can get a decent phone for 1/4 of that price. What I didn't like is the EMUI (won't bother you) and also the unlocking of the device (you have to go through the swiping up). Overall, a great phone from people who know how to make a cheap phone for the working class.

The phone has everything I need from a smartphone at a great price. My only gripe is the speaker isn't great, but it works well enough, and for movies and music I just use headphones and thankfully there is a headphone jack for my daily driver headphones. Also USB-C would have been nice, but it's whatever. Overall this phone is snappy, responsive, has a great finger print scanner and has suited all my needs so far. Definitely recommend, especially at this price!

Great "budget" smartphone! I've had an LG Stylo 3, ZTE Z Max Pro, LG G3, and iPhone 4, and now this Huawei Mate SE is definitely one of the best smartphones I've had. Runs fast and smooth, looks great, battery life is decent (but could be a little better imo), speaker quality and call quality are sufficient. The screen looks awesome and the interface is very responsive on all apps so far! I was in between this and the Honor 7X and from what I've read so far I'm happy with my decision. I'm using MetroPCS as phone carrier. Really enjoy this phone and I'm looking forward to the update to Android 8 Oreo (EMUI 8)!

- Battery with amazing life lasts for entire day and even more, I spend all the day using mobile data for my social media work, at the end of the day is still 40% - Software is good, and will get even better with the new OREO update that huawei confirmed will come soon - Fast and smooth no bugs or lags, even amazing for games and never heat - Camera is good, not as good as the 1100$ iphone or 800$ samsung note8, but comparing the proce difference, it is good - Now some might say that its not good cz there is no NFC, or fast charging, or low volume level; I say that i don't care, I never use the NFC tech, and the battery is more than good it lasts the entire day, no need for fast charging during the day, and the volume is acceptable so if you want a mobile that is fast, up to date, great battery with an amazing price 229$, this is the one but if you are looking for a mobile only for the top camera and loud volume speakers, this is not your choice
reviews.review_header: - Battery with amazing life lasts for entire day and even more

reviews.review_text: Just got the phone the other day, so far so good. Only giving it 4 stars because I haven't had it long so I can't write a super detailed review. Much faster than my old phone (blackview), holds a charge well, gets good service, I like the layout and the setup of the features. Great camera! That's a big selling point for me and the pictures come out great and it has some cool features to play with like stickers, manual camera settings and some great editing options. Optional additional storage is great too. So far I really like this phone and would definitely recommend it.

I've had the phone for a few hours, so far so good. I transferred my number from my old straight talk phone. Sadly is only supports GSM (I knew beforehand). I had to choose between using AT&T and t mobile chip that straight talk offers.

If I could get this with 8GB/128GB I would order it at this instant. I had to upgrade my Samsung J7 Sky Pro even though I loved it dearly. I needed more memory, etc. To be honest, I didn't do a whole lot of research but I loved the specs on this phone. The reviews here on Amazon and elsewhere such as YouTube were very positive. I'd never heard of Huawei before. I took a chance and ordered it. If it didn't work out, I'd return it. Well, it's not going back. I absolutely love it. Not more than 5 minutes after I turned it on, I felt as if I had been living in the Dark Ages. Whole new worlds spread out before me!!! I didn't have the Tracfone SIM yet, but just going through my Wi-Fi was incredible. When I did get the T-Mobile SIM from Tracfone, it took only a few moments to install and move my Samsung account to the Huawei without any need for human interaction. Minutes, data and text all transferred over flawlessly. Popped in the SIM, set it up and within a few minutes voila! 4G! I have no negatives yet except for one thing. The battery. It works fine and does a good job. Powers the phone for a long time and doesn't take a long time to charge, either. Problem is that's it built in. All things considered, it's in NO way a deal breaker. For the $$$, I can't see getting anything better. Indeed, a friend of mine recently acquired the newest iPhone. I gave her my Huawei to play with and she gave me that condescending look (Apple owners practice it alone in front of a mirror at 3AM when no one's watching) whenever they have to touch anything that's not been blessed by the ghost of Steve Jobs. She played with it for about a half hour. When she gave it back, she asked me "How much did it cost?" When I told her, she was more than a bit surprised and looked at her mega$$$ phone. "Not bad," she said. Sounds like a compliment to me. UPDATE : It's been over a week now and I love this phone even better. I called Huawei support's 800 number and within a minute, I had an ENGLISH speaking rep on the phone. Within five minutes my question was answered and my problem resolved. This was during peak hours. Is that good or what?

Good phone for the money with one MAJOR flaw for me. This phone can't stream to Bluetooth and do WiFi at the same time. WiFi speeds become unusable. Tried to figure out why. Looks like they share the same antennae on the phone. Bummed out as I use Bluetooth headsets daily. (I have had other budget phones that handle the Bluetooth and WiFi issue just fine.) Other than this it's a good phone for the money. Surprised because the build quality other than this is good.

OMG I love this phone! It has all the power I need to do any task I need it to do. And there is no bloatware on it like other proprietary phones. Just android plain and simple. The camera is awesome. Front AND back. Seriously, why pay 500 or a thousand bucks when you can pay 200 and get nearly the same quality? I'm completely happy with my purchase. iPhone who?

Very fast. I have a galaxy s7 and it is a pretty good phone, but mate se is faster. For a budget phone it is very good. The camera is not as good as s7, but it costs much less. In bright situation the photos are good, but in low light situation the image quality goes down. The finger print on this phone is VERY fast! just a touch and it is unlocked. The position is very good, it lets you to drop down the notification bar which is good for a person with small hand. Overall, good phone at a very good price.

Was very nervous about ordering this product, yet brand is very popular in Russian Federation and many other Russian speaking countries. Phone has great battery life, very common features, and is easy in setting up. Slightly heavy in weight, but comfortable to hold in a hand. Comes with clear semi-soft case. Back and front camera and video is amazing quality. If I would know before about this brand, I would never spend crazy money on other lg/Samsung/blackberry phones. Extremely pleased with product.
reviews.review_header: Great battery life, user friendly and amazing cameras

reviews.review_text: Amazing. Honestly I love this phone. Bought it to use it as a replacement for my Xperia XZ, for a budget device it has everything you'll need and more. Love the hardware, love the screen, love the battery, that camera it's just ok, it has micro usb not USB type C (me), downfiring speakers (bummer) but besides those things I can't complain.

I was looking for an upgrade and this phone is awesome! It is fast enough to tackle apps I throw at it and there is no lag with the EMUI interface. You have to be nuts to buy an expensive phone on a contract when this is available, unlocked, at a great price.
reviews.review_header: ... was looking for an upgrade and this phone is awesome! It is fast enough to tackle apps I ...

reviews.review_text: Great phone so far. This one I got for my brother and he loves it. I have been using Honor 8 for two years and I didn't have even one issue with it. That's why we decided to get another Huawei phone. This one looks very solid, bigger screen, faster and you cannot beat the price. I always wonder why people pay nowadays $1000 if you can get a better phone for just under $300, plus unlocked???

Galaxy killer........this phone is amazing...well worth the coins....super fast and comes with anti virus preinstalled...... cameras are Rock solid.....I dig the fact you can zoom your videos to full screen....they even have laptops from this company....good job Huawei

I was limping along with my Nexus 6P and it finally decided enough was enough. I wanted an interim phone to get me through to the next Pixel release and decided on this since my Huawei 6P lasted me 2.5 years which is a lot for an android device. I am very impressed with this phone. For the price it is quite feature rich. The system is crazy smooth. The storage is 64GB which is twice that of my 6P. Memory stands strong at 4GB. This is great as long as management of it stays on point. The camera is good. Not great but it is quite usable for a device at this price point. Pros: - 64GB storage - 4GB Ram - 6" screen - Works on Tmobile and AT&T LTE bands (no verizon or sprint) - Crazy fast fingerprint reader in the CORRECT SPOT - FM Radio and a headphone jack (common in Chinese phones) - Good camera, but won't blow anyone away - Dual SIM with great management tools - Actual good battery life will get you through the day easy - Slick all metal design, this is nice but also slippery. Luckily the phone comes with a free clear case. I bought the Spigen Honor 7X case though. - $230??? Cons: - Micro USB connection, better dig up your old cables - No NFC, I use contactless payment a lot and this hurts - No wireless charging, but this is a metal phone so eh - EMUI skin is quite intrusive, I recommend Nova or Google Launcher on top, much better this way - Only running Android 7.0, hopefully the Honor 7X beta program means Oreo will be coming to this device eventually, don't hold your breath though. - This is a Chinese phone and these companies sometimes have questionable practices when using your personal data. Keep this in mind when buying lower end devices such as this. Probably doesn't matter though since your data is being harvested and sold by all phone manufacturers most likely. Might as well save a buck. Overall I am very happy and impressed with this phone. Budget phones have come so far from the last time I had a lower end phone that I honestly did not expect this device to perform the way it is. This phone is easily worth the price. Micro USB being the biggest downfall of this device is understandable at this price point. This phone may get me to skip the new Pixel altogether! Buy this if you need something to hold you off until the next big thing OR if you are budget minded but still looking for a feature rich device.
reviews.review_header: Great device that is USA compatible

reviews.review_text: I bought one of my kids the Honor 7x and one the Huawei Mate SE. Both are great, low cost and beautiful phones. From the outside, the only difference I can see is the color and the camera housing being a single piece on the Mate SE. You can definitely tell the Mate is a little more responsive with the extra RAM. If you weren't already aware, there are some big limitations to these phones. You can only connect to 2.4Ghz wireless and Bluetooth shares an antenna with wifi, which means you get slower performance on wifi when using blootooth. You also don't get fast charging or USB type C, which really isn't a huge deal to me. It seems to charge fast enough. The body is a great size and it really does look very pretty overall. For kids who want something that looks good, but you won't be too concerned about losing or breaking, this is a great option and one I would recommend. At the current price of $230, the extra 30 dollars is worth it over the 7x for the extra memory/storage.

This device is very fast and very smooth. Easily the best experience I've had on an Android device. This phone birngs you flagship level specs without breaking the bank. Don't let the price throw you off. There is no lag. Cameras are absolutely gorgeous. Fingerprint scanner is instant. And that 3340 mAh battery keeps you charged all day, even under decently heavy use. That Kirin 659 Octa-Core CPU can handle everything you throw at it with incredible speed and realibility. The onboard EMUI is very responsive with no lag. Currently Android 7.0 out of the box with 8.0 on the way. Do not hesitate another second. But this phone. You will NOT be disappointed!!
reviews.review_header: Don't even think twice: buy it now!

reviews.review_text: Amazing phone for the value. With 4GB of Ram, I have yet to encounter any issues with the system slowing down, or overheating. The screen is bright and vibrant with great contrast. I love the night mode where it dampens the colors to not strain your eyes at night. The battery will give you a full day of use, easy. The cameras are top notch, with a show motion video option that's actually pretty cool. The only downside to this phone is it uses a micro USB, not a type C. So there's no quick charge option. But other than that. It's a great phone.

This is a beautiful phone for the price. It's fast and has a great fingerprint sensor. The only thing is I'm not sold on the 18/9 screen. My Sony Xperia xa Ultra has a 16/9 and just looks like a much bigger screen ( even though the Huawei is only slightly smaller)when watching videos. I know this is the new thing, but new isn't always better. So if your just a fad junkie ( hopefully this is just a fad) this will be your cup of tea. Why phone companies are always changing things that aren't broke, like removable batteries, headphone jacks, need to have a Sim ejector tool just to remove your SD card. I blame these changes on Samsung and Apple, all the other phone companies are just followers. Back to the phone - if you like the 18/9 and don't want to pay a fortune for a phone with a nice screen, great fingerprint reader, and decent camera and battery life this is the phone for you.
reviews.review_header: Great for an 18/9, but I'll stay with 16/9

reviews.review_text: I'll never buy another 'flagship' device when options like this exist.
reviews.review_header: Best value on the market right now

reviews.review_text: So freaking this phone has been great. Really fast has not lagged or frozen one bit. I wish it had USB typ C charging but still charges decently fast. Battery life if GREAT I'm on it most of th day and does NOT drain the battery fast like my prior phone!

I bought this phone to replace my aging Samsung Galaxy J7 (2015 Version) on the advice of a friend and co-worker who has the Huawei Honor 6X. I have to say i am impressed with speed of this phone. The extra ram really makes makes a difference. 4GB of Ram and 64GB of storage for $230? Great deal. The only thing my Samsung does better is outdoor mode. If there is a way to improve the screen brightness outdoors when its sunny and bright I would love to hear about it. Other than that good overall phone.

Incredible phone. Coming from an iPhone 7S, I needed a cheaper replacement. This beast is no cheap at all. Incredible performance, excellent battery life, premium feel, run all tasks with no problem, wonderful fingerprint sensor with multiple uses. I'm very happy with my choice.
Nice phone!
Upgrade from honor 5. Simple data transfer. Fast fast phone!! Polital govt. Hysterics on Chinese ties seems absurd given that nearly all our phones are made there.
reviews.review_header: Give Huawei a try, great value in phones

reviews.review_text: Awesome phone! I have had iPhones and HTC prior to owning this Huawei, and I could definitely say that this phone is comparable to those big company / popular phones (if not better)! You have to see it and experience it yourself. Such an underrated phone with such a great price!!!
LOVE IT
I bought it for my daughter and she loves it. Have a great camera, a great processor and plenty of memory. Great quality for the price!
Everything works great. No problems with operating on T-mobile network. Fast shipping and excellent value for the price.
Great phone! Everything about it works as well or better than the flagship OnePlus 3 phone I bought two years ago at twice the price.
For $225, this thing rocks. Turbo fast. I gave it as a gift to a friend to replace and older iPhone. She loves it.
reviews.review_header: For $225, this thing rocks. Turbo fast. ...

reviews.review_text: It very good cellphone I wish the screen was bigger, I Love it. I want bigger screen and faster one.
reviews.review_header: It very good cellphone I wish the screen was bigger

reviews.review_text: Amazing phone. Bought this to begin an iPhonefree life. This kills the iPhone i had indeed. 4 stars for the micro usb instead of C-type.
reviews.review_header: Amazing phone. Bought this to begin an iPhonefree life

reviews.review_text: Really good phone for a pretty low price. Thanks China.
I love this phone, I had previous purchased a Moto Z and a Blu V, both were defective and I returned them.. This phone is everything as advertised and it WORKS.
Just Plain Impressive! Leaves my old Samsung in the dust, outshines my early Mate 7.
After trying to figure out how to it in 2nano sim cards that was the worst part but now I love the phone now

Let me start by saying that I am not a phone snob. I am not trying to impress anyone. This phone has almost everything I want and provides me with all the functionality I need. It is essentially an Honor7X with upgraded RAM and storage making it equal to the Honor7X released in the rest of the world outside of the US. It has a decent camera, Android 7, 64GB storage, and duo SIM and unlocked for travel. The fingerprint sensor is nicely placed on the back and I don't have to struggle to find it. The battery lasts me for 2 to 3 days depending on my usage (I am not a heavy user). I use it a lot for Spotify in the car and for my home audio system and it works well. It is lightning fast at boot up and loading apps. I find it to be great value. My cost was $229 US. I had considered the new Samsung A8 (2018) but it only had 32GB memory and I felt that it was overpriced at $429 US with the only advantage that I could see for the Samsung product was being IP68 water resistant and protected against dust ingress. Could have done without the bloatware. Some people will dislike the lack of a headphone jack but I only use Bluetooth so it is not an issue for me. Support for NFC would have been a plus. Essentially a great phone and a Huawei Mate SE Factory Unlocked 5.93" - 4GB/64GB Octa-core Processor| 16MP + 2MP Dual Camera| Grey (US Warranty) great bargain.
reviews.review_header: Excellent Value Considering All the Features

reviews.review_text: This phone is amazing. Battery life is exceptional. One can add apps and they don't slow the phone down. The price is good as well for a phone that ordinarily would cost a lot more.
this is very nice phone better than I expected. good size screen, light weight and thin. Affordable price, I am highly recommended if you don't want to spend big money on you phone.
love it, the only thing confuse me is, it does not come with headphone.
For the price you can't go wrong. Solid phone, great specs, great design.
great product and price so far
Nice phone, very good vslue for money.

Best budget phone of 2018. I absolutely love it and the camera is amazing and i think gold is so pretty :D. Delivery was even earlier than expected. I would recommend this phone to anyone out there looking for a great phone but doesn't have $1000 to spend on the latest flagships.

Best phone I have ever had! Been using Blackberry for over 10 years, was a very welcome upgrade. It's hard adjusting to a touch interface e keyboard VA the qwerty keyboard, but this phone is much more compatible. Only complaint is the edges can hurt your hands after hours of prolonged use.
Great phone so far!

After trying the Honor 7x last month, I decided to return it due to sluggish operation, particularly with the camera, and went back to my iPhone 6s for the time being. I wasn't happy about it, but just not completely ready to cut the iPhone cord, I guess. When the Mate SE caught my eye, I decided to give it a try and it is definitely a keeper. It's snappy response has convinced me to retire the 6s for good, without looking back. Thanks, Huawei! UPDATE 4/1/2018: Still very happy with my choice of this phone... it suits my needs perfectly.
Phone suits my needs perfect. I love the price.
I love the phone. This ia a good buy you won't be disspointed

Fast beautiful phone. Any penny you spend is 200% worth it. So US wants to block this phone and some people just leave bad comments even they don't have the phone in handy. Good performance (not excellent coz its not 1000$$$ iPhone X). If you scared the company spies you, ask Facebook 1st.
reviews.review_header: Fast beautiful phone. Any penny you spend is 200% worth ...

reviews.review_text: Wow, the build quality and performance are amazing for the price!!!
Switched from a iPhone 6 plus to this. I've been very pleased with it. No regrets.
reviews.review_header: I've been very pleased with it

reviews.review_text: I haven't seen anyone mention this but aside the excellent performance and how beautiful the screen is, the touch response is what really make this phone shine in my opinion. It makes general navigating and typing a joy as each touches are registered instantly when your finger makes contact to the screen. Although the speakers can use a little bit for the improvements, this is a BEAST of a phone at this price.
Awesome phone. Great value for money.
Absolutely love this phone . Phone is lightweight and easily fits in my pocket . Still learning all of the unique features of the phone . Fingerprint scanner is amazing

This Hauwei Mate SE... exceeded my expectation!!! For a first time buyer, i'm in love with it!!!! I got me the gold one...bought a few cases and screen protectors which enhanced her beauty! Now i'm good to go!
I really like the performance and build quality of the phone. My highlight is the reduced-bezel display.
reviews.review_header: Feels like a 2018 flagship-type phone on a budget.

reviews.review_text: Quality build.Very fast opening apps.Very good budget phone.I could not be more pleased.Would recommend for anyone.
This is the best phone I've ever had. Been through iPhones, Galaxy, BlackBerry. This one tops it.
Great phone. Amazing price for the amount of storage. Fast speed and big screen. Just can't seem to find any decent screen protectors that will fit right, but I'm sure it's just because it's so new.
Almost as good as my Huawei Mate 9 but for a fraction of the price.
Have been using for the past 3 weeks with no issues. Battery life is good and easily lasts a day. Camera is decent for the price. No lag so far. Great purchase for $230.
reviews.review_header: Battery life is good and easily lasts a day

reviews.review_text: This is the best phone for the price that I've ever had. It seems like flagship quality, for $230.

I have had the phone for about a week, and I love it. Everything is fast including the camera and fingerprint sensor. I like the quality of the photos. The phone is a little on the heavy side, but not too bad. The one really disappointing thing for me is the battery life. I cannot get through a full day with even moderate use. I have put it on battery saver mode, made sure no apps are running in the background and made whatever other setting adjustments I could, but the battery life is still poor. I recharge once during the day for a while, and it is OK. However, I don't think I should have to do that. I am not sure if the battery is a general situation, or if I have just received a bad one. Update 4/2/18: company emailed me about ways to increase battery life. It worked. The battery is now great, and so is this phone, probably the best I have ever owned! Dual sim is awesome. I live in Costa Rica, and need both Movistar and Kolbi for complete coverage.
reviews.review_header: Added a star - battery problem fixed

reviews.review_text: When I started working with computers in the 1980s, I never expected to walk around with 8 CPU cores, 64 GB of storage, and 4 MB of RAM in my pocket! The price/performance ratio of this device is phenomenal, and it's a joy to use. The sound with Bluetooth and headphones is excellent (there is a headphone jack). There are few bloatware apps, and most can be removed. The version of Android is not stock, but isn't annoying either. Huawei says the device will get Oreo in the future. I am using this phone with T-Mobile in the USA and the call quality is good. The phone can either take 2 SIMs, or 1 SIM and 1 microsd card. I installed my 128 GB microsd, so I have all of my music (ripped CDs) on the device. I like that you can set up the phone to turn on with two taps to the screen. There is a step counter that displays on the lock screen which is useful to me. Battery life seems to be pretty good. After fully charging the phone last night, and spending a lot of time installing software and configuring the phone, the next morning it's still at 60%. I even used the hotspot feature when my ISP had a brief outage, and I'm sure that uses a significant amount of power. After charging to 100%, in the morning it was still at 97%. The camera seems to be good, but I have not taken many photos yet.

I have owned this phone a little over a week and can't say anything but good about it. Runs smooth like a champ. All apps are quick and snappy, including games and social media. 64 gb storage and the extra money for 1 extra gig of ram and double the storage was worth it to me. 4 gig ram also allows apps to run quick and even when multiple are running its quite fast. 4g lte is also a great bonus, although it's expected in most smartphones these days. Battery life is also very good with its close to 3400 mAh battery. I can be on it all day and still have about 30% by the end of the day, given I would run it for 8 to 10 hours straight. The phone is larger than other phones I have owned and some may feel that the screen ratio is strange. I however don't mind it being a bit taller and slender. Some people are worried that because it's not a flagship phone that it won't perform and that is not the case. Fingerprint scanner is very fast and responsive. The camera is mediocre to say the least but what can you expect from a phone that doesn't break the bank at only $229 dollars. Also, for those who are worried about "spying", Huawei is just a company trying to make money like any other. I highly recommend this phone to any who were on the edge about purchasing in the beginning as I was. It is a fantastic product.

reviews.review_text: Works with T-Mo. No issues with getting 4G LTE connection. Talk and text working perfectly. First "unlocked" phone I've ever had and the transition couldn't have been any more easier. Just had to run to the T-Mo store to get a new nano sim card because my micro sim card from my old phone didn't fit (didn't even know there were different sim card sizes now). Coming from a Samsung Galaxy Note 4 that was crapping out on my 5th battery after 3+ years, decided to go with this for the screen size at the price mainly. All the knocks on this phone are things and features that it doesn't have (that other phones have as a standard), but if you didn't need it or use it before then chances are you probably won't know it did not exist. It does everything that I wanted my Galaxy Note 4 to do, but faster with double the storage and a nicer screen. I'm already impressed with the battery life but I'm sure that will degrade over time. Still getting used to this version of Android and GUI but it looks neat. My first new mobile device in over three years and I couldn't be anymore happier and impressed especially because of the price. Great bargain if you're looking to upgrade and catch up with the times, haha.

I like this phone a lot. I've had it for less than one week. My previous phone was a google / motorola nexus 6. Good: Screen is very nice and bright Battery life is incredible. will last me two days when my old phone needed charging during each day Camera is amazing. Front camera is as good as my old phone's back camera Comes with a nice clear case Bad: Touch sensor is not great and sometimes registers a tap as a swipe. I wonder if this is a software or hardware problem Form factor -- 2:1 aspect ratio is weird and unusual for android. There's a special button to tell the system to stretch the screen for each app. It has worked in every app I've pressed it, but it seems weird. It's also hard for me to reach the whole screen with one hand. Spyware is factory installed. I usually like to mod my phone and get root and install custom roms. This phone I haven't even rooted yet, but I still leave that open as a possibility. The built in ROM is quite nice it supports themes including dark mode. I've been using DNS66 to block ads. It works ok, but some sites still show ads. This phone doesn't have a section in XDA yet but the previous model (Honor 7x) does and the development is progressing slowly. This phone is bootloader unlock able and root able using the same procedure as the 7x. Today Huawei released Oreo beta for honor 7x in US and I assume that will come to this phone too. Overall I'm quite happy with this device and I think that it's pretty good. I hope that Huawei / Hi Silicon release information about the CPU and camera allowing custom kernel and ROM development.

reviews.review_text: If you’re in the market for a new Android smartphone you have a multitude of choices. I recently started having problems with my Galaxy Note Edge (a one-time Samsung flagship) but given that the phone lasted way past its two-year mark, I’d say I got my money’s worth. The biggest factor in my decision making for getting the Huawei Mate Special Edition (SE) was price. It’s hard to swallow paying upwards of $800 to $1,000 for a smartphone that’s one drop away from becoming the worst thing to happen to you all week/month/year. On the other hand, after experimenting with lower-end budget phones (ZTE Maven and Moto G4), I learned that at least with Android, you do get what you pay for. I’m going to start with something a little different from most other reviews: apps I had to replace. Specifically, there were three stock apps that were tripping me up on the Huawei, because they wouldn’t do certain things. I found free replacements for them on the Play Store and I’ve had no problems since the switchovers. • First the browser: Chrome on the Mate SE is slow and full of ads. I ditched it for (of all things) Samsung’s Internet browser coupled with two extensions for ad blocking (Adblock Fast and Disconnect for Samsung Internet). Much faster and you have the advantage of a home screen of web shortcuts you can create inside the app. • Next, the music player. For some odd reason, Huawei’s music player doesn’t read pre-made m3u files (these are files for playlists). You can make one on the phone, but if you have ones that were made on a computer, the phone won’t recognize them. Solve it by installing another music player (I used Pi Music Player and it works just fine). • As for the camera, the dual back facing cameras are pretty capable right out of the box (you will want to play with the photo and video settings to get high quality pictures). But there is one software/app problem that doesn’t affect everyone but will affect some: in video mode, the camera won’t recognize an external microphone. Most smartphones can handle a TRRS microphone (4 “poles” and three black rings) ; the stock camera app on this phone can't. Solution: download a different camera app. I used Open Camera; to get it to work, in video settings, set the microphone to use external mic when present and you should be good to go. Now the good stuff. Is the Huawei Mate SE a good substitute for a Galaxy Note Edge? Yes. Is it as perfect as the Note Edge was in its hey-day? Nope. Am I much happier with a new Huawei than a three-year old Samsung? Definitely. So let’s start with what’s missing. There’s no NFC, no 5G wi-fi, no removable battery and of course, no S-Pen. I modified my Note Edge to do wireless charging; no bueno trying to do the same thing on the Mate SE. The Mate SE also has a bottom firing speaker that while loud, is kind of weird the first few times you listen to it. Screen resolution on the Mate SE is not as bright and crisp as the Note Edge’s Super AMOLED display (but after a few days you’ll get used to it). What will you NOT get with the Mate SE that you’ll get on other smartphones (some priced the same, some more expensive)? • No USB-C- Not a deal breaker for me b/c I have a ton of Micro USB chargers and cables lying around (so it’s actually a plus right now). • No Android 8.0 Oreo- The Mate SE ships with Android 7.0 (Nougat) but since the Mate SE’s sister phone the Honor 7x is now going through beta testing with 8.0, Oreo is probably in the Mate’s very near future. • No IP68 dust or water resistance- Would have been nice, but nope. So what is there to like? • Battery life. I run the same exact apps (plus the three substitutes I mentioned) on my Huawei as I did on the Galaxy Note Edge. At the end of the day, the Edge was at about 15% but the Mate SE is at about 50%. The Mate SE has a 3340mAh battery; the Note Edge a 3000mAh battery. Size-wise, it’s not a big difference, but the phone, the processor, and the 7.0 OS versus the 6.0 OS on the Note is obviously much more efficient. Advantage Huawei. • The fingerprint sensor. THIS THING WILL BLOW YOUR MIND. I’ve used a fingerprint sensor before, but I found it finicky and slow. Not so here: the Mate SE’s sensor is super, super, SUPER fast. Touch it, and you’re in. • Landscape mode: This is odd- on my Samsung Galaxy Note Edge I could never get the phone to do a decent landscape mode on the home pages. Inside an app, no problem, but on the home screens, it never worked. This phone does landscape on all pages. It’s a little thing, but after missing it for so long, it’s kind of cool. Cool Stuff I’ve not seen before since my last new smartphone three years ago: • Screenshot scroll. You’ve probably done a screenshot before, but what happens when you want to get an entire page as a screenshot that is longer than what you can see on the screen? Screenshot scroll takes care of that: it’s built-in software that will copy an entire page not just what is displayed on the phone (find it in drop down navigation menu). • Speaking of the drop down navigation menu, Huawei gives you the ability to add a fourth button for that navigation menu at the bottom of your display. You can program the fingerprint sensor to perform a task by sliding your finger across the sensor (like say opening the camera), blocked numbers can be based on keywords and contacts, and Huawei has a virus scanner baked into the phone under the phone manager app. • Other goodies: you can encrypt photos and videos as well as lock certain apps so that you (and your fingerprint and nobody else) can use the app. Finally, there’s App Twin- the ability to log into the same app using two different accounts at the same time. two different logins on the same app at the same time. My last comments: troubleshooting some apps. • If you happen to use Waze with Android Auto, you’re going to have problems with the Mate SE the first time you try it. The fix: go to settings, go to apps, select Android Auto, delete all data including the cache, start Android Auto BEFORE you connect it to the car and go through the permissions. Once done, connect it to the car and you should be good to go. Don’t ask, all I know is it worked for me. • Two other problems: my Huawei did weird things with my Arlo system. Solved this by actually rebooting the base station. I still haven’t properly figured out why the phone and Wear OS (for smartwatches) isn’t perfect (I had to reboot and start over several times to get watch faces to download. I’ll finish with this: the dumbest thing about this phone (and the nicest!) is the 18x9 display. On most apps it works perfectly fine. On some, a dialogue box pops up asking if you want to go “full screen.” My answer is always yes and when I hit it, it makes you sometimes start all over again. Huawei- please fix this! It’s the one annoying aspect of your phone that there doesn’t seem to be a quick fix for. Conclusion: if you need a new phone, buy this one. It comes with lots of memory (64GB built in) and lots of operating RAM (4GB). You can pop in a big SD Card (I have a 128GB) or another SIM if you want to go dual-SIM. Is it going to be as good as a flagship phone? No. But are you getting $600-$700 more “umph” in a Note 8, S9, iPhone 8 or iPhone X than you would in a Mate SE? That’s for you to decide. # # #
reviews.review_header: A Week with the Huawei Mate SE
