No fast charging, but again, most phones don't in this process range. No 5ghz WiFi... Just them cutting corners I guess. But it's a little ridiculous in 2017. But not a huge deal if you have decent wifi. Anyway, after working at a company that is mostly concerned with the user experience with it's products, it's nice to see another phone company care about that. Definitely will keep buying Huawei if this continues. The 7x is only $20 more than this phone at this point, so only get this if it's on a major sale. The 7x has great reviews, but $50 less, this is great.
reviews.review_header: It's great! But get the 7x if this isn't on sale!

reviews.review_text: The phone being sold here is not the US version, it is the Global version. I bought this phone and after an unsuccessful 4G network checked IMEI and found out it was the global version. It doesn't support 4G LTE networks of local carriers like t-mobile. It is missing the Band 4 (1710) and 12 (700) which is important for 4G LTE on carriers like T-mobile. I would recommend not to buy this if planning to use in the USA.

I've had the phone for a month now and I was struggling between giving 3 or 4 stars...and since I can't give it a 3.5 I'll give it 4 stars. So...I absolutely detest getting new phones. But because I was forced to when my LG3 started having all these annoying problems I decided to go with an unlocked phone that I could just pay outright for as opposed to being locked into a 2 year contract with my cellular provider. The reason I don't like getting new phones is because although I'm relatively savvy with technology, it takes some time to get used to the different features on new phones especially if you decide to go with a different manufacturer. So I'd never heard of Huawei and based on Amazon reviews and the reviews on PC Mag and other technology resources I decided to go with the Honor 6X. Over the past month I've had a few little minor issues with the phone like when I activate a certain feature it "mysteriously" deactivates itself. The camera feature not activating when I click on the icon or it taking a long time to load. I've even had to turn the phone off and back on a couple times to get the camera feature to load. This isn't good since I've only had the phone 30 days. The pics on the forward face feature in the camera (to take selfies) isn't all that clear which is a bummer. Especially when the camera feature is supposed to be one of the top features of the phone. I can't figure out how to turn up or down the sound feature only for notifications in various apps. It appears that whatever sound level you set for ringtone is the level across the board for texts and other app notifications which is a bit irritating. I wish that I could adjust the sound volume by going into the app settings. Then there's an issue with notifications on certain apps where I'm not notified at all when certain alarm times have been set. I also don't like that when you send a text message you can't tell which number of any contact is which (ie, cell, home, etc.) as it brings up all of the numbers you have associated with a particular contact, so I have to go out of the text look at the contact to make sure I'm not sending the text to the person's home or office no. So instead of starting a blank text it's best to go into contacts first then select the text icon from the number you want to text to...this is a bit annoying and can get more frustrating when you're texting to several people in one text. I also wish you could change the "look" of the text message so that the string looks like callout boxes as with Samsung and LG. It's just a pretty simple format but I guess that's really not a big deal at the end of the day. All said, for $250 the phone is a pretty decent. I could definitely compare it to some of the top tier phones I've had in the past. I love the fingerprint option...it works like a charm! It was basically a breeze (thanks to Google) to transfer all of my information inc my apps to the new phone in no time at all! I love that all of my apps are right there on the phone and I don't have to drill down to get to them (only wish they were in alphabetical order.) And did I mention the OUTSTANDING BATTERY LIFE! Honestly, this has to be the best part of owning this phone so far. I have NEVER run out of a charge. In the 30 days that I've had the phone I still normally have 65% at the end of the day. I only charge the phone at night before going to bed just to make sure it's fully charged for the next day but I really don't need to. And again I usually have 65-70% battery life remaining. For me this is a serious PLUS not having to charge the phone every 5 minutes. I am still learning new features on the phone almost daily which is a good thing. The phone is light and stylish. (Just wish there was a wider variety of phone covers available.) I just hope that some of the quirky, annoying issues that I've been having will just go away. ***8/1/17 UPDATE***Returned the phone and got a replacement. Unfortunately it is performing subpar as well. Having all of the same issues as I did before...and now the screen is freezing on the replacement. I believe they may have sent me a refurbished phone. I'm sending #2 back for a full refund. Not sure if I will be purchasing another as I believe I am getting refurbished phones instead of a brand new phone. Second did not have the new OS out of the box. Spent well over an hour downloading it. This isn't good at all.

I purchased this phone back in January and was amazed at the perceived quality for the money. However 10 months later I regret making this purchase. the phone is still in great physical condition. I keep it in a case and did not abuse it in any way. However the battery started to swell and popped the screen up in the middle of both sides. I emailed Honor to see if they would "honor" their warranty. I received a message back stating that the battery swelling was my fault and they would not "honor" the warranty. Great phone if you only need it for a couple months. Just keep in mind you'll have to buy another in less than a year.
reviews.review_header: Not a good long term choice.

reviews.review_text: I am switching from a windows 10 phone over to an Android phone due to the lack of new windows phones. I looked at both IPhone and several devices that ran on Android all v7. I was not aware some companies had different home screens than others and the set up is not standardized. This phone does not have the apps menu available as other android v.7 phones do. While this is not the end of the world it is very inconvenient and something I will think about every time I have to jump through 2-3 screens to get to the app menu. If there is a way to place the app menu on the home screen please let me know. Edit: You can change the style of your home screen. Go to Settings --> Home Screen Style --> and choose "Drawer" One of the main purposes I purchased this phone was the dual sim card capability and its ability to Incorporate an SD card. I was disappointed that you could not use two sim cards and an SD card at the same time. Now when I travel overseas I will have to forgo using my SD card, or remove my Sim Card that I use domestically....next time I will do further research before purchasing.
reviews.review_header: Good price, maybe better off spending a little more

reviews.review_text: These phones replaced our aged LG G2s, and we have been very pleased with the performance, easy use, sharp and crisp display, ease of camera use, fantastic colorful pictures and GREAT battery usage......like nothing we have ever had. Did not purchase for all the total crap the I-phones/Samsung note 8 and such have. We just wanted a phone mostly for a phone, some texting, taking pics and some net usage like most people our age. I did my homework on a number of Huawei phones and this one appealed to us. All reviews from different sites were great. This is a very nice looking phone, feels nice, good weight and the fingerprint reader is flawless and was easy to set up. Took to AT&T and was up and running with the app assistance they have. ALL contact info and photo's transferred, no problem, not like in the past with LG, Nokia, Moto and Samsung, a nightmare transferring stuff. This is a great buy, and when the word really gets out on this product, watch out. Purchased for 199.99 each, went down 20 bucks the next day, called Amazon and was refunded 40 bucks.......nice and easy!

So I'll start off and let you know how i got here and how I came to purchase this phone. I had a Note 7 on Verizon. After the first recall, got another Note 7. Held out with my second Note 7 until Verizon hotlined the Note 7 in late January rendering it essentially useless (redirecting outgoing calls to Verizon customer support). So with my phone useless, Verizon didn't help me at all, instead wanting me to upgrade and in the process lose my upgrade. So not wanting to waste my upgrade on a device from last year, I purchased this Honor 6X and switched to AT&T while I wait for the new Galaxy S8 to come out. When I first started using the phone, I couldn't believe how good it was for $250. Huawei is increasingly making more and more quality devices. I also have the more expensive mid-range Honor 8 which I got on sale for $280. What a great phone that is for the price I got it at. Display: While the screen is not 2K or AMOLED like my Note 7, it's still a very good 1080P panel. It seems to get pretty bright and the colors seem fine to me. Performance: Equipped with the HiSilicon Kirin 655 and 3GB of RAM, I haven't noticed really any slow downs or stutters with this device. In all honesty, it seems just as fast and smooth as my Note 7, believe it or not. It seems like Huawei included a pretty potent processing package for this device. Software: Took me a little while to get used to it coming from TouchWiz. It has a different style but is still functional. It ships with EMUI 4 which is based on Android 6.0. I was kind of disappointed it didn't ship with EMUI 5.0 on Android 7 but the update is coming (hopefully soon). Gaming: I don't really do any gaming on mobile so I can't really speak to it's performance in this area. Camera: The camera seems to take pretty good pictures. Of course it's no comparison to the sensor on the Galaxy S7s or Note 7. The only thing I really don't like is the time it takes to get the camera to focus to take the picture so I don't always get the picture I'm wanting at the time. When you take a picture the phone says "Hold device steady to sharpen". Battery: The battery life on this phone has been amazing. The Honor 6X packs a 3340mAh battery. Only having to push a 1080P panel instead of 2K really contributes to this devices longevity. I do a lot of texting and listening to music and can go all day and not get past 80%. Other: I don't really don't like how it's equipped with the increasingly outdated micro USB. I would have preferred a Type C but really shouldn't complain at this price point. Conclusion: I think this is a great budget device. $250 is still a decent amount of money to pay for a phone, but I think this would be a great back up phone granted you use a GSM carrier. I plan on using it until the Galaxy S8s come out and will keep the Honor 6X as a back up.
reviews.review_header: A Great Phone (Or Secondary Phone) at a Great Price!

reviews.review_text: This product (only in use since March 2017) recently overheated to the point of melting its own charger port and burning my husband. Due to the melting, it is now unable to charge to any functional level. We contacted Huawei customer service for help under the warranty. They were friendly but repeatedly unhelpful. They require you to ship back the phone so they can check on whether it can be repaired first (outdated policy, but fine); however, the process takes weeks and they do not provide a loaner phone in the meanwhile. In a modern society where the average consumer relies heavily on a smartphone for personal and business use, it would be far more reasonable to at least offer a replacement and then if the faulty product can be repaired, sell it as refurbished OR provide a loaner phone during the inspection/repair/shipping time frame. There also seems to be no option from Huawei directly to just receive a refund so you can purchase a replacement yourself.
reviews.review_header: *FIRE HAZARD* and poor Huawei customer service

reviews.review_text: I am excited to write this review. The best cell phone I ever owned so far. Price? Unbelievable. This performance with this price? It is insane. It is fast and responds perfect. Photo quality is fantastic. Sound is luxurious. Memory size is plenty, I downloaded all the apps I use daily or occasionally,without hesitation. This also has FM radio receiver with ear phone inserted working as antenna. What a brilliant idea to have radio in cell phone (no internet radio, real FM radio !). I was not decisive whether I need to choose higher CPU and memory performance similar price but form different brand. But as I watched youtube benchmark test comparing speed with galaxy note 8, I made up my mind to buy this one - this is slightly faster than galaxy note 8. Battery life is very good. Impressive battery life(not replaceable battery probably). After work, when I come home, battery is about 80 % or higher left after all day long vibration whenever I receive email, messages from employees. I strongly recommend this cell phone.
reviews.review_header: The best cell phone I ever owned so far

reviews.review_text: I really like my Honor 6x. Like REALLY like it. After seeing some of the newer phones come out in the past few months I'm so glad I picked up this phone at the beginning of the year. With all of these $800-$1000 price points I don't know how people can justify buying something that expensive when the specs & speed of the Honor 6x is just as good. The fingerprint scanner is amazing and after going from a phone that didn't have a fingerprint scanner I'm very glad that I made the move to this. There have been a few videos on Youtube showing the durability of the Honor 6x and it isn't the best but if you buy a case and keep the cheap screen protector that it came with you won't have any issues with a cracked screen or anything. I've dropped mine without a case and I did get some scuffs on the corners of the phone, but nothing happened to the actual screen. I would recommend getting a case as soon as you buy it, there are a few on Amazon that are really good and are like $10. The battery life is SO good on the phone too. I typically can go an entire day on just 40% battery and I can usually charge up to that point within the 30 minutes or so that it takes me to drive to school. Then when I come home I still have about 10% left. There is an ultra battery saver too that will let your phone last for like 4 or 5 days or more if you just left it on the whole time. All in all, it is a great phone and I can't see how people can justify spending hundreds and hundreds of dollars on other new phones when there are ones like this or the newer Huawei phones that are over $500 cheaper. I haven't had any issues with the phone... For a while, I changed a few settings so that I would get more of my app notifications (which sometimes don't do a good job at notifying you when you get a new notification?) and I noticed that it slowed down the phone a bit. But as long as you choose which apps are most important and just let those apps constantly run you won't have any issues with slowdowns or anything. OH but one negative that I have with this phone... My Fitbit Charge 2 doesn't work with it as consistently as I would like. Some days it will sync really well and I'll receive my messages and calendar updates but other days it is really spotty and I might get one or two messages that show up on my fitbit. I have contacted Fitbit about this issue but they say that it is something wrong with Huawei's chipset or something and they are trying to get it figured out but have been having some issues.

I've had this phone for only 2 days now and have been loving it. However, today I tried pairing the phone with a Fitbit and Bose wireless headphones and it could not even find it. I did not have this problem with my old (Samsung) phone. It didn't even locate other bluetooth devices in my home. This is a real disappointment as I frequently use bluetooth devices. Has anyone else had this problem? Can it be fixed? If not, I'm seriously thinking of returning this phone. 12/28 Update: I emailed the company who quickly responded with an attached letter on ways to resolve the issue. I did as instructed and was able to pair most of the devices in my home, except the Fitbit device and Bose speakers, which I assume do not support my phone. So, other than a couple devices not being able to be paired with my phone, I love everything else about it. The fingerprint sensor is a great feature on this phone for the price. Anyways, I've revised my rating from 3 to 5 stars.
reviews.review_header: After resolving some bluetooth issues, I love this phone.

reviews.review_text: One week of use and very impressed but also a little let down. Value is top notch but screen is lacking. I'm coming from Samsung note 4 so maybe it's the AMOLED I'm missing. It reminds me of when I did a monitor comparison between a high end Dell monitor with a cheap AOC monitor. The screen has this harsh blue to it. I've fiddled with the color correction and while I can get it to look light, in different lighting conditions or apps it looks washed out. Fantastic value on this phone otherwise and it's kind of a deal breaker for me. Probably done this to a family member.

Not even 2 months and having issues. Bought this phone as it had the main features I was looking for at a price That was in the range I wanted. Since I did not know the brand, I did my due diligence, most everything was positive about it. Consumer Reports gave it mostly very good ratings, couple excellent and a couple fair, so I took the plunge. Wish I had not, and wish I had not kept trying to find ways yo make it do what I wanted. Pros: Large 5.5" screen, 32g storage and 3G ram on board, can do dual sim cards or use slot for memory card. Cons: Runs a proprietary version of Android, called EMUI, Can only set one notification sound for all notifications (text, mail. etc.) loaded with crapware that can only be removed if you root your phone. Get a ringtone or notification tone maybe 50% of the time at best. Crapware and notifications are a biggie to me. My last several phones allowed me to set ringtones for seperate things like texts, mail etc, just like you would do for contacts. Customer support must be on another planet, contacted them x2, one time took 2+ weeks for a response, still waiting on the 2nd after 2 months (resubmitted query 3X)
reviews.review_header: Save your money, there's better out there, and not loaded with dozens of crapware.

reviews.review_text: Phone lasted all but 2 months. Now it doesn't charge and Huawei is no help. I sent the phone to them and was told by Huawei the phone was repaired and that it was sent back to me. Open the box to find a note saying it was damaged by water and was not repair. Phone was kept in a case and screen protector since day one, never ever wet. Called them back and they could not find a report from the repair center stating what proof they had. So basically they just denied repair to a two month old phone and that's that. Never buying a Huawei phone and would suggest you don't!
reviews.review_header: Phone lasted all but 2 months. Now it doesn't ...

reviews.review_text: Upgraded an older smart phone and am very happy early on. To me, this phone is as big a screen as I would want. I had a smaller phone and thought I preferred that, but I much prefer this bigger one now. This phone is very snappy with plenty of memory. I tossed in a 32g card also. The camera has terrific quality. The fingerprint access has worked perfectly so far. Didn't think I'd use that, but fell in love right away. So much faster and you don't have to even look at the phone. I'm not a phone-phile so I'm sure I'm missing things, but this phone got me downloading all kinds of helpful apps that I avoided in the past. I didn't know what I was missing. I bought the SPARIN Honor 6X Case (only adds a little size and has great edge protection). I dropped this phone my 2nd day and it landed screen down on a metal staircase. No Damage! Get a protective case. I just ordered a protective screen now too. That might be overkill but they are cheap and I've broken 2 screens in the past. Bonus Tip - this uses a NANO SIM Card. I had a micro sim. Well you can use sharp scissors to cut your sim down to fit the case if you're handy. Get close to size and sand the edges with a nail file. Got me up and running same day without calling the T-Mobile.
reviews.review_header: I feel like I got a high end for a fraction of the price.

reviews.review_text: I purchased a 'refurb' here on Amazon (to save like $40) for $153, to replace my old iPhone 4 and make the switch away from Apple, mainly because I hated their syncing format and their premium prices. The Honor 6x I purchased was GSM, unlocked, and I use it with Cricket. I just popped the SIM card from the iPhone into the Honor 6x and it worked - didn't even have to go into the Cricket store! Have been using the phone two weeks and really put it through its paces and it has performed flawlessly and I really like it a lot and don't miss my iPhone at all. Won't get into all the details, but will say that the phone is loaded with great features, and I really like the hotspot feature, which provides me a wifi signal to my chromebook just about anywhere I go! The cam is excellent. Phone has enough battery juice to use the phone all day no sweat. And the dual SIM set up enables one the have two phone numbers associated with this one phone, which could come in handy for business use or international travel. Was worried that it wouldn't be so easy to access all seven of my email accounts on the Honor 6x vs. the iPhone, but it is actually better! I have never used the latest greatest iPhone 8 or whatever, but I can't imagine it is worth paying many $100s more?! UPDATE: Have had the phone for 3 months now. Still love it. For $150 it is a no-brainer. Only issue I've had is that sometimes the phone doesn't seem to want to transition from wifi signal to wireless. It eventually transitions, but is not seamless. Have tried lots of different settings, don't think the issue is on my end. Maybe it has to do with the strength of signal from Cricket? But not really a big deal. Also, the case Spigen makes for this phone is just great. The nice thing is, if i drop this phone or wreck it, for just $150 I've go a brand new, great replacement! I won't be going back to Apple iPhone....
reviews.review_header: The Honor 6x is a ton of phone for not a ton of money. I can heartily recommend it.

reviews.review_text: This is my initial early review. Moving from a huge 6'' cheap ZTE Zmax Pro to this Honor 6x This is a solid little phone. It comes with Android 7 or else immediately upgrades to that (it took about 45 minutes of initial loading and setup). It is loaded with Huawei's UI and not stock android, but it doesn't really have bloat ware or a ton of special suites. Even so I installed the Microsoft Launcher which in my experience is the cleanest, most practical launcher that organizes things much better than the standard UI. With 3 GB of RAM it runs fairly quickly, downloaded and installed about 70 apps in only a few minutes. Even running some heavier games like SimCity it handles with relative ease. The camera is nice, the dual lens means you can take portrait pictures while putting the background out of focus. The screen is brighter than most phones I've had but the auto-adjustment is a little sensitive and can quickly go bright or dark. Here are my initial Pros and Cons: Cons: - The screen times out in about 8 seconds and I have adjusted every single setting to make this 30 seconds to a minute but it still isn't right. I reset all the settings and that helped a little, now it will go maybe 15 seconds, but certainly doesn't stay lit the 30 seconds or minute that I have it set to. This makes reading very annoying as it will just go black and then lock. And since you can't just tap the screen to wake up or swipe back into it (another con I mention below) it takes extra time with the lock screen or fingerprint sensor. - There is one speaker located at the bottom right of the phone. This makes holding the phone in landscape mode while watching a video mostly mute the sound. It should be located on the front or the back. Even holding the phone upright I found my hand or finger often covered the speaker. - In order to use the fingerprint sensor on the back you have to lock the phone with either a pin or password. If you restart the phone you can't get right into it without entering the pin. And if you use another launcher, (like I do) their security setting (like a pattern) doesn't matter because it still takes you to the phone's pin screen. (so there's always two lock screens) - You can't tap or double tap on the screen to view the lock screen, (something that is standard in new versions of android) and you can't swipe in simply without entering your pin - No NFC - No Dual-band Wifi (like 5Ghz) - The "dual" sim slots is a combo port for SD card / sim card. So you can have 1 Sim and 1 SD Card - No physical navigation buttons, just a designated navigation bar at the bottom of the display that fades and disappears with full screen apps. This unfortunately eats up screen real estate, makes it a tad slower to actually navigate and takes away easier navigation by touch. - the front facing camera seems too saturated with it's colors, everything is very high contrast - Doesn't have the newer C-type USB - Since it isn't stock Android you can't allow apps to take over certain things. For example I use textra (a texting app) and on my last two phones I could use the notifications and pop up menu of textra, with the look and feel that is customizable in textra for incoming texts. But this still uses the phone's build in notification settings. Pros: - Decent Camera - Quick finger-print reader - Processor and Ram combo are very good for this price point, very happy with how fast apps load - 32 GB of storage, this is mostly standard these days but there are still budget phones that come with 8 or 16 - Bright Screen, easily readable in sunlight or bright areas - Pretty quick charge for a micro-USB - Seems to have all the T-Mobile bands - Battery - everyone said the battery was great and lasts a day and half or 2 days, but I found with maybe an hour of gaming and then general use, news, twitter, some texting and such it still needed a charge by the afternoon. Maybe I'm a heavy user. - General look and feel Overall even though I found a number of things I didn't like or aren't included (NFC, Dual band etc) this is a good phone for the price. It will handle just about any apps or games you want, and with 32GB of storage you will have plenty of room. It takes good pictures and videos. The antenna is ok, I've had better reception on other phones but it's fine. It's a good looking phone and seems well built. The user interface was ok, but I didn't like it that much, as I said I installed Microsoft Launcher which is wonderful.
reviews.review_header: A well built phone that offers plenty for the price.

reviews.review_text: This is the second phone I've purchased by Huawei. The first one was a honor 5x, which worked brilliantly, but was not pool-resistant. Shortly after I purchased the honor 6x, which seemed to work similarly and occasionally better, the shape was slimmer (I will miss the attractive brick qualities of the 5x). Where the 6x really stood out was the camera. I had not realized how nice it was until I went on a trip to Tahoe and started playing around with it(photo below). In fact my brother and I were so impressed with the phone, he ended up getting a 6x as well. The one negative I will say is the Bluetooth can be moody at times.

I really want to like this phone- the size and feel are great, price was awesome, plenty of memory for what I need, but... I have found it to be super glitchy and getting more so the longer I have it- screen unresponsive, going black, freezing, etc. The worst has been the camera. Everytime I open that app, the screen either stays black, or whatever I have the camera pointed at is frozen on the screen. As a parent and a teacher of young children, I need a camera that can turn on and take a picture as fast as my kids move! And last night, I almost missed being able to record my son's band competition- the screen kept freezing, I had to restart the phone several times, the screen would "grey out", home button wouldn't work, and power button wouldn't work. The only reason I was able to record the performance was because a technical difficult caused a delay in their start time. But it was literally at least 5 minutes before I could get the camera to function correctly. If you need to be able to take pictures or videos quickly, this might not be the best choice.. :(
reviews.review_header: OK, if you can put up with the glitches...

reviews.review_text: Had this phone for 2 weeks now and love it. It is a replacement for my Huawei P8 Lite which i used for 3 years and was impressed by the quality of phone for the price range. I don't mind the EMUI that Huawei adds on. I think it has a rather handy set of tools out of the box. Photos are much better than my previous P8 and also enjoy using the fingerprint sensor. Very easy to use. One touch and it unlocks. I have wondered if this was just a gimmick. But i asked others to try unlocking the phone by touching and they could not. So definitely quite a secure method of accessing. If you are the kind that does not want to pay for a phone with an arm and a leg, this is a phone for you. It is unlocked so will work internationally and locally with carriers like AT&T and T-Mobile. Update: Jan 2018. I still love it. Some have asked Android version. The one I have is 7.0 Nougat.
reviews.review_header: Great device for the price range.

reviews.review_text: I love this phone! It replaces a Samsung Galaxy S4. The fingerprint sensor works perfectly and is such a convenient way of getting into the phone quickly and not having to remember a password. Battery life is incredible; seems like it goes on and on forever. Camera quality is beyond perfect. It takes beautiful pictures and videos too! My friends and I just got back from an Alaskan cruise. We were comparing pictures and one of them commented that the quality and clarity of my pictures were much better than her iPhone pics! Although I had never heard of the Huawei Honor 6X cellphone, I decided to take a chance based on the 5-Star ratings and reviews, and I am so glad I did!
reviews.review_header: Happy, happy, happy with this phone!

reviews.review_text: After dealing with unreliable phone service providers (I'm looking at you, Virgin Mobile and Straight Talk) and glitchy phones (I'm looking at you LG Volt and Volt 2 as well a a Samsung Galaxy phone) that consistently contained way too much bloatware (because of said unreliable phone services) and eventually started to die faster and faster, I decided to do a lot of research for a few months before deciding which phone brand and service provider I would switch to. I was initially looking at the Honor 8, but the price was a bit steep for me, so I decided to wait. I'm a firm believer in that you don't need to spend $400+ on a good phone and that the best phone service doesn't have to cost you hundreds of dollars a month. After taking a small break from research, I came back to Amazon and found this phone last week. The price was nice, and while the reviews were mixed, I decided to take a plunge and buy this phone after watching a few videos about it and reading articles about it. I also ditched Virgin Mobile in favor of Cricket (which has been amazing so far! I actually get reception at home, in the middle of my rural/ghost town). The phone arrived two days after I ordered it and the battery was at 60% battery out of the box, giving me the ability to activate it right away and play around with it. A lot of these reviews complain about the operating system skin/EMUI (along with various other things), but honestly, it's not all that different to me. Maybe it's because I adapt really quickly to things and have a fast learning curve (and am pretty tech savvy for not knowing all the correct terminology). Before I list positives and negatives, let me just say that the most important things to me in a phone are internal storage space, processing power, and battery life. Oh, and of course, customization capabilities (like changing font faces), GPS, and a nice set of front and back facing cameras. I don't care so much about having to learn or adapt to a new style of system, since I enjoy learning about them and getting used to them on my own. POSITIVE POINTS 1. Internal Storage: which allowed me to uninstall the useless apps that were pre-installed. The capacity also allowed me install all the apps that I previously had spread out between different devices (because each one had bloatware that couldn't be uninstalled or disabled). It also gave me the ability to add new games/apps that I've been wanting to try. Even after installing all the apps I wanted to, as well as migrating data from apps I previously used (including: Discord, Kingdom Hearts Unchained X, Sword Art Online: Memory Defrag, Mystic Messenger, Sailor Moon Drops, Alphabear. Pokemon GO [which I can actually use AR mode, finally], TsumTsum, Steven Universe: Soundtrack Attack, Tumblr, Instagram, Snapchat, LINE, LINE Camera, Layout, Bitmoji, LINE Webtoon, Zedge, and Huawei Themes), I still have more than half of my internal storage space free. 2. Battery Life/Processing Power: if you read through my long list of apps above, then you can guess I enjoy a fair amount of mobile gaming and a little bit of social media in my spare time. This phone doesn't slow down and doesn't overheat while I play for hours when I get the chance for it. The battery of course, drains, but not anywhere near as quickly as my old phones/devices did. After a full charge, I was able to enjoy 8-10+ hours of gaming and switching from app to app without having to worry about recharging. When the phone isn't in use, the battery life is even more impressive, barely draining from hour to hour. I went from having to charge my previous devices multiple times a day or having them die out on me, to only needing to charge once a day, usually at night/when I go to bed. I also love not having to deal with crashing apps/glitchy apps. 3. Cameras: perhaps because my previous experiences with phone cameras have been full of disappointments, I can easily say that the cameras on this phone are 100% fantastic. Even though I don't take a lot of selfies, I do take lots of pictures of things aside from myself (like nature, food, arts/crafts, scenery, etc.), and the images come out crystal clear and pretty vibrant, unless it's in a low-light setting. Of course, I rarely would even think of taking a photo in that environment, so that doesn't bother me or dull my enthusiasm for this phone. I look forward to being able to play around with my cameras more. 4. Fingerprint Scanner: I just think this is a really cool feature, now no one but me can unlock my phone, which is pretty awesome. I have had no problems with it and setting it up was really simple and quick. 5. GPS/Compass: Since playing Pokemon Go, this became something of great importance to me. My previous devices were absolutely terrible when it came to playing this game. However, this phone has given me the smoothest experience with absolutely no GPS-related problems. 6. Graphics: To be concise, the graphics/display quality on this phone is easily a 10/10 for me. Youtube videos and all my game/apps look sharp and clear. The colors aren't dull or overly vibrant. NEUTRAL POINTS 1. Customization: If you, like me, enjoy changing fonts, then you'll need to install an app, like Huawei Themes, which provides a nice selection of font faces to use. It's a bit of a shame that there aren't options other than the default font pre-installed, but this doesn't bother now that I have an app for that. 2. Speaker: I usually use my headphones, but on the random occasion that I decide not to, I will admit, the speakers tend to be on the quieter side until you turn the volume up 70% or more. It's not that big a deal, but I thought to just put that out there for honesty's and informing others' sake. 3. I am used to having the option to move an app's data from the internal storage to an SDcard. This phone, as far as I've explored, doesn't provide the option to do so. This doesn't bother me because I have plenty of internal storage for apps and plenty of external storage for everything else, so this is just something I thought to note. NEGATIVE POINT 1. Not enough case options, though this doesn't reflect so much on the phone's manufacturer as it does on those who manufacture phone cases. I just really want to be able to buy a clear plastic case for this phone (for decoden) and character cases (like Rilakkuma , Gudetama, or Stitch or just in general, cute cases), but I can't because there aren't any. I had to settle for a basic, dual layer case (the case provides really nice protection though). Just in case any of you need a case, here's the link: Honor 6X Case with Built-in Stand, SPARIN Rugged Dual Layer Cases for Huawei Honor 6X 2017 with [360 Degree Ring Stand] [Corner Protection ].
reviews.review_header: A truly outstanding phone, for an amazing price.

reviews.review_text: I won't rehash the tech specs and other readily available information. I bought this phone as a temporary replacement while my main phone was being repaired. That phone was an LG V10. Overall, I found this phone to be great. It has a good looking display. The octo-core processor can easily handle everyday tasks. The GPU was adequate to play most mobile games without issue. Call quality was great and I had no issues with that. This phone has an amazing camera with great software for this price point. If you are looking for a budget phone to take great pictures with, this may fit that bill for you. The battery life on this phone is great! You can easily get through a day without a charge with typical use. I was very impressed with the battery life of this phone. There are other great features like dual sim or adding an SD card. My cons of this phone would include: no Gorilla glass, you will want to purchase a screen protector. Sound quality is subpar to me. My LG V10 has a DAC converter and produced great sound. Bottom line: for the price point, you are getting an amazing budget smart phone with a great camera and long battery life.
reviews.review_header: Not perfect but has an amazing dual camera and long battery life. Great budget phone!

reviews.review_text: Was hesitant to get this considering how cheap it was since with most electronics you get what you pay for. Caught a case of the fumbles and dropped my Galaxy S7e and cracked the screen. Didn't have insurance on it since I've never broken a phone before so needed a temp phone to hold me over until new models come out early/mid next year. WOW have I been surprised! The fingerprint sensor works better than my S7 and this 6X seems to run just as if not faster for what I use it for. Calls are clear on both ends and it works great on AT&T 4G. Not a big photo person but the camera does take great pics when I do use it not to mention lots of editing options. For an "economy" phone I was not expecting much from the speaker but again was amazed; sound is great too. It's not HTC boom sound but hey no phone is but HTC. The battery? The battery is unbelievable. Another huge surprise. Was in the habit of putting my phones on charge overnight, and sometimes during the day, but actually have not had to every night with the 6X. It's like the energizer bunny and just keeps going and going and going. Have been so impressed with this phone that as it stands I will continue using it and forego spending money on another major name flagship phone for now. The 6X for under $200 (cost me barely over $100 after Amazon rewards points) or between $650 - $1000 for another big name flagship that in reality would not be any better in a substantial way? hmmm that's a tough one ;)
reviews.review_header: No Cons yet; I LOVE it!

reviews.review_text: Its OK for a budget phone. I paid alot less for mine and was happy using it for a while. EMUI was not my thing at all, i prefer a more stock android so I used Googles launcher and it made it alot easier to use. One thing that really sucked was it did not want to work with my Moto 360 watch. I tried everything I could and still had alot of blue tooth issues and could not get them to clear up. Sometimes it would just drop devices and would never reconnect at all. Another was the reception i buildings was worse than my much older Moto X pure that I switched back to after it finally received Nougat. I really like having NFC which this phone does not but for a budget phone that was expected. The camera is on par with alot of budget phones but my sons cheap Samsung outshoots this camera by far. Charged super slow... Other than those things its actually very good performing. It never felt like it got too bogged down and felt snappy 99% of the time. Loved the finger print sensor, it unlocked the phone really quickly. Battery lasted a long time.
reviews.review_header: I paid alot less for mine and was happy using it for a while

reviews.review_text: Don't waste your money on this. This thing is as slow as a slug, UI will crash every now and then. You can never do multitasking. I brought this thinking it would work better than my Honor 3C but this thing is worst. Wonder how it's 3G RAM cannot uphold basic multitasking.
reviews.review_header: Slow as a slug. Don't waste money on this.

reviews.review_text: Great phone for the money. Bought on a sale for $190. I am average phone user. I just need basic/everyday apps. And this phone does every regular thing i need and more just fine. Solid phone and I've been very happy with my purchase especially for the price. For under two hundred bucks I wasn't expecting a whole lot, but I am very satisfied with this phone, no real complaints...and it's unlocked!!! I am T-mobile customer and I put in SIM and phone was connected to network and ready to go. Only MINOR cons for me: wifi doesn't do dual band. so no 5ghz connection. & no image/camera stabilization which sometimes can bother. loud speaker could be better (but previoulsy I was used to HTC one m8 with stereo speakers), and wish EMUI had a lil more cosmetic customization PRO's: display is great, processing speed has been great, battery life has been good, dual camera, finger print unlock, Android and apps have run just fine, not over $800 I was considering another flagship phone. I had a previous flagship, HTC one m8. But $800-900 for the new galaxy that will only last for a year or so before new model is released...flagship phone was just way too much to justify for my average use. Don't get me wrong. The new galaxy was pretty. but i wasn't blown away by it when I tried out in store for about twenty minutes. processing and display really wasn't much different from this Huaweii.

I have had this phone for about a month and use it as my main phone. The screen is bright and legible in sunlight with the auto ambient light feature generally working well. The fingerprint sensor works very well. Sound quality is very good. The phone easily lasts more than a day, seems more like two. Build quality is very nice. My only real issue is the built-in email program. You have the option of seeing the mail from one account at a time or all of them at once. I keep choosing the latter, but the program keeps defaulting to the former. I could use the Gmail program which would solve this, but i don't want Google reading through my mail. There is a very helpful guy online [webcazine] who answers questions about the honor 8 which generally apply to the honor 6 as well and he says that the email program is supposed to remember the last choice and keep it. So this appears to be a software bug. And i have not been able to "cast" the phone screen to my TV even though I have a ROKU which is supposed to be miracast compatible and this phone is supposed to have miracast from what i can tell. And there does not appear to be a full product guide for the honor 6, although they have guides for the honor 8. These last 3 reasons are responsible for only giving 4 stars instead of 5. I will say that the online and phone support is open 7 days a week with almost no hold time and they try to solve your problems. In general I am impressed that this phone is a great value. If it was waterproof it would be perfect. ** After 5 months This phone is not a good as I thought and I am removing a star. Two problems have arisen. First, my Garmin stopped connecting to my phone about 2 months ago. Garmin seems to have done their due diligence by keeping me informed about the problem after I contacted them and the sending me an email telling me that the problem had been solve, working with Huawei engineers (the problem was not just with the Honor 6 but all Huawei phones), but that the fix would need to come from the Huawei side. Perhaps it was just passing the blame, but calls to Huawei were not informative. They were answered but the Huawei spokespeople (who are easy to reach but less informed that I would like) would neither confirm nor deny that they knew about the problem. They told me that an upgrade would fix the problem, without saying when an upgrade would occur, and since they didn't indicate that they even knew about the problem I do not believe that they could have known that an upgrade to fix it was coming. This was very disappointing. One of my reasons in getting the phone was to have more compatibility than my prior Windows phone, and using the phone with the Garmin vivoactive was an important consideration because the windows phone had only mixed compatibility with the Garmin. Right now, there is zero compatibility between the phone and the watch. The second problem is that the fingerprint reader stopped working. After cleaning it off and reinstalling my fingerprint, it is working again, but I wonder if I will need to repeat this every 3 or 4 months.
reviews.review_header: Generally good, but some software issues and poor support

reviews.review_text: I've been using this phone for a couple of weeks now, and I am very happy with my purchase. It was a bit of an adjustment as I was transitioning from a far more "budget" phone, so this one blew me out of the water. Everything runs super fast, and I haven't run into any incompatibility issues. After updating the OS to the latest version, I was able to use every other launcher I've tried (settled on one that emulates a Win 10 OS). By far, my favorite feature is the fingerprint scanner on the back; it immediately wakes my phone up with even a very quick tap of my finger, bypassing the lock screen so I can get back to what I was doing without delay. The cameras are pretty good, and the default camera app comes with all sorts of auto-editing software to up your selfie game, if that's what you're into. The back cameras take very good pictures, with the additional camera being good for adding a bit of depth, if nothing else. One of the features that is just a nice addition is the Eye Comfort mode, that when turned on reduces the blue light emitted by the screen, which helps a lot if you like to use your phone before bed (like myself). Bluetooth and wifi and all that stuff works fine, as you would expect, and I was set up pretty much immediately after inserting my T-mobile Sim card. Not much else to say, it does what it says and runs everything I've tried rather well. Will update if I start having problems with it

This phone has great specs, and it runs well. Unfortunately, after owning it for 6 months, and always keeping it in its case with a glass screen protector, I noticed that the phone was substantially bent. My wife had just purchased one of these a few weeks before I noticed the bend. I looked at hers and it was also bent. This lead me to look into the different stress tests that have been done on the 6x. It turns out, the 6x has failed bend tests across the board. I contacted Huawei and they agreed to replace my phone. However, when I asked them about options for upgrading, since the new phone would inevitably bend, the customer service manager suggested "you could just sell this phone to one of your friends and buy a different one." Huawei has the potential to really compete with the bigger phone companies, but they need to take responsibility for flawed design and recall/replace their defective product with something that will last more than a few months.
reviews.review_header: PHONE STARTS BENDING WITHIN A FEW WEEKS

reviews.review_text: Wanted to gift my wife. I have a Oneplus 5 and wanted to buy similar one. but I was clear about what I needed: Prerequisite - Android, (I hate iPhones) 1. Faster phone 2. Good Camera 3. Decent Battery 4. Large screen 5. Speedy internet and also WiFi 6. Decent Brand. 7. Memory Slot How do I use - We are not gamers but heavily access internet, GPS, social sites and music. I researched all the small and medium brands and phones under $200 and shortlisted with 3 options - LeEco, Huawei and ZTE. With almost the same hardware combination, I decided to read reviews about HH 6X. Its way better than 5X and reviews in amazon, google were compelling. 1. Phone is faster than the 5X and similar to LeEco and ZTE brands. I researched them in walmart and stores nearby. 2. Camera is decent, poor light is a problem, but ok for a limited use. 3. Battery is ok, per my use, a full day is good so that I can charge by the night. But charging is as usual rate, wish they had the dash faster charging. 4. Screen and speed of apps acceptable over WiFi. I like wider screens so that you can view a little larger font, without much eye strain.. 5. Huawei is a decent brand, I see lots of phone these days, 6. I wanted memory slot to hold more photos and music. Now I have an unlimited supply, 64 GB card slot. 7. I wanted Wifi Calling, but TMobile doesnt provide it for now. Why 4 stars ? 1. At almost the same price, ZTE provides better audio and a bit better hardware. 2. 12 MP camera, Zooming in some of the pics were not so good, ZTE offered 16 MP. 3. Battery non removable. Definitely 5 stars if the same phone was sold about $40-$50 less.
reviews.review_header: Good phone, but a touch pricy.

reviews.review_text: The SILVER Honor 6x phones do NOT have voicemail notification. In other words, if someone leaves you a voicemail, you have no idea. And it only shows me sometimes when I missed a call. You need to check your voicemail throughout the day, everyday. I've missed several phone calls/vm msgs and didn't know until a few days later that I have 12 vm msgs on my phone, from my employer, parents, etc. I called Huawei and they confirmed that the silver phones were made earlier than the gold ones and that they don't have vm notification, and my carrier (T mobile) also confirmed that it doesn't have the (necessary!!) feature. If you buy a silver one and you do have vm notification, my apologies; someone is obviously fibbing somewhere, but it isn't me!

Great phone, no issue, it allows me to internet tethering without having to pay ( I use cricket wireless). I was not able to tether using the honor 5x, so this great, no root needed. Get a case and tempered glass protector as this phone is may be forgiving to being dropped.
reviews.review_header: great for tethering on cricket wireless

reviews.review_text: They really are not kidding about the battery life of this device. I have been using it constantly since I got it. I have had it for 2 days and I have yet to charge it since I got it. It is now down to 54%. I am truly amazed. The touch sensor is amazingly fast. The camera is clear and can zoom in extremely far. I used it to take a picture from the back of a college classroom to get some information on the board up front and when I zoom in on it I can read extremely fine print. AMAZING! I am not usually as excited about electronics but this phone by far exceeds all of my expectations! Would buy it again in a heartbeat!
reviews.review_header: High end phone at middle price! Better than expected!

reviews.review_text: I bought the phone because I was already sick of Apple and after seeing how they were slowing all their phones down from 5 through 7, That was the final straw. I did a lot of research on the Honor 6X before I decided to buy it. There's a lot I like about the phone so I am gonna break it down for everyone real quick: It's 5.5 inches tall, The only iPhone bigger than that is the X. Comes with 64 GB of memory and can be expanded by another 200+ GB by putting an SD card in the second SD card slot. Yes, that's right, There's a second SD card slot and you can expand the memory. Can't do that on an iPhone either. The battery is fantastic and can last an easy 24 hours before you have to charge it. I say that honestly because I put this phone through the ringer - Playing games, Videos, Music, Taking photos and all that jazz. The battery was still strong and just laughably puts the iPhone to shame because, on a good day, It's gonna last 8-10 hours top. The operating system runs smoothly, I have no issues with it. I love that I can search google from the home screen without having to open the web browser. Everything is readily available from the jump so I don't have to go through a hassle of using it. It fits fine in my hand, Doesn't feel heavy or bulky at all. That was a concern for me because it's a lot larger than my old iPhone but after a few minutes, You don't even notice it. Honestly, I don't know why more people haven't tried this phone out. It's bigger, more (and expandable) memory, The battery runs longer and it works phenomenally. Yeah, I get that I may be coming off as a paid reviewer but I am not. I genuinely like this phone and I won't be going back to Apple.

I've had this phone for 10 months. It's fast, takes great pics and videos, it's slim, it's not heavy and it has more than enough memory. I like it better than the Samsung 6s edge I had before it. I dropped this honor 6x 5 months ago and cracked the screen, it still works perfectly. I'm replacing it with another 6x it because I am embarrassed to show the cracked screen when I need to share stuff at work. I love this phone.

I've used this phone for about 6 months now, and I feel I'm in a good position to write a review. First of all it looks good, and comes with a nice screen protector that has already saved me a lot of scratches. I've dropped it a couple of times on concrete, and I got some bumps on the corners but screen came out fine with no cracks. Camera is great with excellent daylight pictures and decent low-light results. It can take a while to startup and focus, so not really good for the spur of the moment instant shot. Call quality and controls are decent. My negatives start with the finish of the back cover. The rough metallic finish is very smooth in the palm, particularly when my palm is dry. This means the phone easily slips from my hand unless I grip it firmly. It can be annoying when you're just trying to pick up the phone. The software is not that great; especially the phone book and calendar. The phone book has no easy way to save contacts to Google by default, so in the end I had to turn off the phone contacts completely so it can only save to Google. It also has a "merge" feature that seems to force all the merged contacts to the phone. Well, one fine day I woke up to find all my contacts GONE. I had to restore from Google, but all the merged records could not be recovered. FInally, I discovered that 32GB is nowhere near enough. Now I'm getting these annoying reminders to free space whenever I try to do something. I have to delete files to make the reminders go away. Overall a nice phone and good value for the price. The flaws I observed can be fixed without changing the cost.
reviews.review_header: Good phone, but with some quirky behavior

reviews.review_text: I am learning more and more that you don't always have to pay a premium for a great quality phone. I never liked the idea of spending to much on a phone, but I wanted more than what I was used to. I came across the reviews and decided to go for it considering the good price. I was blown away because I was not expecting this phone to be this good. The battery is REALLY GOOD. My favorite feature is probably the finger print unlock scanner; IT IS FAST. With phones like these, at this price, I see no reason for me to upgrade to a $600+ phone when I can have it all in an affordable $300 phone like this..
reviews.review_header: These phones just get better and better

reviews.review_text: Let me start off by saying I'm not a gamer or interested in watching Netflix on a phone. I don't do any photography with a phone, unless at the most casual level. I bought this to replace my aging Nexus 5, and so far I couldn't be more pleased. I'm not sure if the increase in battery life is due to its larger capacity or the software update to 7.0. I'm getting just shy of two full days between charges. If you're a gamer or heavy user YMMV. I do wish it had wireless charging like my old Nexus, but I knew that was the case before I bought it, so no stars deducted. Having said that, when using the supplied wall charger, I go from 20% to full in about 90 minutes. I've only had this phone for a couple of weeks, but I'm very satisfied. A great deal for a bit under $200.
reviews.review_header: and so far I couldn't be more pleased. I'm not sure if the increase in battery ...

reviews.review_text: I've had Samsungs and iPhones etc... They all break or something stupid like the camera wont focus. The honor 6x seems a better phone all around and the camera is great! If it breaks just buy another. Frankly, the camera was my biggest concern and I'm very happy with this one..best I've had yet. I had a Blu vivo air and the camera was lousy. Anyway, this phone is great. The only con against it is it gas 2.4 GHz wifi only. It's not a big deal but I wanted that. I never used NFC so no loss there. It has everything else including FM radio. I bought the US model and it does have a gyroscope. Many sites have that wrong in soec sheet. Great phone, a year ago it was $250.

This phone has a lot going for it, and I've listed some of the things I like below. However, I'm having so many issues with it!! I bought this when my last phone breathed it's last breath a couple of weeks ago. It's a pretty phone, but I've had problems with it from day one. First, the fingerprint sensor only recognizes my print less than half the time I use it. I end up locking myself out because no matter what I do, the sensor thinks I'm not me! Second, the phone started freezing up within a couple days of receiving it. The screen will go dark and no buttons will work, not even the power button. I've restarted the phone a bunch of times over the last two weeks and it only fixes the problem temporarily. Third, when it's not frozen, it lags SO MUCH. I'll press a button and literally nothing happens for at least 10 seconds or more. Again, restarting the phone stops this temporarily. It does take gorgeous pictures in basically any light, which is a drastic change from my last phone's garbage pictures! The audio is pretty good too, which is nice! There are so many cool things this phone can do and I really want everything to work properly! I'm going to check out the manufacturer customer service now to see what can be done.
reviews.review_header: It's got some good things but mine is having so many issues!

reviews.review_text: This phone has been, by far, my favorite phone to date (I have owned Apple, Samsung, Blackberry, Nokia, and others). The screen is very vibrant and responsive to touch. The fingerprint sensor on the back will almost instantaneously unlock and turn on the phone. On average, I get anywhere from 4 to 5 days out of the battery, but I am not a heavy phone user and your experience will probably be different. I have recently begun using it with a smartwatch and because of that, I do have to leave the Bluetooth switched on and that has been reducing my battery life to around 3-4 days. I also make it a habit of keeping all of the features of the phone (or any phone that I own) switched off such as the wi-fi, GPS, etc. in order to prolong the battery life. The phone also has two different battery saver modes that will extend that life even further if you wish to engage them. The camera is more than adequate for my needs and I have no complaints. I am currently using the phone with Cricket Wireless and have experienced absolutely no problems with it. Phone has full Android functionality and is kept updated. If I had to be picky just to find something wrong with the phone, it would be speaker as I do not think it's that great. However, I rarely need to use it, so it's a non issue. Overall, if you want an outstanding phone that will not break the bank and will not keep you tied to a specific cell phone provider, give this phone a try. Why spend $800 to $1000 for Apple or Samsung when you can have one of these?
reviews.review_header: Awesome phone at a great price

reviews.review_text: I decided to go with this phone after I had issues with two Moto g5 plus units I had ordered a month ago and in my honest opinion, this Huawei Honor 6X blows it out of the water! After owning nothing but black phones I opted for white and gold, and it doesn't disappoint. The gold adds a touch of style and class. It is almost like a light champagne gold. The display is a little bigger than the G5 plus and offers awesome colors. There are thin black bezels around the display on the white variant but they are also found on most other phones as well, even iPhone. They definitely aren't that thick like they were on the Honor 5X though. You can set color temperatures (custom, cool, warm) and even turn on a blue light filter for bedtime viewing, which is a major plus! Also, the camera is an absolute steal given the price point of the phone! The aperture effect is awesome thanks to the dual camera set up, it shoots clear and detailed pictures (photo sample provided), it has a lot of nice editing features like filters, picture tools, etc.! It doesn't have 4k video but I don't mind that since I don't shoot much video on my phone. But having the slomo video option is a plus! Although this phone does not have an ambient display like Moto phones, it has a nice LED notification light (color can be customized)! I also like the new update to EMUI 5.0, Android nougat 7.0 update. The UI is iPhone esque but it is nice! I have had zero issues with performance or lag at all as of now. I was a little worried after watching a durability test with the honor 6x on YouTube but as long as you have a screen protector and a case, and don't try to bend the phone on purpose, you will be fine! After being loyal to Motorola, I must say I think Huawei has won over a new customer! Overall, I can easily recommend this phone especially if you're on a budget! You get a very nice phone with top specs under $250 with the Honor 6X.
reviews.review_header: Very nice phone, better than the Moto G5 Plus IMO!

reviews.review_text: Great phone and for ~$150, you'd be hard-pressed to find a better deal. Pros: The screen is (in my opinion) is the perfect size and has great color. The cameras are just great. Rear camera takes amazing pictures in daylight and with the flash. Low-light pictures are better than most phones well into the $300 price range. Front camera is good enough. The phone is very quick. I've not experienced any lag in any app and the phone will reboot in under 10 seconds. Battery life exceeded my expectations. You can really trust that "1.5 days of heavy use" claim they make. Speakers are loud and good quality. In-call volume and clarity is great... But don't expect your music to sound wonderful at max volume. But... There's a headphone jack! Also, EMUI 5 is not a bad interface by any means. Cons: No fast-charge... Charging takes quite a few hours. So many built-in apps. Some that can't be uninstalled without root... Another option would be to hide them with a third-party launcher like Nova (prime) It's difficult to make photos save to the SD card. Switching the default storage location to the SD card in Settings seems to cause some apps to glitch out, so it may be best to use a third-party camera app that has the option to chose the storage location. The preinstalled screen protector was placed on slightly sideways. Doesn't seem to be wide enough to actually cover the entire screen, regardless. I would recommend replacing it.
reviews.review_header: At this price, I wouldn't hesitate to buy.

reviews.review_text: Huawei, has their own UI on the phone that is slightly different from Stock Android and it really makes this phone POP. The Speed is wonderful with 3gig of RAM. and nice bit of storage. It is expected to get the Android 8 update in at end of Jan 2018 so I am pumped about that! Already the flow and speed is much better than i have seen on other android phones. No bloatware was installed so I think makes a hug difference. I purchased it as a replacement for a ZTE MAX Pro that i dropped several times and finally killed, and this one is much faster. The battery life seems to be VERY VERY good, I played games on it for 1/2 day and the battery still had 60% left ( note i was playing One More Brick - so its not very CPU intensive ). My daily phone is a windows phone lumia 950 xl, but since Microsoft killed off the windows mobile os, i wanted to test a Huawei lower end phone before jumping in on the Mate 10 PRO.. Well I am very impressed!! I will pik up the Mate 10 pro and give this one to my kid. Great Product, yes I would recommend it to someone to purchase.
reviews.review_header: Very nice phone!! Love the Quality Easy of Use and Nice UI

reviews.review_text: Love it. I wish I knew about this phone before I bought my LG-G4 a couple of years ago for which I paid way much more than the Honor 6X and died on me less than a year down the road due to system update causing me to lose a lot of my data which was stored in the phone. The LG-G4 was insured (for an extra $10 / month in my contract) so it was replaced with a refurbished model of the same. Guess what! A couple of months down the road the refurbished LG-G4 died on me again!!! the LG company played dumb. I had no idea that this phone was out there, I didn't even know what an "unlocked phone" until a trusted friend talked to me about the Honor 6X and highly recommended it. Solely upon my trusted friend's recommendations when time came to choose another phone from my carrier or buy mine, I chose the later option and bought my H. 6X. Let me tell you: This was one of the best decisions I've ever made. I use it almost 5 months now with no issues whatsoever. The battery is excellent, lasts me almost twice as much than my previous high end / more expensive LG model for same / compatible type of usage. Downloads and updates seem to happen in half speed, blue tooth radius extends twice as far, as well as wi-fi receptivity. Just to offer you an example: with my previous more expensive LG-G4 phone when I went one room away - in any direction - from the location where my wi-fi router is located the signal was dropped / lost. With my Honor 6X I connect to my wi-fi in my car, in my driveway (!) which was an impossibility with my previous supposingly better brand name phone! The camera of the Honor 6X on paper is of a lesser quality that the camera of my ex- LG phone, yet I haven't really noticed any difference in the quality / clarity / resolution of the pictures the 6X takes. Most excellent pictures! Bottom Line: I'd buy this phone or from this company (Huawei) again if need be with closed eyes, without a second thought!
reviews.review_header: Bottom Line: I'd buy this phone or from this company (Huawei) again if need be with closed eyes, without a second thought!

reviews.review_text: Takes great pics. But as a phone it seems to have occasional freeze up issues (either in camera or Gmail, two places where it hangs or doesn't respond) where I have to close all app,clear some memory, then start the specific app again to perform action. Definitely buy a backside case (not wallet style) as it is safety for drops. A small assortment of pics (Indian food in India, nature from West Virginia) taken by the phone. Thanks for viewing!
reviews.review_header: Decent value for money as a high quality smartphone with nice cameras.

reviews.review_text: Works far better than expected. MUCH faster than my old 5x responding. The UI is smooth and responsive. Although I had to get a smaller sim card going from the 5 to the 6, it didn't take any time to do this. My MicroSD card works with it. The Camera is a big improvement over the 5x, much better quality. - After the update, the UI looks even better, and a new theme was added. I liked them both.

This is exactly what I was looking for. I bought it and popped in my SIM card from T-mobile and it worked right away. The camera is awesome and the while phone I user friendly. It is a great smartphone for the price and I don't feel like I had to sacrifice any features. I had an iPhone before this and a Samsung before that, by far the Huawei is my favorite and a muchhhh better price for me. I also love that its unlocked so when I am traveling I can just buy a cheap SIM card, load $5 on it and make calls and use the internet. The speed of the fingerprint unlocked is so fast!! It unlocks as soon as my finger touches it, I can't even describe how fast it is.
reviews.review_header: Fantastic phone, truly unlocked for various carriers and lighting fast unlock feature!

reviews.review_text: At the price of $150 a week before Christmas, the 6X is a great buy versus rivals like the Moto G5 or G5s , and lesser known phones like Alcatel 4s or ZTE Axion. Other options might be refurbished older Samsungs or Apples. I actually have an Alcatel Idol 3 that has been a very good phone for the last 2 years - Amazing Audio - and I recently was given a rather worn looking used Note 3, which I do like.. I even looked at Samsung 8 and Apple 8 when T-Mobile had them 2-for-1... My son spends smartphone money like water (Sonys mostly) and my daughter is nothing but Apple ( 7s now, looking at the 8 or X). Those just don't offer anything but name prestige for my purposes, since I don't game on a smartphone's tiny screen, and I have laptops and tablets for serious streaming video. I started checking out options under $250 about Dec 1st... I eliminated the Idol 4 even tho I loved the Idol 3, since the 4 is till at $250 vs the 6X, and I knew I would take a 6X given those prices. The Idol 4 comes with VR that doesn't interest me, and the VR is getting poor reviews. Tried the Moto G5S at $249, but its design, weight, and camera were bettered by the 6X. The Moto screen may barely edge out the 6X. A refurb Apple 6 or Samsung S5 did not interest me, but may be an option you could choose. Pro: The Honor 6X has a nice modern design and feel. Battery life is very good for casual streaming. Reception on 4G LTE is at least equal to the Note 4, using T-Mobile. It is either dual sim ( 4G LTE + 2G second sim) or single (4G LTE plus SD memory card). It gets all the T-Mobile bands as far as I can tell, because inside-building reception is pretty good, compared to the Alcatel. The camera is very good, certainly above the Idol 3 and even a notch above the Note 4. Con: I've been spoiled by my Idol 3's JBL audio...nothing even today comes close. And the Idol has a very nice black rendition and good color. But the Idol's reception seems weaker now. The 6X has only decent sound, a bit tinny compared to the Moto G5s. I would rate both of them about a notch below my wife's Moto X Pure, Display quality is good, not brilliant, and slightly "cool blue", as opposed to "warm orange". Blacks seem not black enough for me tho. Still, at that $150 (a price low enough I went for the 2-yr Sq Trade warranty also), I feel this was a good deal. Balances looks, reception on all bands, decent video streaming, battery life....those are some important things I look for.
reviews.review_header: At Holiday Pricing, this is the best I found under my $250 limit...

reviews.review_text: Edit- I've been using this phone for about a month and it still works just as well! The battery life is amazing, the fingerprint scanner is instant, doesn't have issues with freezing, overall just a really great phone! ---------------- I desperately needed a new phone but didn't have a lot to spend, so I spent a few weeks researching which one to get and ended up going with this one. I'm glad I did! It's considered a "budget" phone, but it definitely doesn't seem like one. Doesn't feel cheap, runs smooth, and it's big, but not too big. It came exactly as described, and even had a screen protector already on it, although it was only big enough to cover the screen itself and not the whole front of the phone. That bothered me so I took it off. Completely satisfied with this phone, and am in the process of convincing my fiance to buy the same one haha

Almost perfect. I used to own an Honor 5X for some time before I switched to a Moto G4 Plus, which I still have. My G4 Plus was snappier in about everything compared to the Honor 5X. I was pleasantly surprised that the Honor 6X is actually faster in opening many apps compared to the Moto G4 Plus. I like the shape and form and rounded screen. The camera takes great pictures so far. There is only one thing that bugs me: there is either very poor application of or no oleophobic coating on the screen. It attracts finger prints and moving the finger does not feel smooth at all. I tried two different tempered glass screen protectors but neither of them stay adhered on the visible area of the screen (they lift off 0.5cm all around). I should have left the plastic screen protector on the phone when I got it of course. I just purchased a new set of screen protector (made by Dmax Armor) and it is much better than the actual screen with respect to smudges and finger prints and feel. I'd give this a 4.5 but that's not an option. Great phone, but why do a shortcut on something the consumer has to feel constantly using the phone I don't understand. I'm glad I did a Google search to find a few reports on this shortcoming - otherwise I'd have asked for a replacement.
reviews.review_header: Almost perfect - no or poor oleophobic coating

reviews.review_text: Huawei is a brand that is trusted... for quality, features and value. I bought this for my Dad and he absolutely, positively loves it! He spends all day getting to know it and what it can do, and believe me, worth every penny. Even colleagues who were brand loyal to S**Sung have made serious enquiries into it putting it on their wish-lists and have it in mind as their soon-to-be replacement phone. I set it up for my Dad so I can speak to the solid feel,, not too heavy, but responsive screen and buttons. This is definitely a repeat buy option as I need to replace even my own. Way to go Huawei! You have a winner!

I really like this phone however I can't not connect it to my car and this is a really big deal for me since I drive a lot and I need hands free. I have no issues with switching to my phone provider , the set up was very easy , I'm surprised that this phone did not come with ear plugs.. this phone was 198.00 and now it's 149.00 GOLD MODEL , per amazon I have to return this phone to get the difference ! I hate that I'm returning a great working phone just for the sale price. Dec 28th , I have had this phone for a few weeks now and it keeps rebooting !!!!!!!! The camera don't take good pictures at all .. I'm thinking about returning if it continues to reboot

I like this phone and want to keep it but as some other reviewer noted, "com.google.android.googlequicksearchbox:intereactor will not be able to record right now" keep popping up whenever I use 'Paypal Now' or 'Square'. I'm using those 2 services to received payment and it is really annoying because it keep popping up every 5-10 sec. while phone is attached with card reader. I'll return this phone and probably go back to either LG or Samsung. Too bad this phone itself is very decent.
reviews.review_header: Almost impossible to use this phone if you are Paypal Now or Square user.

reviews.review_text: Bought this phone as a "cheap" replacement for my iphone 6S and wasn't expecting much to be honest. Wow was I wrong. This phone is amazing and has been exceeding my expectations since day 1. Excellent camera, processing speed, battery life, connectivity, aesthetics, and features. Since the switch I now get service in places my iphone never worked and I come home from work with 70% battery left instead of having to charge my phone by lunch. I recommend this phone for anyone looking for a great performance phone at an incredible price.
reviews.review_header: Excellent bang for buck. Very impressed with the Huawei Honor 6X.

reviews.review_text: Great phone. Bought it to replace my iPhone SE. It's very responsive, feels good in my hand, and I love the fingerprint sensor being on the back. I go back and forth between iOS and Android. At this point in time Apple is driving me nuts. They're definitely not worth the premium price with their current product line. For my needs, this phone hits the sweet spot.
reviews.review_header: Great phone. Bought it to replace my iPhone SE

reviews.review_text: Plug and play with T-Mobile. I used the 5x version and this one has much better battery life. The picture quality is about the same though I will say that I took the 5x to Europe last year and took excellent pics. You can either choose to pay less than $200.00 for a high quality phone or hundreds of dollars for a phone that does the same as this one. Huawei is unknown in the US but I saw plenty of advertisements in Europe which if you have never been there, the small stores usually only offer name brand or higher quality than in American stores. Just saying.
reviews.review_header: Excellent Unlocked Phone for T-Mobile Network

reviews.review_text: Purchased this phone as a 'starter phone' for my daughter. I purchased this due to the dual camera setup and CPU speed / capabilities. I have it currently on the AT&T network and it works great. I have been seriously impressed with the phone for its price, so much so I would definitely consider using one myself as a cheap alternative for work etc... It is perfect for multi-media use, text, video chat, and the usual social media of tweenagers. If you are considering this phone for someone who you prefer not to have a $1000 smart phone, I would not hesitate in getting one of these!
reviews.review_header: Fantastic value for money, great multi-media experience and perfect for the price conscious or younger clientele..

reviews.review_text: Pros: solid, decent screen (not great), fast operation, good OS, pretty good camera.
