Cons: speaker is weak, decent screen but washed out, battery is pretty good but if you use the phone with apps or music as you need to charge at least once per day. As just a communication device, that battery will last 2-3 days easy. I listen to a lot of audiobooks and music on the speakers and stream shows as well as work on my phone so sound quality and loudness is important to me which is rarely mentioned in reviews. I had a Alcatel Idol 3 and really enjoyed that phone besides its weaknesses (processor and memory). The H6X is an upgrade on the processor, memory, and OS software. All else is a wash from the I3. But as with all phones like that, the battery became a pain. I looked at the reviews for the Honor 6X and thought this would be a nice upgrade and I was not wrong. The H6X is the same size as the I3 for those video needs and a much faster processor was the main reason for the choice. Screen colors are not as vibrant but still quite nice. Speakers (Super strong point on the I3) are mainstream which in my mind means weak. Unless the speaker is pointing at you or into a hard reflector, the speaker at max volume is merely adequate. I will probably buy a bluetooth speaker if I really want to listen to music or books unlike the I3. I could put the I3 anywhere in my garage or even driveway and clearly hear what ever I wanted. Not so with the H6X. Otherwise, the phone is much faster with tasks, the OS software is a bit more intuitive than the Alcatel OS. One thing that is really annoying with my carrier (Cricket) is they only allow a small selection of phones to become hootspots and this phone is not one the them. This is pretty lame on Crickets part. That has nothing to do with the phone but if you are on Cricket or AT&T (Cricket's supplier) you likely cannot use the hotspot capability which I would assume the phone could easily handle. Overall, a n

As someone who used his iphone 4s until last year Christmas it was about time for a change, and I needed something cheap. I always preferred Android but never bought an Android phone because I would never just throw away a perfectly working phone, but after 5 years of serving me well the screen finally stopped working. Instead of fixing the screen I bought the Honor 6x on sale for USD 140.00 and I've had this phone for 3 weeks, here are some thoughts for my first Android phone: 1) Build Quality: premium, despite the bottom/top to the back of the phone being plastic it feels like metal and looks like metal, it also adds to the lightness of it. It doesn't have that sweet 18:9 aspect ratio as but the device looks magnificent. Tweeting, gaming and watching videos/skyping my wife all feels natural. I would bring this phone rating down for no IP resistance but honestly at USD 140.00 it's worth it. I live in the Cayman Islands so I'm not gonna take it out to the beach and expose it to salt water (at all) and salty air for long periods of time (probably keep it in my bag when I'm with friends) but it has held up pretty good to dust etc especially with a screen protector. As far as durability goes, I dropped this phone at a height of about 3 ft by accident and there wasn't a single scratch on it and everything works fine but I'm not going to durability test it like JerryRigEverything haha (though on his review he shows that this phone is far more fragile than it seems but for USD 140.00 I'm totally fine with that as I treat my devices with care- I ironically say as I drop my phone within the first 3 weeks of purchase). 2) Display: The display is a vibrant 1080p and watching videos on this baby is wonderful. Some complain about the display being washed in colours but honestly I don't see it unless I compare it to an Samsung OLED screen (and even then it's still good). The screen itself is an LCD screen so it'll last longer and won't particularly suffer from burn-ins but you do have to be careful for light bleeding over the years. However, make sure to buy a screen protector on this because there isn't any real gorilla glass (that I can tell) as the screen will scratch rather easily, it comes with a plastic screen protector (because they probably know this) but buy a tempered glass screen protector ASAP as every day usage will scratch this device (thankfully I bought a pair with mine from OMOTON). 3) Interface: I'm not a fan of the EMUI skin, it looks bad and it didn't come with an app drawer (unless you upgraded to Nougat which I did after) but honestly it doesn't matter. I eventually downloaded Nova, Evie and Microsoft launchers and ended up using the Microsoft launcher and it makes the overall experience 100 times better. It feels like a clean, professional phone for both work and gaming and socialising with people I know. Widgets and the like are standard but I love the notification tab stylised by Huawei (super sleek). The fingerprint scanner is quick and accurate with seldom being unable to read my fingerprint but it's great. Please note that if you scratch the fingerprint scanner too much it will render it useless. The LED light in the top Bezel is nifty and easy to tell what's going on, nice and standard and the phone call speaker is completely flushed in line with the screen (and metal) making it not only look good but actually increase the phone lifespan by decreasing the likelihood of dirt etc from settling in. 4) Tasks: It's a quick/snappy device with smooth animations and gets every task I needed done. It packs 3gb of of RAM which allows you to have multiple tabs without slowing (I tried it out with about 10 apps running in background while I played Kingdom Hearts and it was still running fine @2gb RAM still free). I can run excel and create spreadsheets on this phone with relative ease and the splitscreen function works like a charm (on Nougat) when I'm on both twitter (Follow me @WaffleWhiskey ;)) and youtube, overall I haven't had any hiccups (except with the PPSSPP emulator). Primarily Gaming: Games from the appstore run fine but my main form of gaming is in emulation (Note I personally owned the physical games) It handles a lot of things pretty well. I couldn't run Dolphin Emulator to run Super Mario Sunshine for the Gamecube (runs at 4fps) however I've seen videos of people running dolphin on this device so I will try it again on different settings and update here. PSP games run well (30-35 fps with some hiccups here and there) but I've had to fiddle with the settings on the emulator (PPSSPP) to get Kingdom Hearts: Birth By Sleep running perfectly (though gaming on a touchscreen for action rpgs like this is doable, but takes time to get used to). Overall this is fantastic (and yes it runs everything else in between like nes/snes/gbc/gba/nds/nintendo64- been playing Ocarina of Time @35 fps/psx- will test and update/ps2- will test and update though I doubt it will). 5) Camera: Easily the most impressive feature on a USD 140.00 phone. Dual camera setup (THAT ACTUALLY WORKS!- 12mp and 2mp) which is incredibly surprising on a midrange device like this but not only does it look impressive, but it actually is. Huawei did a good job with this camera, I'm not sure if Leica helped them to make this as they did with their other devices but there's nothing (official) said about it on the device. Images are sharp, well detailed and the colours are great which wasn't expected, video is captured at 1080p but it can be shaky if you don't have a steady hand without any Optical Stabilisation. The dual camera setup really adds depth, I wasn't expecting it at first but the photos really do look different when using that second shooter (great for taking pictures of my wife/son). The front facing camera is 8mp and does a fine job of selfies, the camera system/features are both wonderful and somewhat tacky at times with the beauty option but plentiful nonetheless. 6) Storage: At 32gb there's not a super crazy amount that you can do but honestly for someone who isn't into downloading a bunch of games/apps/videos this will be fine. I recommend getting another 32gb of storage (AT LEAST) if you're emulating big games like me/downloading a lot of music like me. I'm currently on a 16gb sd card on top of my phone but upgrading to 128gb in the near future. 7) Battery: Super good @3340 mAh it lasts me about 19-20 hours on a full charge with my brightness fully turned up, 25-27 hours on power saving mode and 80-100 hours on ultra battery saving mode (super impressive but only uses low power usage apps/basic phone functions/browser functions which is fine in this case). What it could've done better: 1) USB-C/Fast Charging- Note that this has Micro USB charging port 2) NFC- I don't use google pay etc but it would've extended its lifetime with me as I would use it in a few years (still on card and paper right now) 3) IP resistance of at least 66 would be appreciated but at this price point I won't complain too much 4) Remove that damned skin, it looks cartooonish and it's rather limiting and similar to iOS- make it an option not a mandatory thing 5) LTE support would be nice but GSM works fine and dandy 6) I don't care about 4k resolution video recording, I'm not a snob, I just wish there was SOME optical stabilisation 7) The build quality is superb for this price point but would appreciate metal buttons to give more satisfying clicks/feels but that's just me nitpicking, the phone's buttons feel great for being plastic and are still satisfying (but not quite as satisfying as metal buttons) 8) Replace the fingerprint scanner with a ceramic scanner, it's a better quality and is resistant to scratches but not too costly if only used on the scanner 9) A better glass for the screen as it's super easy to scratch which is also a huge threat to the front facing 8 mega-pixel camera 10) Follow me on twitter @WaffleWhiskey I know I'm shameless Thanks Amazon for the delivery and thanks Huawei for the fantastic phone!
reviews.review_header: Quick, Snappy and Feels Premium- MUST BUY!

reviews.review_text: It's only been 2 weeks, but I am 110% satisfied! I was with Sprint for 6 years with the unlimited plan. Got the newest Samsung Galaxy every time I signed the new contract so I am kind of spoiled. I like this phone just as much as any I've ever had. Feels great in my hand, very smooth and responsive. Doesn't lock up or have any glitches yet. Plays my games beautifully without slowing down. This phone is a fantastic value in my opinion. Moved from a contract plan to Cricket Unlimited. I couldn't be happier at this point. Some things a little different than the Androids I've been used to such as having to swipe the phone when inside an app to reach the back button. But figured out the differences quickly and as long as it keeps as tight as it's been up to this point I think I will be upgrading to the next Huawei every year. Great pictures also. Can't say enough about this affordable but yet flawless phone.

My wife loves it. This phone is an improvement over my Huawei P8 Lite. It's faster and look better. The battery life is also much etter. I actually bought it for my wife since her LG G Stylo is dropping calls and has a defective ear phone jack. She like my P8 Lite but said that she like the larger screen of her LG G Stylo so I decided to get her this Honor 6X instead. So far so good. Let's hope the Honor 6X will be as reliable as my P8 Lite.

For the money, this is the best cell phone you can buy. Works seamlessly with the t-mobile network. l have owned one for 4 months and it has worked flawlessly with internet, data, phone, and all applications
reviews.review_header: For the Money, the best Cell Phone you can Buy

reviews.review_text: Pretty good phone in terms of specs and good camera, this on paper is the best spec phone I've ever owned, I like the overlay Honor used, a mix of iphone/android and phone has been smooth with a fast fingerprint reader, but...the biggest con to me is no gorilla glass on this phone, seriously, look up some drop test vids online and you'll be petrified to use this phone without a good case and screen protector. The included whimpy plastic screen protector is eh, and many of the tempered glass screen protectors for this phone (or maybe in general) seem to have quality control issues with the edges not wanting to seal right, or having bubbles even after following directions correctly. Overall, amazing specs and camera for the price, but be extremely wary of ever dropping this phone, they didn't want to include gorilla glass even though budget phones like the Moto E4,etc have gorilla glass. Their Kirin cpu are actually stronger and better than the snapdragons I've read, so that's a big plus for what it's worth, and 3gb ram should be good for awhile. I ordered and installed a pretty good Spigen case which feels very tactile with its good buttons, but due to quality control issues and having to do a refund on a screen protector pack that wouldn't seal right and had bubbles even after following directions to a T, I'm very paranoid about dropping this thing by accident and having the screen crack in a million pieces due to a cost cutting measure by Honor to not include gorilla glass for some reason... in the end, great smooth phone but be VERY careful and make sure to get a good case and screen protector, I heard on non gorilla glass screen phones even putting it in your pocket is risking it getting scratched up,etc
reviews.review_header: Great specs for the price, but...fragile screen

reviews.review_text: My phone came in two days and not even a prime member so it was really great. I have to say I am really pretty pleased with it. I was able to put my chip from Cricket in it and it worked without having to do anything. It also automatically collected all my info from my other phone as soon as I had put in my google account info. It comes with some really neat apps already installed like Huawei Health that tracks how many steps you have taken along with how many calories you have burned, it's pretty neat and not bulky. It also has app buttons that group certain apps together so you don't have a mess of apps all over your home screen. One has Google search, Gmail, Google maps, YouTube, Google Drive, Google Play Music, Google Play Movies and Tv, Google Photos and Google + all bundled together . The other group button has Weather, Calculator, Notepad, Recorder, Fm Radio, Flashlight, Mirror, Compass and backup and the next group app button has Twitter, CNN, Store, Honor Community, Support, and you can add more to it. It also comes with beautiful themes and each time i awaken the phone there is a new pretty picture on the screen. The screen is really clear and easy to see and the photos it takes are amazing even though I have yet to really learn all the functions. Phone specs are CPU Kirin 655 . 32 gb internal storage . resolution 1080x1920 , android version 7.0, EMUI 5.0.1 , RAM 3.0GB

If it didn't drop calls and send callers straight to v-mail, I'd give it four stars. It really is great value. That said, I'm having issues with T-Mobile and the Huawei Honor 6X on T-Mobile's network. Frequently, my Honor 6X sends callers directly to v-mail. I'm also experiencing frequent dropped calls. My wife has zero connectivity issues with her Nexus 6. I previously used Moto G3, Nokia phones, BLU phones (and even an Amazon Fire phone) without connectivity issues. T-Mobile can't find anything 'wrong' with their service. Other reviewers seem to have experienced similar issues with T-Mobile service (carrier/phone frequency incompatibility). So in my experience, the Honor 6X works inconsistently on T-Mobile's network.
It's a very decent phone. The fingerprint sensor works great. The design is great. I'M very happy with this purchase!
reviews.review_header: The fingerprint sensor works great. The design is great

reviews.review_text: I'm simply AMAZED at the quality and functionality of this phone. The few negative things that I found from various sources seem to have been wiorked out (ie: one person complained that there's no flashlight mode. There's a flashlight mode now). Response time is snappy, bright and easy to use screen. Fantastic camera. The fingerprint thing works excellent too and can even distinguish which finger I'm using. I've had everything from iPhones to little cheap starter phones and everything in between and so far this is my favorite (and it doesn't cost an arm and a leg).

First, this phone is not unlocked. I specifically bought it, after hours of searching, reading reviews, and product comparison, because it was unlocked, and supposedly has a long battery life. IT WAS NOT FULLY UNLOCKED! Therefore I could use it with the provider I already bought a year of service with! I had already put on a glass screen cover, bought a case, and it didn't work right with my provider! As far as the battery life went... No. It did not have a 2 day battery life. It has a long battery life IF YOU DON'T USE IT. I could have it on for days without needing to charge it. The second I used it on wifi (which is the only way I COULD use it, since I didn't have phone service on it!!!), the battery drained pretty quickly. I am not one of those people constantly glued to my phone, either. Have you noticed that I speak of it in the past tense? That is because it is dead. Or, close enough to dead that it is unusable. Sometimes it works great - for a mini tablet that can't make calls - but sometimes it is completely unresponsive, and will not even power on or recognize a charger. I am out a phone, plus the money I paid for the screens, the case, AND a year of service (since I can't afford to buy a new phone to work with my service provider!). I am absolutely livid. I have been continually disappointed with businesses and purchases lately, including Amazon. This device was falsely labeled, as it is not fully unlocked, and the product itself doesn't even work. I already sent a message about this, and got no response. If I could give zero stars, I would.

So I read all the reviews on mid range cell phones. I decided to go with the honor 6x. I am so happy I chose this phone. As soon as I pulled it out of the box and grabbed it in my hand I knew this was a quality phone. The phone looks great and feels like a more expensive phone then what it is. The screen display is very sharp. The camera is awesome. The battery life is as stated as it does last easily throughout the day on one charge. The phone reception is crisp and clear and loud. I dropped the phone by accident and not a scratch on the phone. The phone is very slim. The transition between applications and internet browsing is very smooth. Huawei did a great job at a great price. The reason why us Android users choose Android is because we do not like to be like the rest of the sheep that chose apple. Take a chance make the purchase on this phone you will not be disappointed.
reviews.review_header: I am so happy I chose this phone

reviews.review_text: This phone is great in terms of designs and functionality. But after receiving it and reading the instructions I was disappointed. Why?, this phone CANNOT recieve calls while using the other sim. Let’s say I’m on call with sim 1 if persons call via sim 2 it cannot do a call waiting, or recieve the another call while I’m on the sim 1. This was a utter disappointment, all my other phones can do this, Samsung, blu’s. So I just gave it to my wife. I receive calls constantly from either numbers in my daily work. This phone has everything I would have wanted in terms features, functionality, ergonomics, there are a lot cases for it, I ordered two. In the end I had to go back to amazon and order another phone, dual sim phone call Doogee, that has features and performance I require without breaking the bank on a Samsung with similar features. Please be aware of this issue, other than that this really a great phone for single sim purpose. I believe it can give higher end phones serious competition within its features group.
reviews.review_header: This phone is great in terms of designs and functionality

reviews.review_text: Great phone so far. The reviews on this phone are better than the pixel and pixel 2, AND for quite a bit less cost. It may not be as fast but it's pretty smooth so far. I've noticed the camera can be a little slow, pics are pretty good. I had the Nexus 5x which was a great phone!! It died from the bootloop issue they have, it lasted 1 yr and 8 months. The performance at this price point is very good (I did get it on sale amazon for 150$ !!!) With the price of phones skyrocketing, don't think this can be beat, and with several hundred dollars still in my acct. The feel of the phone is premium, metallic and solid. Battery life is excellent! Will have to see how durable it is in the long run.It came with good plastic sheet protection on front and back. I plan on leaving the front sheet on , as I'm shopping for a slim case for it. I don't abuse or drop my phones much.

Hi this is my third Huawei Honor 6X I love this phone BUT the load speaker is anything but load. That is the only draw back. I have had the phone 5 months now and really like it. But I would only buy this phone with the add on of tempered glass protection cover and the CoverON Honor 6X Case, Huawei Mate 9 Lite Case, CoverON [HexaGuard Series] Slim Hybrid Hard Phone Cover Case for Huawei Honor 6X / Mate and the SPARIN [2 Pack] Honor 6X Screen Protector, SPARIN Tempered Glass Screen Protector for Huawei Honor 6X 5.5 inch with Ultra Clear, Scratch Proof, Easy to Install,Only Cover Visual Screen The phone with these two add on make it a excellent phone less the speaker which I hope they will improve in future
reviews.review_header: Hi this is my third Huawei Honor 6X I love this phone BUT the load speaker is anything but ...

reviews.review_text: I've had this phone about a week. So far, I love the battery life. After two years, my last phone (Nexus 6P) was giving me about 30 minutes of screen time on a full charge, so having a phone that can last all day with moderate use is amazing. The battery life comes with a price, however: the processing power is underwhelming. I feel like for what I paid for, it's about as good as I should expect, but it's already lagging with some of the bigger apps. Snapchat in particular causes the phone to freeze. The camera is fine in adequate lighting, but is pretty poor in low light. Most of the reviews I read listed the main cons as being that this phone uses micro-USB instead of USB-C, which I personally prefer just because I like things to be standardized, and that the backing panel was plastic instead of metal. I don't know about most people, but I pretty much never take my phone out of its case, so backing material does not make a bit of difference to me.
Love this phone it takes great pictures and the screen is big what more could you want?

I have had this for about 3 weeks now. fingerprint reader for the most part part is very responsive and helpful, esp, with EMUI gestures available. Screen seems fine for me, no ongoing issues with any lagging or nav. issues. I really want to love the phone and keep it, but it has extreme camera lag issues (opening camera, completing photo, processing photo, all very slow). I uybndersrtnad htis is an EMUI 5.0 bug. I do have latest Nougat and latest EMUI.

02.24.2018 .. I am not using this phone for much of anything but an internet HOT SPOT. Bought Straight Talk Unlimited Data Plan, and using for internet service at work, since I shut down our line 2, that had the DSL on it. ATT wanted new contract to move to main phone line, for 2 years. We will likely be closing business sometime this year. So, I decided a budget cell phone as a HOT SPOT will do for now. And is working fine. I dont need lots of internet, and this is meeting my needs just fine. I really havent used this phone for anything else. But, I am surprised how well the battery lasts when i dont have it on the charger. But, is new. So, it should hold a charge very well. When it gets a year or two, on it will show just how well the battery ends up being. But for now, the phone has impressed me for what it is. Unit is about 1 month old at this time .. .. 03.20.2018 .. Update. Well, i had to send my personal cell phone in to get the battery replaced under warranty. So... that means i have been using this phone as my main cell phone in the mean time. Perhaps, i didnt understand the dual sim card limitations in the product description. and, it wasnt important at the time. What i have experienced is that you cant use but one sim at a time. basically, the other becomes inactive. Both wont function at the same time. So, may as well just shut one off, while the other is on. Am still using Straight Talk unlimited data as Hot Spot internet access at work, So, i cant used my personal ATT sim/phone number for texting of calling. Have to shut off the other sim first if i need to do that. So, If you need to use both sims, then, this isnt the phone to use. But, I am getting by since it should be just around 2 weeks that i will be w/o my personal phone, which, i can used one sim for data, and the other sim for talk and text. Hope this helps...
reviews.review_header: As HOT SPOT, is doing very well.

reviews.review_text: This is a fantastic device and I regularly get 2 full days out of the battery with my local TMobile MVNO. I bought it from the Amazon warehouse as used-like new and can only imagine it was a post-Christmas return. My 6x arrived with the Dec 2016/B110 EMUI 4.1 level software but, once connected to wifi, it updated to B360 to B365 to B366 over the course of a day. The 6x supports Voice over LTE but does not currently support Voice over WiFi. My understanding is it is also missing the primary band for AT&T LTE service (17). Personally, I'm just fine with the phone having micro USB because it allows me to use my collection of various microUSB chargers instead of investing in newer USB C when I'm really only plugging the phone in for power. Maybe other folks do more data transfer via cables than I do. It's still not clear if this 6x will get a software update to Oreo. The successor (the 7x) is slated to and has hardware that is similar to the 6x. Fingers crossed that Huawei doesn't forget about the 6x phone, which came to the US in early 2017.
reviews.review_header: Very happy with the 6x performance and battery life. Highly compatible with TMobile service.

reviews.review_text: I've only had the phone a few days, so if anything changes, I'll change my rating. So far it works great. It replaced a Galaxy S5 and it's much faster. It can run several open apps and switch between them without a problem. The battery lasts through an entire day of continuous use. I didn't have to uninstall too many apps it came with because it's just stock Google. The lack of bloatware is nice. I like that it comes with a phone manager app because the ones in the Play store all have ads. The call quality is decent with a FreedomPop sim that uses ATT. Call quality is also good on wifi. No complaints despite it being VoIP. I noticed other reviews say it isn't 4g LTE capable but it is. The camera is garbage and shouldn't be a selling point. Sometimes certain apps crash when first opened but work on the second attempt. The battery can also get hot while charging and idle, but not while in use, which is weird. The lack of other features don't bother me since it's a cheap budget phone. For the money it costs, it works far better than I expected.

The dead giveaway that I had made the right purchase occurred at the MetroPCS store. I walked in and asked for assistance with the phone. The manager behind the counter held the phone in her hands and expressed surprise at the build quality. She put it through its paces and asked "What is Honor"? I purchased the Huawei manufactured 32GB model with 3 gigs of ram. The phone is screaming fast with a 1080 X 1920 resolution. Had it for a couple of months. The 6X runs Android 7.0 Nougat. Storage, performance, camera quality and reliability makes this phone a must for customers looking for iPhone performance and reliability in a small price. Huawei is the real deal. Recently, Huawei had a pending deal with major American carriers blown up by lobbyists for "other phone manufacturers". If Huawei gets a foothold in the American market, the rising prices of certain handsets will freeze. There's a lot at stake. The stated reason for the deal going south was that Huawei is a Chinese manufactured phone. Amazon, thankfully, is truly "free market". Great phone.
reviews.review_header: The Honor 6X: The iPhone and Samsung Challenger

reviews.review_text: Great dual lense camera for adjustable focus after taking a picture. Normal great huawei camera app, plus one click apiture option to use second lense to record depth information. Then or after you take the picture, you can edit the picture and move the focal plane, have foreground or background in focus, or even have multiple focal planes. Splash is another nice photo edit option. Each time you apply one of these features it saves a new picture, and google photos finds them. Other pros: Fast and responsive phone. Lovely metal body. Great screen resolution. Gets google security updates ( Jan 2018 ) and is up to date Android. Fingerprintsensor is very fast, much faster than 5x. Camera focus is a bit slower than 5x. Comes with a plastic film screen protector factory installed. Amazing performance for the price. Cons: only 2.4 WiFi, but it works very well. 3 months later: great battery life, I use it a lot all day, on T-Mobile data and WiFi. Charge it every 2 days. Still seems to run fast, and up to date google security patch wise.
reviews.review_header: Great dual lense camera for adjustable focus after taking a picture

reviews.review_text: I so desperately wanted this phone based on all of the reviews I had read for this phone including at LEAST 30 other phones,however; I had to return the phone due to only being plugged up for about 10 minutes both the phone and charger became really hot. So I returned the phone and they sent me out another phone within 3 days! !! Yet again i was so excited,I had already ordered an sd card and 3 cases for it,but yet again the exact same thing happened after being plugged up for 10-15 mins. It over heated. I would like to try a third time but I'm really skeptic and would hate to get let down AGAIN! !!

This phone never was delivery by Amazon logistic because Amazon locker destined to my package was occupied by another according to logistic. I called customer services four or five time may be more of that, anyway very frustrated situation because the phone wasn't for me but a present that I had already promised to one of my nephew. The good news is that Amazon returned my money back into my card immediately. Anyway, I reordered the same phone from "Newegg.com" but I didn't know at the time that both of them (amazon and newegg) were using the same shipping and it took around twenty days and a lot of phone calls to received the small package with the phone. Guess what the phone came in the same amazon box and nothing was protected the phone inside the box. I think that the only reason the phone made in one piece is because it is all metal. Anyway, my nephew like it and according to him the battery can last for a couple days without recharged. Definitely, battery is the best feature in this device. Compare to Blue in the same price, Huawei is a better phone and this is my personal opinion.
reviews.review_header: Good device and can be upgrade to android 7.0 not bad at all

reviews.review_text: I'm more of a computer person than a phone person and by this I mean I don't use my phone other than to internet browse, get texts/calls, and play the occasional app game. I bought this one for more memory as I realized I needed to start downloading more than three apps. So far this is great. It's as fast as I need it to be, a good chunk of memory, the camera is definitely a huge upgrade from my last phone (an LG Stylo) and software-wise I'm only really upset that you can't turn the screen off and on by double tapping. The only thing I've noticed is a bit iffy is how slow to react the keyboard is while typing in the messenger app. It only seems to be the keyboard as I've tried sliding my finger across all of the screen in other places and apps and it's just the keyboard. Don't know if this is specifically my phone or just how this phone is in general. So far it's a minor annoyance - let's see how having to go back and fix spelling errors (auto correct is just as obnoxious and I have that off) will get after a few more months.
reviews.review_header: Works - not much to say but I like it so far. Keyboard touch is slow.

reviews.review_text: Great phone even if a year old for 150 bucks you can't easily go wrong if looking for battery life. Pro's >long battery life I'm a IT guy and need my phone almost always on for email, discord, im's, etc. Charged this once when I got it still rocking around 60% after 3 days. Keep this in mind I don't really use this for youtube/videogames/music/facebook/instagram stuff; if you do that will determine your battery life way more than this review. >Responsiveness Every app I use is perfectly responsive no issues like any other phone I've used >Screen quality Nice and crisp no complaints, much better than the 5x I had which just ended sucking battery for some reason. >Camera No complaints, I heard issues with this being slow, I can't find it unless you need <.05 second to launch the app Con's Not really going to knock it a star for any of these since you can easily find this stuff out by googling/reading a review here >no 7.1.1 update I would really have appreciated a 7.1.1 update or something like that over 7.0 stock but it still works well enough and not a super big issue >Not a gaming phone battery life is one of it's key points, so cpu/gpu specs won't be the top performers here >screen protector that comes with it is annoying It'a hair too thick so swiping from the side on things like discord is kinda odd, not a huge issue since you can easily get some other kinds and it's free so whatever
reviews.review_header: Great phone even if a year old for 150 bucks ...

reviews.review_text: I have been using this phone along with my regular iphone 6, for the past 2-3 weeks. I think features on this phone match that of iphone 6. It has a super fast finger print recognition, and pretty reliable for my limited test. Its camera is decent, and it has more features than iphone. And web browsing is pretty decent, but iphone is little smoother. Video quality is similar. Battery life is similar to my iphone(after 2 years of usage), for which I have no complain. For the price, this is an amazingly good phone. Just have to get used to gphone app/software. For me, the big advantage of gphone is its openness. I can transfer a lot of video+picture into/from the phone, very easily+quickly. Plus it is cheap to add 128G SD. And it works with AT&T wireless phone+data. But I have not gotten messaging to work yet.
reviews.review_header: good phone with a very good price

reviews.review_text: I wanted to wait until i had used this phone for a few months before i reviewed it. This is a great phone. It is a bit more expensive then when i bought it a few months ago but, it is a little gem! I am not into expensive phones, i really just want to call, text and search a bit. This is far beyond that. It is fast and has a lot of memory and the camera is not great but good. I have tried the equivalent price range phone in BLU and Moto. They do not compare. So far this is a great deal. It came with a screen protector so that made it even better. It seemed a little big at first but it seems fine now. I would definitely recommend this product.
reviews.review_header: Cant beat this for the price!

reviews.review_text: This phone is great, the camera is outstanding for the price, and it runs smoothly, the speakers are good and they can be very loud so that's good, works with VR to an extent, the gyroscope has slow reaction speed and shaking screen sometimes some vr apps work fine and some don't, this leads to a fun but annoying VR experience, I wouldn't put a whole lot of money into a VR headset for THIS phone, the fingerprint sensor is very speedy and fairly accurate as long as you configure it right, overall this is a great phone.

Great phone, probably the fastest fingerprint sensor on the market. Decent camera, and good screen. However, the Bluetooth version is ancient, and the audio quality suffers terribly for it. Any bluetooth audio sounds like an old 32kbps mp3 audio stream. High frequencies are distorted, and overall accuracy and audio depth is terrible. Had to return for this deal-breaking trait. For me, they skimped in the wrong area. If you use don't use bluetooth audio, go for it. At $150 these are a good deal.
reviews.review_header: Don't buy if you enjoy Bluetooth audio often

reviews.review_text: Takes a nano SIM card. And I had to upgrade to a better SD card. Class 10 or better. It still worked with my original SD card but that one I've had for a few years and it was only 4 GB. Phone is metal, not 100% plastic. Very nice. Also I have straight talk as my carrier.

The phone is a phenomenal value for the money. I've had it for a week. Good 5.5" screen, but the phone is smaller than I expected and fits well in my pockets. The phone is light, but it doesn't feel cheap, I like the aluminum back, though it appears it may scratch easily. The included front screen protector seems to be more than adequate and fits perfectly. The cameras are very nice, the rear 12 mp camera takes great shots, just haven't figured out what the second 2mp camera adds to the equation. I take lots of pictures but I'm not a techie when it comes to photograpy, I just know what looks good when I see it. I have played around with some of the filters and they are fun and easy to use. The slo-mo video works well, I just have nothing to compare it to I've never had that feature on a phone before. The front facing 8mp camera takes wonderful selfies, best I've ever shot with. Performance wise it seems to work great. I haven't had any issues with sluggishness, everything loads smoothly and quickly, probably due to the 3GB of ram. The battery is as advertised, I use a ton on GPS and navigation in my car on a daily basis, and the phone hasn't died on me yet, which is saying a lot and the main reason I bought it. Every previous phone I've ever had has never made it through a full work day using Google Maps, and this one does, nuff said. I've paid twice as much or more for phones in the past few years and have never been more satisfied than I am with this one. Lets just hope I don't break it, I've never had a phone for more than a 7 or 8 months without destroying it, I work on appliances for a living and always seem to figure out a way to break them. Here's hoping this one bucks the trend.
reviews.review_header: Great battery, good camera, smooth performance.

reviews.review_text: I've only been using this phone for a couple of days, but so far, it's really good. This is the first time I've ever gotten a phone through anybody other than my service provided -- and to be honest, I was a little nervous about it. My nervousness was completely unfounded! Swapped the SIM card, turned on the phone, used the provided app to copy over all the apps from my old phone, and I was good to go! Would have been nice if I could have brought over all the configurations, too -- but I didn't see a way to do that. Not a big deal from my perspective. Functionally -- I'm really used to my Nova Launcher set up, so that was my first task after copying everything over. Once I got everything looking like I wanted it, I started poking around. It's a good phone -- great compared to the HTC Desire I switched from. I can hear well with it (hearing aid user), and it is plenty fast. As for look and feel -- wow. It's a solid phone! A little heavier than my old HTC, but in a good way. It feels like it's better made. Screen is clear, sound is good, and I think it looks terrific.

I bought this on cyber weekend for a good price. For a budget phone, it does what you need it to do for the most part. Certain apps are a bit too much for it though, specifically snapchat makes it wig out. The camera can be a bit unresponsive in general. Sometimes when accessing the camera, photos, or bluetooth the phone will lag a LOT or completely freeze. Certain headphones also may not work for this phone, I used a pair of cheap ones once and no sound would work through them. The battery life is really great, I can use it for two days straight without having to charge it, probably my favorite thing about the phone. The design is also clean and it feels good in the hand. The fingerprint unlock is also super convenient and works pretty well unless your hands are sweaty or something. I wish it worked a little better, I was hoping to keep this phone for a few years but with the problems it has had in only a month or two I doubt that will happen.
reviews.review_header: You get what you pay for I guess.

reviews.review_text: Coming from an iPhone 5 and more recently an iPhone 6, this was not a transition I was looking forward to. Over the past 2 months I have been extremely impressed by the UI, battery life, responsiveness of the phone, and camera/photo quality. Not on the level of your $700 android or apple smartphones, but for the money I don't see how anyone could be disappointed with this device. Surprisingly awesome.

I had recently broke Asus phone and didn't have money to buy another. I needed a cheap phone and didn't want to settle for a crappy one. I never bought a Huawei before and was a little nervous, but it's been one of the best all around phones I've ever had. I've had this for 5+ months now. Pros: - Battery. I can easily get 2 days with normal use without location or Bluetooth turned on. I use both of those, which eats more battery, but by the end of the day (I get up at 3am and go to bed at 8:30pm) I still have 30% or more battery. - Camera. Not the best I've ever used, but for a $200 phone, it exceeds all my expectations. I'm a photographer and a good camera was important to me, and I am not unhappy with it. Like I said, it's not the best I've had, but it's good. - Screen. It's nice and bright with good colors. Cons: - Speaker. It's very quite. Nothing impressive. - It doesn't have USB Type C. It doesn't compare to more expensive phones, but if you are on a budget but don't want to compromise, get this. The finger print scanner is a nice touch.
reviews.review_header: The best All Around Budget Phone You Can Buy.

reviews.review_text: This is a very nice phone. Has some interesting features like the multiple app capability which is quite nice when texting and watching YouTube at the same time. I was expecting a bit more from the camera though. Picture quality could be better, but still not too bad for the average user such as myself. This is an update to my previous note: I received the Huawei phone, after checking the sound ,I realized that even though it appears that the device has 2 speakers, sound only comes out of the right hand side. Thinking that this was a defect, I returned the phone. Upon receiving the replacement, I did another test of the sound, and the same thing happened. Sound is emitting from only one speaker on the right hand side. This has lead me to conclude that this is how the device was actually manufactured. If I am wrong, then I must be the most unfortunate person I know. The opening on the left side seems to be just a prop and nothing else. I am a bit disappointed as the advantage of having both speakers would greatly enhance the experience. Apparently, its a microphone, not a speaker.
reviews.review_header: This is a very nice phone. Has some interesting features like the multiple ...

reviews.review_text: So, I'm gonna start with the basics. The screen is no laughing matter but is just.. Basic. Don't expect any ground breaking stuff here. Colors are accurate, but not over saturated. That being said, it does feel fragile. Get a screen protector and a case. This ohone definitely needs it. The cameras are pretty awesome. You definitely have some creative options, and feel like there is no limit to the type of photo you can take. Really can't say anything bad about the cameras. This phone is definitely 5 star worth.... Expect for one thing.. The wifi. This phone is mediocre with wifi at best. Sporting only 2.4ghz connectivity at a very distant range. Also the LTE bandwidth isn't the best on this phone. But the battery is one thing that really shines. Boy does this thing have power. Alot of it. I feel like I can throw anything at this phone, and it'll still get me through an entire day. Definitely one of the better daily drivers that you don't have to worry about too much. It's nice, handy, great with photos and battery life. Not really fast with its download speeds though.

It gets the job done, but I've noticed a lot of lag on this phone. Clearly this is a second tier phone. For the price though, you shouldn't expect a Samsung or iPhone type experience. The one thing that is aggravating though is that it feels like it is the miui interface and bloatware that are making this phone perform below what it is capable of. Overall though, I'm still satisfied with this phone for the price. It is still a solid performing phone that doesn't unexpectedly crash. Additionally, the battery life is very good on this phone and I've never had trouble making it through a day regardless of heavy usage.

Well made and the performance is good. Fairly stock Android running on top of EMUI. This was a gift for my daughter. The UI is very good and with those used to 100% stock Android there's a little learning curve. Or you can use Google Launcher. Build Quality is good. Performance is Good. Display and Battery life a also very good. The phone needs a clear case and screen protector. These are a must. It's not a fragile phone but wise to protect your investment with a screen protector. If you've used iOS and Android you'll find the Huawei Honor 6 a nice and budget friendly device.
reviews.review_header: Well made and the performance is good. Fairly stock Android running on top of EMUI. This was a gift for my daughter.

reviews.review_text: Very good. Easy yo set-up, very fast processor, 32 GB memory. Only trouble I had was the tethering option - setting the mobile hotspot was easy, connection is stable but...after couple of weeks there was no internet access. Other devices connect to the AP, but cannot access the internet. Tried the SIM card in a different phone - no problem with the network, everything worked. Phone was replaced with another Honor 6x, after initial set-up everything worked great...for couple of weeks,.. then again no internet access trough the hotspot. I can only speculate about the issue, definitely it's not the mobile network (Cricket), since there are no problems with my new phone (unlocked Samsung Galaxy J7 Pro). I guess the Honor 6x, even though unlocked, has some piece of software allowing the mobile network determine it's a carrier sold phone and blocks the tethering ability. I also tried USB and Bluetooth tethering, same outcome. Returned the phone to Amazon for a refund. Otherwise, if you don't intend to use it as a hotspot, it's a great phone for budget money.

Just got the 6X a couple of months ago. This phone skips around, freezes (I have to restart it), doesn't pick up a signal sometimes. Not entirely reliable, in other words. The photos are nice and sharp. I would not buy this phone again.

After 2 days I'm am happy with this phone. Great battery life. Camera is pretty awesome. Love the finger print scanner, very fast. The phone operates better than other budget phones. It is great value for $150. I don't use NFC so I'm not missing anything. This phone could sell for $300 and would still be a good buy.

I can not get over show much I love this phone! I am on att, and after dealing with their switch from paying a couple hundred Max at contract renewal to paying about $500, having small amounts added to each bill which is absurd for then phone I had, I am over the moon to find such a quality phone for this price. The fact that I can put my SD card in it was a big plus for me as I know phones are phasing that ability out. It is easy to set up, easy to use and I plan on buying one for my husband.
reviews.review_header: Easy to use, high quality for a low price.

reviews.review_text: I bought this phone as an replacement for my Honor 5X which would no longer access mobile data (NOT Huawei's problem). Compared to the 5X this phone is super fast and the battery seems to last forever. I have difficulty leaving my house so the WiFi on the 6X is always on. The battery drops about 15% over a 24 hour period. Installing apps on the 5X took a while, but on the 6X installation flies! Oh, yes, the problem I had with mobile data on my 5X. I had the same problem on the 6X initially and had to go to a local AT&T store. It took them about an hour to figure out the mobile data on my account had been restricted for a reason nobody would explain. They removed the restriction and the 6X is working perfectly! I love this phone!!!!

Unless you are a smartphone snob this phone completely does everything that you need it to do. I am coming from a Galaxy Note 4 & had spent $800 on it back in 2014. Now it's 2018 & it was time to upgrade. Did a lot of research & went out on a limb & tried the Honor series. And let me tell you it was the best decision that I had ever made. The screen resolution is great, gaming specs are great, the camera is only good, User Interface/Learning curve is great & Finally the battery life is excellent (2 days with moderate to heavy usage with battery saver on). I feel like I paid under $200 for a flagship phone. I know Huawei makes other (high end) phones but for now I will stick with the Honor series, because for what you get & what you pay it's a no-brainer.
reviews.review_header: The Best Smartphone Ever Made (For The Price)

reviews.review_text: So my jank ass cricket phone broke bad and my broke ass needed a new phone. This one is really good. The camera is nice. It's pretty fast. The screen resolution is nice. There's not 700 preloaded app taking a space and it looks really good. I'm not a tech geek (un)fortunately but as far as I can tell it's pretty good for it's price range. The battery life is really good. For example, I left for class this morning on 100% and it's 8:20 and I'm only on 40%. You can get almost a full day out of heavy usage and I'm guessing over a day and some hours with little usage. The volume can be kinda low at times. I gave it four stars bc I've only had it for a few days but I'll definitely make it five if it continues to do well.

I was tired of spending $800 on a phone that only lasted 2 years, so after doing tons of research I decided that this phone was the closest comparison to Samsung Galaxy phones. I've never been happier with a phone IN MY LIFE! It's super fast! Amazing screen size! Almost the same size as my Samsung Note 5. If you're hesitant getting out of the name brand phones, you won't be after using this phone! I used this with straight talk, which is an amazing service provider, had sprint before and never had service anywhere until I switched!
reviews.review_header: Switched from Samsung phone definitely worth the price!

reviews.review_text: I bought this to replace my Zenfone 2 ze551ml. The ZF2's screen started failing, so I figured I had to buy a new handset, but didn't want to spend a lot on a new sim-free device. The Honor 6x fit the bill. Compared to the ZF2, the Honor 6x is almost as snappy. Gaming-wise, look elsewhere as it will not impress - there's definitely lag when gaming. Then again, if you're considering this phone, you aren't looking for a gaming powerhouse anyway. You also don't need to buy a screen protector --- it comes with one installed right out of the box. The Honor 6x also feels like a high-end phone when held since it's a metal-unibody handset. Try finding that on another $200 phone. As soon as I finished the initial setup, the phone prompted to update to EMUI 5.0, which is Android Nougat 7.0. The update was about 2.x GB. Some folks are complaining about a drop in performance, but my handset never had that. In fact, I find it faster. The settings menu also got an overhaul and more options are available at your disposal. A tip, though: DO NOT CUSTOMIZE YOUR HONOR 6X'S UI IF YOU PLAN TO UPDATE TO NOUGAT. Install the update first, then customize the look and feel of the phone later. The LCD display is nice. You'll also be able to choose the screen's color temperature if you find it too "cool" like I did. Audio quality-wise, calls, music, and videos all sound clear. The fingerprint scanner is QUICK. Unlocking the phone via that method is almost instantaneous. I can't say much about the camera as I have yet to test it. But for low-light shoots, the photos lose some detail as far as I can tell. There isn't much bloatware either, which makes it clean. Love the battery performance --- out of the box, with 54% capacity, it drained to only 43% after I downloaded apps, synced e-mails, personalizing the settings, and transferring files between two phones. That's with around 2.5 hours of screen time. Color me impressed. As for connectivity, the modem is pretty solid. No matter where I go, I always get full bars, and compared to the ZF2, LTE performance is way better. Overall, for a handset that's around $200, I love it. Again, not a gaming powerhouse, but for everything else, it gets the job done.

Wow! I bought this phone for my mom after her iPhone shattered. This phone is AMAZING. The screen is large, the swiping fast and smooth. Very intuitive user interface (I am an apple user and usually find myself stumbling around on Androids). The camera takes the best photos; it even has a "beauty mode" that even makes me look kinda cute (hard to do, I'm super unphotogenic). Honestly, think it blows iPhone out of the water; it's even faster. Might be saying goodbye to my iPhone and getting an Honor 6 for myself.

I bought this phone for a close friend of mine, she absolutely loves it. I wanted to get her a good midrange phone and this definitely delivers she's had it for a month and she's still in love with the phone! I had a big feeling this phone would be great by looking at the specs. If you are looking for a solid phone without paying premium price for those other flagships this is the phone for you!

The phone's camera is not very good and especially bad in low light or oddly lit scenarios. Also the processor freezes and can't handle multitasking and lots of app switching even if just between 3-4 apps. Battery life has been good, but haven't tried it outside of airplane mode, since I've been waiting for my nano SIM card to arrive.
reviews.review_header: The phone's camera is not very good and especially bad in low light or oddly lit ...

reviews.review_text: A fantastic phone. It has a beautiful screen, premium look and feel with a great simple design and it has Android 7.0. Most of the bloatware can be uninstalled which is a breath of fresh air and the user interface is good. The only thing to critique is that the audio is not great, the one speaker is lackluster, even with headphones the audio sounds weak. If you are looking for a phone for music you might want to look elsewhere. Other than that it's a great phone for under $200.

I have had this for about one week and I like it very much. I think that for the price it is a pretty decent phone. The camera is by far better than other smart phones that I have had and it is also super fast. The battery is pretty good I have charged it about 3 times since I received it. On other phones that I have had I would have to charge it almost every night. I will say that I do not use my phone for games or surfing the web, that is what I have a computer for. I would recommend this phone to anyone that asked me. Personally I do not think that you have to spend a lot of money to get a decent piece of equipment. I dont think that you have to spend 500-1000 to get a good phone. That is just wasting you money, but then that is my oponion.
reviews.review_header: ... have had this for about one week and I like it very much

reviews.review_text: Initial Review: 1 week. Got this for the $150 Black Friday price. Pros: -2 Complete Days Battery. Currently I have 20% battery: 5hrs Screen On Time, 2.5 days no charge. Been watching a lot of YouTube. -Screen Bright, Colors are good -Performance Fast, Responsive, Multitasking -Fingerprint reader Great location, almost instant unlock. -Good aesthetics Looks pleasing, I have the white/silver. -Takes short falls well Already dropped it, but it took it like a champ. Only a small dent on the corner Cons: -Really feels like it wants to be an iPhone. The settings, no app drawer (you can change after the update). It all feels very similar to iOS, which i'm not fond of. Luckily it is an android phone, and you can tweak the settings to make it feel like a more traditional android experience instead. -Slippery -Comes with a screen protector on it from the factory, but mine was not applied correctly and a large part of the screen was exposed, and some of the sensor was covered. Other thoughts: A bit bigger than i thought it would be. I have small hands, and it can be cumbersome to handle one handed. Back is rather cold to the touch. Not a bad thing, just an observation. Hard to find well built accessories like cases, and tempered glass.
reviews.review_header: Take an hour to uninstall the bloatware and change your iPhoney settings. After that, this is a great budget phone.

reviews.review_text: This is an amazing phone for the price, and quality. I was quite skeptical of Huawei when i first started looking for a replacement phone, due to the Apple fiasco. I once owned a Huawei phone back when they first started selling in America. The orginal phone i had was of cheap material, very slow performance, and was not at all what i hoped for. Then about 2 weeks ago I decided i was fed up with my iPhone, and wanted to make the switch to Android, and was in the market for something reasonably price, yet very functional. As everyone else does I went to online, and began researching what would be the best option for my needs. There are so many options available for consumers it may be a hassle for someone to make the choice, so the decision of Huawei with its gleaming reviews. I decided I would have given it a shot due to the price and UI. It is only running Android 7.1 Nougat which is a little disappointing, but with the merging of EMUI which is Huawei's UI it has not let me down yet. The phone honestly has an amazing screen for being 1080p 5.5" inch display, a wonderful processor which is a little old but still holds up, and a battery that suprisingly lasts me almost 2 days with a single charge. The phone is a great choice if you aren't looking for the latest and greatest, because being almost 2 years old it is still able to hold its own against even the newest smartphones.
reviews.review_header: Great Value, Wonderful Display, Best Optimization, and Battery Life is Amazing!

reviews.review_text: Absolutely love this phone. I considered going with iPhone after some disappointments with android and curiosity to "join the dark side". I'm happy to say the reviews on youtube and Amazon convinced me to give android another try with Huawei. I'm really impressed with the quality and low price of the phone. I do wish this phone had more choices with cases and wireless charging capabilities. Somehow I've already lost my Huawei charger that came with the phone. I have Cricket wireless and do not miss Verizon or their expensive devices. (or other contract carriers for that matter). So happy that this phone works well with the network. I had no issues setting up the device and will continue buying Huawei products after this! I'm very impressed with the quality and overall function of the phone.

I like it except for the fact that I couldn't get it to sync with my FitBit charge 2 so I called Huawei and they stated they know about the problem and it could be fixed in the next update but couldn't give an exact date when that would be. The customer service tech seemed nice and informative. The camera and the screen were fantastic for the price paid for the phone but the EMUI skin on top of android needs a lot of tweeking in my op. I returned for a refund however would consider purchasing after it's updated to Android 7

I had a Samsung Galaxy 4 for several years and was looking for an upgrade. I'm not one to go out and buy the latest and greatest, no matter the cost. I was looking for function and price. I found it with the Honor 6X. I read reviews galore and for the price, felt I could not do better. Got the phone, glass screen protector, and nice case for less than $280. I've had it for several months now and I LOVE it. The phone's design is stylish and modern. The camera's great. The battery lasts for days,and the functionality is terrific. I really have NO complaints about this phone. My 17 year old daughter's been considering the Samsung S8, so I've been comparing the two. Of course the S8 comes out on top in direct specification comparison. But really, for a $500+ difference in price?? The quality is right up there, the specifications are not that off - and in several ways, battery life especially, the Honor 6X comes out on top. I'm really trying to steer her away from spending so much. Save your money, honey. You know you'll be wanting a brand new phone before too long anyway. This phone more than delivers!
reviews.review_header: I'm not one to go out and buy the latest and greatest, no matter the cost

reviews.review_text: This is a terrific phone. It provides great sound for WAV music on Poweramp media player. the interface for the phone is a little bit different than standard Android. I prefer it to Android because it seems to be better organized. This phone has a lot of storage and RAM, so everything flows smoothly. I noticed the price has increased since I bought mine a couple of months ago, but only by about $20 or so. I still think it is a good deal. My phone has a scratch on the glass, but it was my fault, so I have no complaints at all. the screen looks nice, and the hardware is solid. Some people have complained about customer service from this company, but I have had no reason to contact them. If I lost this phone or ruined it, I would buy another one.
reviews.review_header: A great phone for the price

reviews.review_text: Dear review reader If you've come this far , you are probably interested in a mid range mobile phone that wont break the bank and wont get you to break in tears. On both of these aspects I can attest , with this phone you will find just that . The Honor 6X is actually a 2nd Gen. 5X , a device which I have owned prior to upgrading to this second generation. When I'm looking at a successor to a 1st gen phone , I want to see significant improvements , and a lot of them . one might ask , how many improvements can a company possibly introduce in a 2nd gen phone while keeping a price point that will justify them ? Huawei's Honor brand has managed to do that gracefully. A mobile device experience is much more than an accumulation of specs , but just to get that out of the way so that we can understand the baseline performance and abilities of this device: 5.5 1080P IPS panel at almost 72% screen to device ratio with 403PPI (I don't know about you but its becoming more and more of a thing these days and will remain a thing for the future) Hisilicon Kirin 655 octa core processor at 2.1 GHz 32 GB on board storage (twice the base storage vs. the 5X ) EMUI 5.0 (Android 7.0 Nougat , Vs. EMUI 4.0 for the 5X) 3 GB RAM (50% more than the 5X at 2GB) Dual 12MP+2MP 1080P rear facing camera with LED Flash , 8MP 1080P front facing camera Rear mounted Finger print sensor which is blazing fast Dual Sim Micro SD storage expansion (supports up to 256GB) 3340 mAh Batter (vs. 5X 3000 mAh) all metal build All of the above translate to an experience that I can only describe as total joy. Android 7.0 dressed up in Huawei's EMUI skin (which I like a lot but is a matter of preference) runs smooth and fast on this device with plenty of ram for multitasking and juggling open apps (have not tried gaming but basic games will surely work smoothly with the GPU on board) the build is tight , substantial , light enough (for a 5.5 Inch phone) and for a price point of $199 ... no less than phenomenal with curved back to slim the device's edges and polished smooth display and bezels. Battery life is a vast improvement on an already great performance of the 5X , lasting easily a full day (and I'm talking 7AM to 11PM not 5PM ) with 50% at least left after substantial usage (media , texting , calls , social media in the background with messages etc.) The display is sharp and crisp , with Huawei's very good and high quality color and saturation levels that are customizable in the settings . Oh and about that camera , I am not familiar with a lot (or any for that matter ) phone brands that sport a dual camera at these price points and it wasn't put there for show just to check that check box . The camera produces VERY ! impressive shots at decent to very good lighting conditions , with a bundle of configurable settings including Bokeh (Boca) effect (Depth of field) that look absolutely amazing even before taking into consideration they were taken with a $199 mid range phone. Low light performance is good thanks to the led flash , however will not reach levels of pricier phones out there (you know who I'm talking about) The performance of the camera is snappy , quick , easy and with so many options embedded in the camera app to fill all the average user needs. The finger print sensor is not only fast and on point , Huawei also includes finger print gesture options to control different controls such as notification pull down , camera etc. My personal and only two drawbacks which are very specific are micro USB 2.0 (instead of USB Type C) and lack of NFC for mobile payment , however if I'm being honest , taking into consideration all of the advantages along with the excellent price point ... are fairly negligible . in conclusion , as a daily driver , this phone is a joy . Mr. A
reviews.review_header: Honor 6X - Mid range at its best

reviews.review_text: By all accounts this appears to be a very good phone for the money. I got the version running nougat and everything transferred over just fine from my sd card, phone calls and gps fpr my ridesharing apps worked well too. However this a warning for anyone running google appa and is on tmobile. The 6x does not appear to consistently be able to open google apps like, gmail, waze, newsstand, etc. They either close immediately upon opening or close when you do your first press or swipe. Tech support suggested trying another carrier but of course that is a luxury most people don't have time or money for. So just be forewarned, although I know a number of people who love and use the product, you may have a lot of heartburn in store if you're one of the ones where not all apps function. That being said, the return seems to be going seemlessly, I just don't have a substitute phone for the next few days.
reviews.review_header: Great phone for the money but beware your experience doesn't mirror mine.

reviews.review_text: I don't like to write reviews until I had time to use the item. Now that I've had this phone for about a month now, I have to say this phone is great and is a lot of "smart phone" for the money. So far I really like everything about it. The camera takes nice quality pictures, the call reception is great and the volume is outstanding. One feature I am glad it has is the fringe print reader and it works perfectly every time. If you need an unlocked phone, you cannot go wrong with the Honor 6X.
reviews.review_header: I don't like to write reviews until I had time to use ...

reviews.review_text: Good phone overall, but if compared to the Huawei Mate that I bought together, please spend a little more to get a Huawei Mate. Mate is totally worth it. They share the feature of dual cameras, but image quality is so different. So are the other aspects. Update March 9 2018 Now after using it for only four months, the phone has two major issues. It is missing phone calls when it does have signal and I am using it. It really surprises me. It happened multiple times! Other thing is I receive my social network in batches rather than one by one. I believe it is from inconsistent in networking of the phone or limited processing power. I live in residential area and did not shut any thing down. Changed it from five star to three
reviews.review_header: Ok phone but please get Huawei Mate if you can afford 200-300 more

reviews.review_text: I purchased this phone for my daughter and she loves it. It is very responsive. The screen is good. The camera works pretty well. The sound quality is good. The phone has run about two weeks now without a single issue. It makes you wonder why people spend so much on "flagship" devices when you get an amazing quality phone for so little.

The phone is sleek and the screen is nice and big. Camera works well and everything is quite fast. Speaker is also loud and clear. Works just as good as any $600 phone, honestly. Also has a lot of included battery saver apps which are nice to have if you care about that. Some minor annoyances that I've found in the first few weeks of use: - LED is barely visible. Almost can't see it out the corner of my eye if it's on my desk, and no way I would ever see it in the car or in broad daylight. - Can't independently adjust the notification and ringtone volume level even with external apps. - Included Huawei music player is awful, but I was able to easily replace it with the Pulsar app.
reviews.review_header: Great phone for the price - with minor annoyances

reviews.review_text: It does everything I was expecting to do with it, including running it under Project Fi with data only services as a secondary device. I was looking for the speed and 3GB memory in a not-too-big device.

When I turned this phone on right way I was impressed with it. For this price this is a wonderful phone. Probably the best budget phone I that I held in my hands. Camera isn't that great but I am spoiled by my primary phone Google Pixel. So it's not a fair comparison. Maybe too small of a storage but again, consider the price. The screen is good enough. As far as I can tell it has one speaker but it's pretty load. Didn't have a single problem so far.
reviews.review_header: A great phone for this price

reviews.review_text: How is this phone so cheap? It is as good as or better than phones costing hundreds more! No payments, no fees, just take your sim card out of your old phone and put it in the new phone and BANG! It is ready to use! No need to go to your retail store or let them know anything. You have the right to buy your phone anywhere. There is no need to spend a fortune on a phone anymore. This does everything the same. If you are making monthly payments on a cell phone you are crazy!
reviews.review_header: Best phone you never heard of!

reviews.review_text: Based on the other comments I decided to take a chance on this phone and boy am I happy that I did. This phone is everything a smart phone should be and then some. The camera is not on the same level as my LG G3 but it still takes great pictures. I'm so excited about the finger print scan feature that allows me unlock it as well as answer calls and with my banking and credit card apps I can log in super fast without having to worry about typing incorrect passwords. My only complaint (so far) is there aren't a lot of ringtones to choose from but since you can download free ringtones of all kinds from practically anywhere it's not much of a big deal, in fact I ordered another one today for my daughter now that her current phone is acting up. This phone uses the nano sim but I had no issues with T Mobile when it came to switching it over. In fact there was no lag time with my service at all it went into effect immediately.

I'm the mean mom that makes my kids buy their own smart phones. My daughter had her eye on an iPhone 6S, although she really wanted the 6S Plus for the larger screen. She saved and saved, but decided she wanted a phone sooner rather than later - so she'd have to do an iPhone SE or consider android phones. Since screen size was an important feature for her, I did some research and ran across the Honor 6X. It seemed like a perfect fit - it had everything that was important to her, except iMessaging/Facetime, and it left her with plenty of money in the bank. We also liked that cases and screen protectors were reasonably priced too. She has had the phone now for two months. She has absolutely no regrets, which also means her friends (that all seem to own an iPhone 6 or later generation) thought it was cool too. I have to say that as a 6S owner myself, I too am quite impressed with everything she got in a phone for $250. I love the fingerprint scanner on the back, her pictures are quite good and battery life is much better than on my phone. I like that it has 32GB storage and that it can be extended by micro SD card - it integrates just as seamlessly as if it is all internal storage. Call quality has been good, reception in our metro area has been fine, although I can't speak to how it does in more rural areas as we haven't been off the beaten path since owning the phone. I've seen quite a few complaints about the UI, but I have none, perhaps because it feels similar to the iPhone experience, which is what we are used to. The processor is nice and speedy, no lagging or hanging so far. The phone seems pretty durable, keeping in mind that it has a glass screen protector and a slim case on it. My daughter cracked the screen protector the first weekend she owned it, but otherwise she has not managed to cause damage to the phone itself - and this is a teen that is tough on her belongings. I know it has seen multiple drops already. If I didn't have a company issued phone and was spending my own money, this is what I'd get! The only features I would miss is iMessaging, live pictures and Apple Pay. It looks very likely that my oldest daughter will choose to update her phone and get one of these too. I very highly recommend this phone. Update: The phone is now four months old, and my daughter accidentally left it in her pocket when she got into the pool. She immediately realized what she had done and we took it out of the case, dried it and put it in rice for several days. The phone boots up like normal, but the touchscreen is non responsive. We then popped off the back for better airflow and let it sit for several more days. After a week of dry time, the touchscreen still wouldn't work. The repair is $150. We're still waiting for the parts to come in, but the technician seemed very confident that it will be as good as new when he's done. While I realize that it is my daughter's own fault for getting her phone wet, we have had many phones get wet in our household, even completely submerged, and this is the first one that has actually required a repair. This experience has not changed my mind about the value of this phone, I would still have my daughter buy it. However, knowing that it is perhaps not as durable as our other phones, I would definitely have purchased an additional warranty for it in retrospect.
reviews.review_header: This phone is the best bang for your buck!

reviews.review_text: Constantlly freezes even though its not loaded down with background apps. Snapchat doesnt work well at all. This is a budget phone. If all you do is call, text, and maybe the occasional facebook an instagram, this will work alright. Having multiple apps kills the thing.
reviews.review_header: Constantlly freezes even though its not loaded down with background ...

reviews.review_text: No, it's not an Iphone X but for the price I can buy 6-7 to use as a spares. the built in camera app is really pretty good and has quite a few features: scanning, HDR, Good food (makes food look "better"), slow motion, object tracking, say "cheese" to take a picture, etc. The battery life is pretty epic as well. I unplugged fro the charger 5 hours ago and I'm currently at 93%. I can go two days easily although I'm not a massive user.
reviews.review_header: the built in camera app is really pretty good and has quite a few features

reviews.review_text: Great phone, I bought it from Amazon Warehouse Deals (9 months of a year warranty left on it) looked brand new and works flawlessly in the US with AT&T. I saw some You Tube videos showing that the screen is not resistant to scratching so bought a screen protector and a case (Remex Honor 6X Case Stand with Kickstand) right away. Overall a solid feeling phone. It was lagging at first so I backed up my SD card that was previously formatted on a Samsung and formatted it in the Honor 6x, formatted it in the Honor, put stuff back on it and now no lagging. Bluetooth would randomly disconnect so had to restore it to factory settings which fixed the issue but should have been first thing since it was a previously used phone. The finger print recognition feature on the back is SO convenient, works great to unlock the screen plus has different options on what to control like scrolling through pictures showing notifications, and it can be used by some Apps to confirm purchases instead of using a password. My gripes are that the ring tone and notification tone are together, they should be separate, sometimes at night I only want text messages and like to turn ringer all the way down. Also the alarm volume can not be set for each individual alarm so had to find one from the Google Play called "Alarm". Also installed "Nova Launcher" which is much more customizable than the default launcher. For the price a really nice phone.

AVOID - Broke quickly. Huawei will not honor warranty. Phone broke after 3 months. Microphone dead, speakers barely make sound. Reported to get RMA and warranty repair. Phone came back stating "water damage". This is pure bull. Phone was never near water/humidity. They just use cheap contracting services that apparently don't want to do any work. Use cheap excuses not to do any warranty work.
reviews.review_header: Huawei will not honor warranty. Avoid.

reviews.review_text: I was very skeptical about cheap phones. They didn't have the greatest reputation and for good reason. However, budget smart phones have come a long way and I'm not ashamed to admit that this is probably the best money I've spent for a phone. It has so many of the same features you would want from the flagship phones from other top brands. One of the best features of this phone that excels against the others is the fingerprint scanner. It's very accurate and responsive. The battery life is incredible. With moderate usage, the battery life sustains itself until the next day. This phone may not be the best, but it's certainly not the worst, and for less than $200, it's a great deal.

For the cheap phones in the $149 price range this is a good buy. If I had to buy it for the $185ish it's currently at, I'd consider spending the extra $15 and getting the Moto G5 - but, I assume that's Amazon's thinking as well....
