I currently use Cricket because the plan is super cheap for 5 lines, includes tax and this device works great with the ATT / Cricket service. I purchased the ZTE Blade Max from Cricket for relatively the same cost as this - plus a $25 "upgrade:" fee.... I had to take the ZTE back within 3 days because of the horrible delay and lag on day one.. The camera quality is great for this inexpensive of a device. The screen size and clarity is perfect for me and it is also very responsive The Fingerprint reader is very fast - though most are these days. The Speed is quite nice - Though it is still day one - but relatively 0 lag opening any apps standard apps. I do no gaming so I cannot review that. The I like buying the non-carrier phones like this because of the options to do things such as Wifi Tether without purchasing extra plans just to use the limited data I already pay for. As well, because of the ability to remove bloatware apps pre installed easily. The only cons I have so far is the EMUI launcher is not easily pushed aside by other Launchers and you need to take a few extra steps to change to Nova or others, but it's still not that big of a deal. Also, No VOLTE or WIFI Calling with carriers on 3rd party devices - but you should know that prior to purchase! Can you get better phones for this price? Yes and no. You can certainly go purchase a used HTC M9, Galaxy S6 or LG G4 used and have a better device that was considered a Flagship just a few years ago which means loads of better specs all around. But, they are used and you will almost definitely have issues with them. You can even get the Nextbit Robin brand new for even less than this, which has quite a bit better internal specs, but a worse camera, screen, no expandable memory and just overall bad design. However - For the price of this phone, compared to the others (If purchasing for the $149 like I did) it's worth it. I wouldn't get this at the current cost, because of the other better options at the $200 price point.
reviews.review_header: Great phone. For $149 or less, buy it. Otherwise pay and extra $15 to $20 for a Moto or something that's just a LITTLE better.

reviews.review_text: Bought this phone for my 16yr old. He didn't like it at first, coming from an iPhone; especially with the finger sensor on the back. But he likes it now. He's thanked me a few times for surprising him with it so I do believe he likes it.

I'm loving this phone, the fingerprint scanner is quick, the video playback is really crisp, and the processing is very fast. The battery will last me 2 days sometimes with lots of use.. Taking battery life out of your concerns when going on long day trips or traveling. The Huawei flavor of Android is nice and clean.. updated to the latest version of android, while many pricier phones are still working on older versions.. Split screen is great, as I can watch youtube, while surfing facebook or the internet... I use this now more than my tablet great buy !
reviews.review_header: Great Value, Latest Huawei Flavored Android OS, Amazing Battery Life. Will longer stick to mainstream phones. Would Buy Again.

reviews.review_text: Truly incredible deal. The Honor 6X is more than capable of performing any tasks the average person needs, and the price is almost hard for me to comprehend given the up-to-date tech available in this device. Screen is acceptably vibrant, camera is very powerful, fingerprint reader is fast and easy, battery life is surprisingly robust... there are almost no downsides to this phone unless you NEED the latest and greatest tech. The price of the phone is evident in the build quality. The overall strength of the phone is below the standards set by other flagships from Apple, Samsung, etc. The screen is also made of a more affordable type of glass that is considerably less scratch resistant than those using the latest Gorilla Glass. Beware of spare coins, keys, or other potential hazards because they will most definitely destroy your screen. Just be careful how abusive you are with the phone and everything should be fine. Besides, if you are looking at this phone then it is obvious you are looking for a good deal. I would take this phone any day over the money-devouring iPhone X or Galaxy S8.
reviews.review_header: Best Deal for A Capable Phone

reviews.review_text: For the price, this is a feature rich phone. The camera is its best feature and it's loaded. For under $200 I got 3 gig ram and 32 gig storage, 12MP camera, 1920x1080 IPS screen (just like my PC monitor), 2 quad core CPUs and more. On top of that it had rave reviews and I'm sold. The only downside I learned is that the screen can be a bit fragile but I ordered a rugged case and screen protector. I do this for all my phones. Check it out for yourself.
reviews.review_header: The camera is its best feature and it's loaded

reviews.review_text: I've had this for a few months now and so far it's great. Ive had Galaxy 3/4/5/6 and I will not go back to that over priced stuff anymore.

Love this phone, especially for the price. I use Cricket and it worked flawlessly. My Samsung broke and I replaced it with an Alcatel which was horrible. That phone wouldn't even download the phone book to my car. This one does. Speed is very fast when searching. I have come to really like the fingerprint unlock and login to some apps. If you are looking to replace a Galaxy, I think this is a great option.
reviews.review_header: Surprisingly great phone I'd never heard of...

reviews.review_text: I don't think you can do any better than this phone for the price. You'd have to go up to the $300-500 range to find something comparable. The backside fingerprint ID is ingenious. The one thing I don't like is that it's just a bit too big for my hand, and it's thin and slippery. It has fallen out of my hands more than a few times as I tried to type one handed. I'd like to see them come down in size a little. There was no reason to ever make a smartphone larger than 4".
reviews.review_header: I don't think you can do any better than this phone for the price

reviews.review_text: We've been really impressed with this phone. It is very snappy/responsive and the fingerprint scanner works well (though I'd prefer it on the front, but that's just a personal preference). I've read the recent news about US government officials dissuading citizens from using these phones, but I think that is WAY overblown. Sure, if I worked for the NSA/CIA/FBI/whatever, I wouldn't use it--but then I'd have a government-provided secure phone probably, too! I'll take my chances that the Chinese government is less than concerned about what I do on my phone. If you're on the fence, google it and read what the experts say--I was comforted by what I read. Make up your own mind, but I'm happy with mine. Also, we got an excellent deal on the phone. I would definitely consider Huawei again.

So far great Android smartphone. I don’t care if the USB is not a USB-C, as long as I can charge it and communicate with the device. The screen size is great, same exact size as my iPhone 6Plus. The fingerprint sensor is extremely fast, much faster than my iPhone. I haven’t yet assessed other features, like the battery charge, speed of apps, etc. But for the price, it’s a very good option. Only drawback is the older version of Android, thus 4 stars instead of 5.

I don't know what all the hubbub is about concerning the Moto G4 Plus...I've had mine for under 8 months and the battery almost caught fire...kept shutting off just when needed most. Decided to switch to the Honor 6x...man, I'm glad I did. Just as fast, same 1080 screen but the Honor has so many more little extras. The camera is only 12mp but images are sharper and better detailed than the 16mp Moto. Camera has so many more features as well. The Honor seems quite a bit smarter with little extras like telling you what your BlueTooth is connected to. The battery seems to never go down. The Moto eats juice. I'll check back later and give an update on all the other things this phone does.

Everything has already been said. I switched from a Samsung Note 4 back to this one, remembering how happy I was with my first Huawei Mate 2. And I am not disappointed. This phone is everything it claims, and a little more. On top of it I truly enjoy how relaxed I can handle this phone compared to my peers who are holding a $800 and up stick in their hands. If something happens to MY phone, it wouldn't be the end of the world.

Amazing. Believe the positive reviews. NOTE: It DOES takes a few GB (yes, that's gigabytes) to get EMUI updated (this can be done over your wifi), but it's so worth it. Amazing amazing. Very happy. Would buy again. Have heard this several times: "Is that the new iPhone?" Looks great, incredible price, great camera(s), longest battery ever. Read the reviews on the internet- this thing is a proven winner. [PS - I also bought the EasyAcc soft TPU case for the Honor6x, which is clear, and shows off the gold backing / white front] [PSS - Super bright screen, I also recommend a 'black out' privacy screen-protector]
Battery life is phenomenal, performance is great. Fingerprint sensor fastest I've had. SD card slot is a huge plus. Best phone I've ever had.

Used it for 2 weeks, my main gripe is Huawei's operating system. It can get slow. The camera especially can open up slow, although once opened, it makes great pictures. One can notice after a while, that the operating system is still having rough edges and some empty or unused options points to being very new, very much like still in beta testing. It does look nice, once to be like Apple, but again, given the fact, that phone has 3GB of RAM to utilize, something just slows it down, like it only has 1GB. The battery life is phenomenal. I couldn't believe my eyes that it was still on 86% after several hours and medium heavy usage, while my Note 5 was already at 55%. Give yourself an even greater boost by disabling apps you will not use. Despite all the positives, I can't give more than 3 stars, because they really need to work on that OS. They could have just opted for the unmodified pure Android, they'd have a 5 star winner!
reviews.review_header: it makes great pictures. One can notice after a while

reviews.review_text: It's a solid phone regardless of the price for all of the reasons in the other reviews. I can't give it 5 stars because Huwaei periodically pushes updates that override my wallpaper, ringtones, and launcher - that's annoying!

This phone is pretty awesome. Fast, stylish, the dual camera is nice and the screen is crisp. I upgraded from a phone I bought a few years ago and this thing is lightning fast. I get up to three days of battery life during the work week, two days on the weekend. For the price it's hard to beat. Would get 5 stars but I ordered gold and it seems the gold is actually a rose gold. My girlfriend made fun of me for having a pink phone and the consensus at work is, the phone is pink. I can't pull it out without one of the guys saying, "yo nice phone bro, you borrow that from your girlfriend?" It has come to getting a phone cover. It's still a nice phone, but rose gold is not quite gold.

After owning this phone for 3 months and very happy with the speed and features, I started to randomly stop receiving text messages. A little at first, then everyone. Voicemails stopped too. After doing a ton of research, resetting the phone, getting a new SIM, it came down to a hardware issue. I contacted Huawei support and was told I would be sent an RMA label under warranty. Two weeks later, still nothing. Called again, was told it was never sent and that they would send it next day air. Another week passes, still nothing. I call again, apparently the last two times they failed to enter my information correctly! Finally, two days after the third call, I receive an email with the RMA label. It took nearly a month to send an email?! I send the phone to Huawei under warranty and two days later, I get a package from them. Excited that they had fixed my phone, I'm shocked to see a letter stating my warranty is void "due to water damage." I've never exposed my phone to water and never had others handle my phone where this could have happened. This is a blatant cop-out. I called them up for the fourth time and am told it would be "reviewed" and I would be contacted shortly. Another week later and no contact, I've given up on this being resolved, and will not be buying another Huawei product. Buyer beware if you have any issue and expect them to fix it!
reviews.review_header: Great phone while it worked; Terrible support from Huawei

reviews.review_text: Great phone! We have always used phones that were styled like Samsung (Volume rocker and Power button on opposite sides). This phone has both of those buttons on one side. It took awhile to get use to, but my husband says he prefers it set up like this. The metal body of the phone is not only useful for protection but looks great too. Fingerprint scanner works amazingly well and is quick to respond. The only negative thing we can find with this phone is a slight connection delay when you answer a call. It takes about two seconds before the person on the other side can hear you.

Was thrilled in the beginning. Especially with Huawei advertised regularly updated. Have received zero updates in 8 months. Phone is beginning to bow, has become sluggish and glitchy. Contacted customer support about warranty, expressed my concerns, was asked, 'Will that be all?" I asked about warranty and they just hung up on me. Chat support is the same. They do not Honor warranty nor does Huawei provide the regular updates as advertised. I will purchase a reliable brand elsewhere.

I am extremely impressed with this phone after using it almost 2 months. OK, the negatives first. No USB type C and testing has shown the screen scratches easier then many phones in testing. Bluetooth audio and video do not sinc well so watching a movie you should use the headphone jack. The phone is snappy and the screen looks very nice. Battery life is very good and you can adjust how aggressive the phone deals with battery saving. Games play fine. Camera takes nice pics, perhaps not up to flagship standards but darn nice. Made me wonder why some phones are $800! Speaker could be a little louder but really OK. Calls are fine and it gets a stronger signal then other phones I have. The new 7x is out. I will be buying one. I bet you will be hearing a lot from this company in the very near future.
reviews.review_header: Really nice phone and extreme value

reviews.review_text: Just got this phone. Very impressed! I would give it 4.5 stars if possible. With this phone, I can't believe people buy 800 Dollar phones. This was $150! What a steal!!! Seriously, I really like it. If it starts breaking and freezing in the next few months I'll update. Otherwise, I'm a honor fan!
reviews.review_header: I really like it. If it starts breaking and freezing in ...

reviews.review_text: I got this phone on the 9th of October. I previously had a galaxy s7, grand x max (I think through cricket) 6s edge...etc...first for me having this brand. I am very pleased. The $200 price tag was great. Didn't really feel like spending $700 on another galaxy phone and took a leap of faith. I read pretty much all the reports on this phone before purchasing. To me I can't really tell the difference between the camera on this and the S7 other than maybe the low light??? I don't take many selfies, but I did tonight only cause I bought a Halloween mask and wanted a pic. The phone responds well. Have had no issues. It comes with a screen protector, not glass, I didn't know this, but I vaguely remember I may have read that. I had purchased the sparin tempered glass protectors as well. I only tried to put one on last night. It didn't work great. I only tried one out of the 2 pack. But wasn't really happy with it. I wrote Sparin. They wrote me back instantly. They are sending me two more free of charge as they said there had been a couple issues and want to resolve the issue. They also said if it doesn't they are coming out with a new product soon that should be even better and will give it free of charge or will refund me (their customer support is excellent). I also bought the cheap, flexible, clear phone protector. Love it. It came in a two pack as well for about $7 or $8 dollars I think. I bought a prepaid AT&T sim and have had no issues with it. Other than the fact I hardly have service here with them, but I knew that before hand. I've heard conflicting issues about Verizon and Tmobile working on this unlocked phone with 2 sim slots. I will try out Verizon tomorrow just to see what happens. Overall, I give it a 4 only because ...well,no particular reason, just probably something I'm missing and if you're like me I like to read all the ratings and sometimes I don't believe all the 5 star ratings. I know as long as it keeps working the way it has been I will contine to purchase the newest phone's from Huawei!! That is for sure. I am very impressed.

This is clearly not a flagship product it's a middle tier but for the amount of Hardware you get for the price it is a smoking deal. Hardware seems solid and looks great I do have concern that as usual with Android I will never get a software update again from Huawei.

speaker blew out after light use for 1 month, speakers not maxed out (no damage, moisture, etc). hardware is good(minus camera,it is decent), software is OKAY. seems durable but I haven't been in the habit of dropping it.
reviews.review_header: speaker blew out after light use for 1 month, ...

reviews.review_text: I'm a happy camper. I've had this about a month now. Bought after I-6+ began having screen problems. Thought this would be a temp until i-10 became available. Cancel that, I'm loving this Honor 6X. Real 2 day battery life. Android 7 working flawlessly. Finger print lock works every time. I have no cons. Photo fine, sound fine, touch screen fine. Good job Huawei!

I will say up front I purchased this phone as a temporary replacement phone for my Samsung Galaxy 7 Edge while waiting repair and I was NOT expecting an "apples to apples" comparison of devices but this phone really only gets 2 Stars from me because it serves the purpose of basic function until I can get my Samsung back. I literally struggle with myself to not throw this phone at the wall or out the car window EVERY SINGLE DAY!!! I will list just a few of my personal complaints/issues below along with a few pros. Pros: Great color Good picture quality Good Android (not phone) functionality Easy out of the box to use set up Good call and sound volume Cons: Lag time opening apps ~ esp camera Apps crash mid operation Processing speed is slow at best....videos, songs always pausing, buffering When using "back" button from any app phone will oftentimes take you to random apps that you were not in rather than back one page ie...Google search, press back button and phone takes you back to a random text message or email ( this happens so frequently that this is my single most irritating glitch of this phone) When I try to answer phone it drops calls and vise versa. Sometimes call choice is a slide selection and other times it's a button selection of whether to accept or decline, very aggravating. I end up having to call everyone back because I hang up on them no matter how I select to accept the call. Again, this may be my experience in using Samsung devices and their superiority in function that makes me dislike this phone so bad but in my opinion I would not recommend this phone to any adult who needs to conduct business matters or does much on their device other than minimal calling and texting. This is just not your device.

I had a cheap Huawei go phone from Walmart that cost around $75, it was a good phone but due to four little hooligans, one of them broke my phone. I searched for hours for a phone in my price range that would be a good quality phone, that took a nano sim and a slot for a micro SD card for extra storage, and this had it. Plus, I am not in a cell phone plan, I'm just using this as a gophone for at&t. I am SO happy with this purchase. The camera is absolutely AMAZING. I take a ton of pictures and I am so pleased with the camera and all the features. You won't be disappointed. I went out on a limb buying this and I am so glad I did.
reviews.review_header: Takes nano sim, has micro SD slot, can use as a gophone and has an AMAZING camera!

reviews.review_text: Purchased for my mom. It is a pretty basic android phone with great picture taking capabilities. A bit slower than my S8, but hey, this thing was less than $200. The battery is also really good and can last at least 2 days from what my mom tells me. The screen is quite large as well. This is a pretty good bargain for someone who doesn't want to spend $800+ on a smart phone.
reviews.review_header: It is a pretty basic android phone with great picture taking capabilities

reviews.review_text: No problems whatsoever with this phone. It's fast, the screen resolution is great and the camera takes very good pictures. I don't make many calls but the reception and voice quality seems good. Battery is also above average. I'm getting almost 2 days with light use (Email, chats, browsing, some music). I wish it was stock Android, but Huawei's interface is not that bad. I would recommend using it with a case, as the back is quite slippery.

I have had the honor 6x for about two months now,moving on from a lg g4. Positive of this phone is build quality,and excellent battery life(5-6 screen on time).The area it really stood out for me is in performance it is really amazing for the price and keeps up very well doing everyday task.My negatives about that phone would be speakers are really just to low for most sanarios,camera is good for the price range.I found images to always lack a tad bit of sharpness and colours are dull,there is a option to increase contrast so it helps a bit.Other things such as screen,front facing camera are on par with the competition.My biggest concern about this device I the lack of nougat update which Honor promised in March but still isn't hear.Hauwei/Honour doesn't have the best record for keeping phones updated keep this in mind before purchasing.
reviews.review_header: and excellent battery life(5-6 screen on time)

reviews.review_text: I've had this phone for a week and I really like it! The camera is really nice! The downside is that the aperture settings don't work well when you have multiple people in the frame. It'll focus on one person or object only. Great for taking photos with a single subject. The phone is fast, and supports 4g LTE for ATT. I have never owned a dual sim phone with that capability. It's nice moving up from H+. 32 gigs, and about 9 gigs of it is bloatware. Overall performance is very good! Great phone especially for the price. A lot of people were astonished that I only paid about $180 for it.
reviews.review_header: You get more than what you pay for.

reviews.review_text: I really like this phone. Very high quality, excellent performance, solid network connectivity and the Emotion UI is really full-featured and easy to use. I would recommend this phone to anyone. I was concerned about security issues since where I work we have extremely tight network security and constant Wi-Fi monitoring for any connections going overseas. Several phones employees have bought off eBay have been banned from using our employer's Wi-Fi because of this. However, this phone has never once popped up with security warnings. I'm quickly becoming a big Huawei fan and am eyeing the Honor 7x or Mate 10 as an upgrade for my wife's Xperia.

Bought this for my mom and she loves it so far! I'm very surprised at the quality of the phone, given that it's made by a Chinese company! This phone had great features and super user-friendly! The design is simple, sleek, and stylish. Camera worked so much better than my iPhone's! I'm now seriously considering switching to Huawei myself since that's what my husband, and now my mom, swear by.

There is no debate. This phone offers the most bang for the $150 bucks that I bought it for. Aluminum unibody, dual cameras, Touch ID, 5.5" full HD display, thin bezels, great OS, octa-core processor, 32GB internal storage, dual SIM, 3GB RAM, and a 3300 mAh battery. It can take gorgeous photos. Wide aperture mode actually works, looks impressive and adds a little "wow" factor to your images. Touch ID sensor on this phone is faster than on many flagship phones, including the iPhone 8 and Galaxy S8. Both EMUI 4.0 and 5.0 are polished, neat, quick, and easy to use. The screen can be split to use two apps at once. Little to no unnecessary processes going on in the background. No app compatibility issues due to EMUI so far. The included storage sense and RAM optimization software is useful. Also includes many of the latest features; hotspot, screen recorder, eye comfort, resolution optimization, and Miracast among others. Unlike many others in this price range, this phone won't get uncomfortably hot after a while of usage, the processor is fast enough to handle multiple apps at once, the large amount of RAM won't make your phone crash if you multitask too quickly, and the back cover won't go flying off when you drop it because there is none. The large battery complements the large display. I use power intensive apps regularly from the moment I wake up at 6 AM, until 5 PM when I arrive home, and there is always 40% or more power remaining. The closest competitor there was when I bought the Honor 6X was the Moto G5 at $200... After using this one for a day, it worked as expected, and I was glad I made the right choice. The newer Honor 7X has now been released, so make sure to look into that phone before buying this one. I trust that it will improve over its predecessor.

I have been using this for about 3 months. I have always used the current android phones and paid well more than I wanted to so I did some research and purchased this Huawei phone. It's not a bad phone for the money and my bill is less than 1/2 prices than it was prior. I chose finances over quality and I'm ok with that. If this phone lasts a couple of years, I will buy it (newer version) again.

I've been a consumer of BLÜ cell phones for years. I decided to try this one and can't say I'm not happy with it. I still have to get use to the way it works but all in all it's been pretty good. Every once in a while it'll restart and when I'm in Bluetooth it answers every single call, which I do not like, but that might be some setting I haven't found yet. I would recommend this phone.
reviews.review_header: From BLÜ to Huawei, can't say I haven't had to get use to it, but I definitely recommend it

reviews.review_text: Pros: Premium materials and design, fast fingerprint sensor, surprisingly snappy performance, dual lens camera, bright and vibrant screen, good call quality, amazing battery life! Cons: major OS woes, no NFC (no Android pay) Single speaker is a bit soft, no wireless charging, micro USB, no OIS for videos (shaky can galore), accessories are flimsy. Verdict: The best mid range phone of 2017 so far despite it's design weaknesses. I bought this to replace a OnePlus One which has stopped receiving OS updates. Here's hoping that Huawei follow up on their promises of a Nougat/EMUI update.
reviews.review_header: Excellent Midrange Phone Disguising As A Flagship

reviews.review_text: Love this phone. As an avid iPhone user, I got tired of spending so much on iPhone upgrades. For less than $200, I got a phone the same size as an iPhone 6+. It is quick, bright, and the battery lasts a long time (so far). Small learning curve in getting all my customary apps in Android format. Overall, I will probably upgrade to another Huawei in the future.

Great phone for the price. I really wanted the 7x but they sold out almost immediately. The only reason I can't give it a 5star is because the EMUI is modeled to look like ios which I find revolting to look at however, they're great with updates. I don't have Oreo yet but they announced they're working on it and I do get security patches within a week of google pushing them to their devices which is far far faster than my Sony phone that it replaced. I just wish it was waterproof that was my favorite part about Sony.

This phone makes me feel like a sucker having spent so much more on other phones in the past. I've been with Android since the G1. This might be my favorite Android phone thus far. I don't game but for everything else...it performs perfectly for me. LTE is solid. No echoing. Bluetooth hooks up fast. 64gb sd card works great Thumbprint is blazingly fast. Only thing I'm not to keen on is the audio chipset is pretty weaksauce. I use PowerAmp so the eq fixes mist of my issues regarding sound quality. That's subjective stuff though. Will by from Hauwei again.
reviews.review_header: This phone makes me feel like a sucker having spent so much more on other ...

reviews.review_text: I poured over hours of reviews and am very, very pleased with my new $150 Honor 6X and am happily acclimating to the Android world. :) Pros: Simple finger sensor, incredibly long battery life, super-vivid screen, fast processing speed, great camera. Cons: No built-in parental controls. (This is one of the best features of Apple Iphones.)
reviews.review_header: FYI - NO PARENTAL CONTROLS available - must download app(s)

reviews.review_text: For the price, this phone has been great! The quality and feel is very nice and you dont even notice you have a Chinese phone and not a "top of the line" S-something or iPhone. I cant speak to the technical advantages and disadvantages, but I can say that for my needs, it is excellent. Id say the price point is one of its strongest pros!

Got it in time. I use this as backup phone for keeping a secondary number and an oversee number live. Very nicely built. The metal frame makes it a little heavier than a Galaxy or iPhone. The dual sim card and unlocked feature works very well. Setting up two sim cards takes no effort at all. The user interface is not as sophisticated as a Galaxy or iPhone, but not a big issue for me as a backup phone. The camera is OK. Galaxy still have much better color than this one. Speed is good. Overall, it is better than I had expected. Really a good bargain for the price.
reviews.review_header: A decent phone and good bargain

reviews.review_text: Love this phone...I know it is the Chinese version of other big name phone...but really has been working even better then expected.. Very much worth trying it..

Great phone overall I dislike this notification when operating mic "com.google.android.googlequicksearchbox:intereactor will not be able to record right now" message pop up everytime when using mic app such as Facebook call or hivoice. No updates for emui. Screen looks good but cracks easily on small drops. Repair for crack screen is about 60-80 which isn't to bad it comes with a film screen protector. I miss having an ir blaster on my phone's I wish it had it built in. I know their higher end one has it. Also WiFi is 2.4 GHz most phone have 5ghz. Missing the USB c as well. Likes: quickly opens apps and doesn't hang for multi tasking. Looks great compared to other flag ship phone's Lots of space 32gb is a standard size now with all the apps out there.
reviews.review_header: Mic and Google Nag screen message

reviews.review_text: I am so glad I purchased this phone. For the price, it performed well above my expectations. An incredible battery that lasts so long. Sometimes it's 2 days before I need to charge. The picture quality surprised me and I have little to complain about. Works fast with the updated Andriod and I plan on sticking with the company.

Its a pretty good phone, for the price. I usually go for nexus devices, because I like pure Google. However the newest nexus is not available with my carrier, and google is starting to violate your wallet, just like the carriers. The phones specs are good, and if does the job well. Not too crazy about the stock UI, so some tweaking is needed. Ive noticed a slight lag in navigating the different apps, but its acceptable. Battery life is excellent. It lasts all day with heavy use.

So I like to wait a few months before reviewing a phone, because an immediate review is just an initial impression. Now, I'm not a power phone user by any stretch. I make calls, send texts, use it for my GPS and some browsing. That's it. I don't game or stream. For what I do, this phone fits my needs perfectly. I love the size. I had a Nexus 6 that was just too large, and a Samsung Alpha that was just a bit too small. This one feels comfy in my pocket, with a screen size I like. It's also reliable, well, so far. My last 3 phones have died due to HW issues. Maybe this one will too, but 3 months in, it hasn't gotten the least bit buggy on me. That's really all I care about. I want a phone that works and has a decent battery. Oh, I also need a phone that gets regular patches and updates or my company wont let me access my work email. Huawei seems to have a good record of doing that, and so far I have not been denied access. So all in all, I'm giving it 5 stars as of 8/24. You can rest assured that if this review is still 5 stars on the day you're reading it, it's still working for me. The day this phone dies, I will post it here and update accordingly.

So far, I am loving this phone. Great size and great value. The camera is fantastic. I am a photographer amateur and to my surprise this phone takes very nice pictures. The image is sharp and colors are beautiful. If you add a photo editor app you can actually make great photos. The functions are easy and the reception is pretty good and quite fast. I am not a phone addict and I don't need a lot of apps but I would say that overal this phone has fantastic features for its price. This phone DO COME with flightlight.

This phone is AWESOME! The honor 6x has been compared to the Iphone 6s and the Galaxy 7, and I can see why. It has an awesome user interface (updates to EMUI 5.0), great display, sound, app drawer, etc. I had recently purchased the Blu Life One X2 and that phone is a joke compared to the Honor 6x. I've also owned an Iphone 6x Plus and this is definitely on par. The octo-core processor is clearly doing it's job, this phone is incredibly responsive. I connected it to my car's bluetooth with no problem. The Honor 8 has a faster processor and better camera, but the 6x is not far behind. 09/14/2017 update The phone kept getting seriously sluggish on me. A number of bugs kept it from working as it should have. Had a hard time reselling the phone, finally gave it away.

I'm giving this a 3 star review, because up till now was a 4 star, because phone has a little freezing points and this week, with out no reason at all it deleted the names of 95% of my contacts (not happy) with that!
reviews.review_header: I'm giving this a 3 star review, because up ...

reviews.review_text: I bought this phone last May and it worked perfectly until a month or two ago. All apps that requires GPS started to have problem. For example, while I was driving on highway and using either with Google map or Inrix, it kept showing I am off road. And my location only refresh every 15 seconds. Essentially, I can't use my cell phone for navigation purpose anymore. I did a factory reset but it didn't help. Only ended up losing some of the data and setting. I send an email to Huawei tech support but never heard anything back. I wish this happen in the first month then I still can return it to Amazon.
reviews.review_header: GPS having problem after a few months of usage

reviews.review_text: I bought this for my 9 year old. We have had it for about 2 months now. I can say that it holds up to constant use. The size is just right. She uses it mostly for games. I am surprised it is better than my Samsung Galaxy in terms of battery life. I am very happy with this phone.
It gets the job done for her & that's good enough for me! Economical pricing makes this a winner!

The phone is excellent, so far I'm very happy with my purchase. My recommendation: update asap to emui 5.0 (2.35 Gb more o less) because with the software version installed (emui4.0) the avg free ram is about 1.4-1.5 Gb, after updating to emui 5.0 the avg free ram on the phone is 2.0 - 2.1 Gb a really nice improvement; also huawei confirmed the update to oreo by late january (search xda for the info) that's the only thing holding me to install a custom recovery and rooting the phone (I'm a root freak with my phones)

This phone works great. This is actually my second one. . I brought one from best buy in gold but I dropped it & cracked the screen after only having had it for 7 days & I spent 264.00 for that phone so when I saw this phone for 174.99 on sale last week I jumped on it. this is a great budget smart phone and works well with several apps I will be using it in haiti when I move there in three weeks
reviews.review_header: This phone works great. This is actually my second one

reviews.review_text: I love this phone! After owning four Blu products -- and after all four developed issues -- I stepped out on faith and tried this Huawei. Two of the power ports on Blu phones loosened over time and the phones refused to take a charge...VERY FRUSTRATING! After a few months of use, the connector on the Honor seems solid and I'm confident I won't have the same issue. The performance of this phone is excellent for the money! It runs rings around the comparable Blu product for speed, multi-tasking and battery life. I'm a pretty heavy social media user; I check Facebook about 3 or 4 times daily and I've never had to plug in during the day. I also use it to stream radio from time to time, and it holds up well there too. And when I realize I've been streaming for a few hours and check my remaining battery life, it will fully charge from about 25% to full in about 30-45 minutes. The Hauwei Android interface is well designed. A nice feature is it automatically shows weather for dual locales as you travel, i.e., it always shows your "home" weather, and if you drive 30 miles away, you'll see the weather for that town or suburb too. My only criticism is launching the camera and the flashlight. The flashlight is especially frustrating because it takes multiple taps to engage it, then to shut it off. I haven't spent enough time learning the camera -- and maybe I was so used to using the camera on the Blu that it became second nature -- so that's on me to familiarize myself more with the features and functions. The pictures I have taken are very, very nice though...even low-light interiors show pretty good detail. In the sub $200 price range, this is a winner!

Preliminary report, all is well. The phone operates smoothly and quickly as it should. The only complaint thus far is that it doesn't seem to have IR, meaning I can't use it as a universal remote for my TV. But, alas, nothing is perfect. For the price and performance otherwise, it's fantastic. More details to follow in a few months.

I cannot believe how great this phone is. Took a picture of the cat and you can count the hairs it's so sharp. Battery is a treat and actally does last at least 2 days. Everything about this phone is high end without the high end pricetag. Love it!

LG G6 owner here. I bought this phone for my dad and wow, am I impressed! It's an incredible budget smartphone, but actually can keep it's own when compared to flagship models. Super fast with apps and the perfect screen for someone like my dad, who has large hands and needs a big display, but also is light-weight and comfortable for any user. Tools are simple and straight forward, and Huawei isn't too in your face about any extras they include. I wish I knew about Huawei before I dove into a carrier-locked cellphone. Never again.
reviews.review_header: Incredible phone for the price, Samsung and Apple don't want people hearing about these for a reason!

reviews.review_text: This phone is great. Works as expected. For all the people that gave bad review remember you only paid 249.00 THIS IS NOT A FLAGSHIP PHONE!. The phone runs smooth no lag, speaker is average, camera is good and screen is pretty good to. Best feature on phone is battery life I would recommend to anyone looking for a great phone for the price.
reviews.review_header: This phone is great. Works as expected

reviews.review_text: After 3 days unpacked works fine. Pretty big size if you got use to carry some phones in your pocket but very confortable for reading and manipulating. Nice colors, pretty good camera. Not started yet the fingerprint interface. I appreciate the Android 7.0 interface, very good. It updated the same day after start it for the first time. I'll keep informing. Update 10 days after having it I am really very happy with it. At the end of 1 day using it in all purposes and apps the charge still keep some 40% battery which is really good. I usually re-charge it at 15% so the battery life average is around 29-30 work hours. It's fast, the 32Gb internal memory allows a good number of apps downloads, internal sound it¡s still better than all my previous Samsungs, display have good colors and temperature keeps cool at the normal usage. So far, I love it.
reviews.review_header: Good phone for a reasonable price.

reviews.review_text: Overall its incredible quality for the price ($150). It performs much better and is much sleeker than most phones around this price. I've had about 4 budget phones and this doesn't even feel like a budget phone when you hold it. The fingerprint scanner is very fast and overall performance is beautiful. Definitely recommended. Issues you should be aware of: Snapchat is very glitchy Doesn't sync with Fitbit
reviews.review_header: It performs much better and is much sleeker than most phones around this ...

reviews.review_text: Really wanted to like and have this product...good battery life.......major issue is that it freezes and camera basically is super slow.......Really dropped idea to return it as I liked the phone...But I guess could not keep up with the sluggishness ..finally, returned.
reviews.review_header: Really wanted to like and have this product

reviews.review_text: I have had a lots of cell phone 📱 but the Honor 6x is the absolute best phone I have ever had. I 😍 the quality of the 📱. I have paid a lot more for phones that wasn't even close to the level of this 1⃣. I have definitely found a brand that makes me happy 😊 and I would definitely recommend it to anyone who needs a new phone. Thanks

I bought my honor 6x during a black Friday sale where it had been knocked down to 150 dollars. For the money, This phone cannot be beat in value. A dual camera, with a fingerprint scanner and good build quality makes this a fantastic buy. The UI after the update out of the box is very appealing and usable. Operations are buttery smooth and my battery doesn't even go down 10% after am hour of heavy use. Buy this phone if you are a baller on a budget like myself.

Very nice phone for the price. For $150 there is nothing to compain about. It works very well and is fast and the display is great. The fingerprint scanner seems very decent too. The only downside that I see on this phone when compared along a galaxy S7 is that the camera falls way short. However, it still takes great photos in well-lit situations.
reviews.review_header: Probably the best phone for under $300.

reviews.review_text: Great phone for the price. Strongly recommend if you're coming from something like a samsung s4!

When I first purchased this phone in December I loved it. It seem to have plenty of memory and the features works great. I like the phone so much I bought my wife one. But in the last month it keeps locking up. Mainly the camera locks up but occasionally the whole phone will lock up and the only way to resolve it is to repower it. My wife is having the same problems. In its current state I would not recommend this phone. I regret buying it but I will reach out to Honor to see if they have a fix.
reviews.review_header: Loved it at first, hate it now. I don't recommend anyone purchase in his phone.

reviews.review_text: At first I loved this phone, but after about a month or two my mobile data wouldn't work anymore. It's not my provider, it's the phone. I turned on my mobile data in the settings and it still wouldn't work, after about a week it started working again for no obvious reason. This has happened consistently ever since. It will randomly stop working for a week or so then start again and no matter what I do in the settings I can't fix it, restarts don't help, nothing helps. I can't explain how frustrating this is when I need my navigation or I'm doing something for work and I'm not around wifi, which I shouldn't need to be. Now about 5 months into having the phone it has started doing the same thing with my text messages. I have unlimited everything on my phone plan and have never had any problems in the past with my other phones. But now I will try to send a text and it will say that I'm not registered on the network... I'm starting to really hate this phone because I never know from one day to the next if it will let me text or access anything that requires internet. And the camera is nowhere near as good as it claims. I took pictures of my daughters first ever orchestra concert and none of them turned out good.

I love this phone I originally had the Huawei Mate for three years and also loved it until I dropped it and cracked the corner it still worked with no problems but was getting old enough that it wouldn't run some apps because it was only a 4.1 android, I still use it with the wifi to take pictures, watch movies and play games and so on with the kids. So when I saw the Huawei Honor 6x on special for prime members only I had to know about this phone it does everything you would expect out of a smart phone and more. The price is out of this world I believe you can get one from amazon for approximately $179.99 with prime shipping you will have to verify the current cost. I believe the Huawei Honor 6x Dual Camera and Dual Sim card slots is a great phone for someone starting out or financially can't afford the very expensive high end phones, you won't be disappointed. Anyone can buy this phone.
reviews.review_header: Top of the line for the cost

reviews.review_text: This is a good phone,the camera is awesome.The phone is very responsive and screen quality is nice but the sound is junk, it's a very low volume in call mode and listening to music is really bad off of the phone,it's supposed to have two speakers in it but one is just holes cut in the shell of the phone. If you are a big music listener I would avoid this phone.

Amazing camera, both for the price and regardless of the price. Comes with bloatware, but some are uninstallable, and with 32GB of storage, I can simply kill-off, I mean disable, the rest of the apps I don't want and leave them, rather than try to root the phone so I can fully uninstall them and free up ROM. This also leaves the warranty intact, so I can update to new versions still. EMUI is a fairly stock experience, but if you don't like it you can install your own launcher and use that instead. I prefer Nova Launcher myself, because it has the scrolling app dock, et al. I have Earth & Moon Pro wallpaper installed and turned up to maximum quality, which takes up a lot of resources, yet I've had no issues, unless I'm running a lot of apps in general. The phone is incredibly thin despite it's huge battery, which is very nice, and the speakers are above average, maybe even excellent if you bounce the sound off an object. The screen has bright, vivid colors when turned up all the way, although the colors dull if you dim the display. There are a few minor cons, although the worst is that with the EMUI, I cannot install a screensaver and can only do a slideshow as the screensaver, no matter what app I try to install to fix it. Pros: EVERYTHING! (Except for the cons below) Seriously, it's a fantastic phone. You've looked at the specs right? Here's what I like the most, -Price -Great day/night rear camera. No, of course it's not DSLR quality, but it's sharp, and fully featured, with all sorts of pro and fun shooting modes. -Front camera is 8MP. -Thin and light. -Huge battery, easily lasts over a day. -Above average speakers. -Price! -Huge ROM, RAM, processor, and full array of sensors (look at the specs). -Has the second latest Android version (latest hasn't hit any but a few manufacturers yet, but Nougat is barely any older). -HONOR is a great name. ;) -Almost forgot: Speedy, accurate fingerprint sensor. (Can be a little slow if you don't wake up the device first.) -It has a audio jack!!! (Apple, I'm looking at you.) -It has the radio chip enabled, so you can listen to the actual radio if you open the app and have a plug in the audio jack. (Yes, that's a thing. Look it up. I'm looking at you again Apple, and other large phone manufacturers.) -DID I MENTION THE PRICE?! I had $200 as the highest I was willing to pay for a new phone, and also a list of features I wanted. Wherever I looked, the price was either way too high or the specs just weren't up to what I was looking for and/or were mixed reviews. This phone has more than I could have dreamt of, and was within budget. It's a great deal for a phone that can actually kind of rival the latest iPhones. Cons: I only have a few minor complaints, -Extremely limited screensaver options, and additional apps don't help. -Wide aperture enhancements don't look natural. Regular shooting mode has good depth though when an object is selected to focus on. Most enhanced aperture cameras don't work great anyway though. -Large footprint. The large display is nice to look at and type on, but is a little tall for some pockets. Just something to get used to though. However, I would be willing to add 10% to the width if it could be scaled down 10% (to preserve battery capacity). -Screen resolution is great (Full HD), but still not optimum if you love or want to tinker with Google Cardboard 3D viewing or similar. 4K is needed for a clear picture in the 3D viewers. -2.5D display looks and feels great, but makes it difficult or impossible to find screen protectors that fit. Not sure how scratch resistant the phone screen actually is, but I've been using it without a screen protector for a few months with no problem. -Colors on the display dull if the screen is dimmed. -Radio app could use a couple extra features, such as scrolling name of station and song, as well as better reliability when run in the background. I highly recommend this phone to anyone looking for a new phone, regardless of budget. Actually the 7X is out now, and is even better at the same price (although I still slightly prefer this one because the camera on the 6X is centered instead of to the side). What I would recommend to Huawei in their future generations of phones: -Fix the cons stated above, except for the 2.5D edge. The curved edge is really nice, even if it makes finding screen protectors hard. -Keep the camera centered - it helps for finding macro shots and for mounting as a gun camera (for those who would). -Move the fingerprint sensor to the power button. Others are starting to do that and it's both natural and easy to trigger without picking up the phone. -Add a speaker to the top. That would add stereo audio in landscape mode. That can be forward facing, but if they remain outward facing, the sound can be bounced off a couple objects on each side for enhanced audio. -Keep doing what you're doing with upgrading the software. -Make the SIM tray accept micro as well as nano sim for convenience. Maybe provide two different SIM trays? -On a slightly more expensive model, I would like to see added: -Add in a gyroscope and pressure/temperature sensor in addition to the ones you have in there. -Change the micro USB to USB-C. -Add wireless charging. -Pull in the specs from the Honor 8 (of course).
reviews.review_header: Best Phone for the Money or Otherwise

reviews.review_text: I am trying to like this phone but see too many red flags. I love the storage card feature from android. I switched from Apple iPhone 6 and found this phone to unlock many features, screen casting, storage problems. Recently my phone will not connect to a computer or any other USB device. I enjoy connecting my DSLR to my phone to share my pictures but abruptly it stopped. I have searched countless forums and even asked for support, still waiting. I have only had the phone for a month and half. Recently I saw an article in the media that says to us users not to buy Huawei per the FBI and Homeland Security??? They say Huawei can't be trusted and China is trying to get into our US phone network one way or another, what what???
reviews.review_header: I am trying to like this phone but see too many red flags

reviews.review_text: I still can't believe this phone only cost $140! The battery life is incredible. The picture on it is stunning. It takes magnificent pictures. I have zero complaints. Its a terrified phone, BTW I downgraded from a samsung 8.

had it 1 month now and it already has blown me away. lasts over a full day easily. DOES NOT GET HOT. its fast and the OS is lovely. I was recommended this by some techhies at schoo and its the best $200 ever spent. love the wallpapers and customizations and the overall feel and function of it. i cam from samsungs and LG and the LG got hot and friend themselves. i am a HEAVY user and do 20gb per month and this has so far been amazing. I'll be sticking with the honor line for sure. get the spigen bumper case and ur good to go. it even has a light use screen protector installed!
reviews.review_header: lasts over a full day easily. DOES NOT GET HOT

reviews.review_text: For the price this phone is amazing! Has a metal body, screams quality, compared to my iPhone 6s Plus it’s really close on the outside. Screen is better than any low budget phone out there. No lag, great UI, camera is not the best but still takes great pictures. A+ Overall. Again compared to the iPhone I would still pick the iPhone but if I needed a budget phone it will meet and exceed expectations
reviews.review_header: For the price this phone is amazing! Has a metal body

reviews.review_text: There are many cool features on this phone, like fingerprint unlock, however, it is constantly freezing and the photo app is always freezing when i first open it, which really makes taking photos difficult. Given that we use our phones as cameras now, you would think that this would not happen. I am giving it two stars because of the freezing issue with the camera app and other apps upon opening.
reviews.review_header: There are many cool features on this phone

reviews.review_text: I was sceptical about buying a phone online especially when I couldn't ask questions about it or visibly touch or see it before buying. But when my 4th iPhone crashed /broke beyond repair, I was not willing to spend the same money again. That is when I researched this Huawei honor 6x phone, I read the reviews and also asked people with Huawei model phones and they all appeared very happy with them. It was very tempting considering you get the same if not a better phone for a fraction of the price. I have to say when I received this phone, I was pleasntly surprised and very impressed with it. It feels expensive, the screen is a lot bigger than what I had before and the picture and camera quality is the best I've ever had. The sharpness and colour of the pictures is fantastic. It is much better than any of the iPhone cameras I've had before. I love that there is a fingerprint sensor which allows you to open apps and use the phone more quickly. It is also better for security reasons. Overall it is an excellent phone, I would recommend to anyone who is sick of iPhone constantly breaking/crashing. I promise you, you won't regret it. And you'll save yourself a lot of pennies. If it breaks tommorow, I would buy it again. As many people have complimented my photos and asked if I used a professional camera. You won't be disappointed.

Insane battery life, good gaming power, and nice overall feel. Only con is no NFC chip but thats sketchy to me anyway. I can watch youtube and twitch throughout the day, listen to mp3s, play some GTA vice city or emulators, watch some more twitch or youtube on the bus and the phone is barely at 30% battery life. One of the best phones I have ever owned.

Once I installed Google Now launcher to replace the native EMUI variation of Android, I started loving this phone. You might get used to EMUI but my question would be, why would you want to? It's not nearly as intuitive as stock Android operating system. Fortunately, you don't have to do anything extraordinary (like Rooting) to install Google Now and once that's done, it works, acts, looks, and feels like a much more expensive phone. I withheld one star because of the EMUI interface, but everything else is five stars.
reviews.review_header: Fortunately, you don't have to do anything extraordinary (like ...

reviews.review_text: bought this for my mom and she loves it. camera is on point and instant. bigger screen so she can see stuff better and she can take better pics. she likes the finger print scanner on back.

I have been using the phone for 2 weeks and noticed that sound quality via Bluetooth is extremly poor. Im pairing it with Bose Quietcomfort 35 headphones, which are proven to be flawless. wire connecting the headphones to the phone also give low sound. to conclude, sound quality is not good at all!
reviews.review_header: Hearing music via bluetooth with wireless headphones is terible

reviews.review_text: This phone has a ton of features for a 'budget' price: dual cameras, fingerprint reader, good quality screen. Camera is fast and responsive, excellent images. Apps load quickly, no lag detected. It has plenty of built in apps, but these can be easily removed. There's dual sim slots, plenty of built in storage, plus a micro SD slot up to 2TB extra storage. Very happy with the purchase, this is a fantastic value device!

I have mixed feeling about this phone. I currently have a iPhone 6S plus as a personal phone. Although, I was issued an iPhone 6 4.7" from my company, the screen was just a bit small to read and it only came with 16 GB. I take a lot of pictures when I go to the field so the lack of storage and the ability to expand are major problems. Since it is for company use, I didn't want to spend a lot of money and having an Android phone would be nice compliment to the iPhone. I previously owned a Honor 5X and for the price ($120), I really couldn't complain about the features but the constant lags were a huge problem. The processor of the 5X was just too slow. I read that the 6X has a much faster processor and its comes with 32 GB internal storage and 3 GB of rams. Based on the spec, the 6X is a much improved phone. Since I received the phone two weeks ago, I have taken it with me on two company trips and so far so good. There were still occasional lags but not significant. I have done speed tests on the iPhone 6S plus and the Honor 6X, the iPhone performed better in app opening and web page loading but not by much. The fingerprint sensor on the 6X is very responsive and fast and I like it much more than the iPhone 6S plus. I just wish that there are more Android apps with fingerprint unlock available. Also, I notice the 6X has a much brighter screen and colors are more rich than the 5X. So, why the 1 star reduction? For the $80 price difference between the 5X (currently $170) and 6X, the improvements were noticeable but not substantial. The dual cameras make little improvement to the picture quality. During low light condition, 6X photo quality is still not great. For the price, I can deal with no NFC but the wifi is still N and not AC which is pretty much the standard. There is also no OTG support. I tried to output media content to a TV via a OTG cable and the 6X did not support it. Conclusion, the 6X is a good but not a great phone for $250. I think $200 is more appropriately priced. The bright 5.5" 1080p, expandable memory storage, fingerprint sensor and metal casing are pluses. The lack of AC wifi and OTG support don't justify the $80 price increase from the 5X. At the end, I went for the LG G5. This phone comes with AC wifi, 4 GB ram, NFC and 32 GB internal storage. The only negative is the screen is only 5.3" which is a bit smaller in comparison to the Honor 6X. I got a "Like New" condition one from eBay for $210.
reviews.review_header: Improved over the Honor 5X but not substantial

reviews.review_text: I needed a replacement phone for my LG v10 that suffered the bootloop of death. I've heard about Honor and their midrange phones. So I decided to buy a Honor 6x after reading a few reviews on various Android based websites. This phone has a premium feel and not a downgrade much from my v10. But I have a one knock on it. The camera lacks OIS and it makes the pictures crappy at times. But it's expected for a midrange phone though. Other than that, I really like this phone until I can afford another flagship again.

It's fast, every pics taken with it is high quality. Fingerprints lock is very responsive OS takes time to get used to, but themes solve the problem There will an OREO update coming so looking forward for that if you want to buy this phone. I returned this because I getting another phone from Huawei. Good for your money.
reviews.review_header: Best phone I got on this site!!!

reviews.review_text: I bought this for my ex. I felt bad because he was using a crappy cell phone, always running out of space, lagging, so-so pictures, etc. Phone is fast, spacious, no lag and he takes excellent pictures. He even entered one of his pictures in a photography contest, won, and got it featured in the local paper. While I know when it comes to electronics sometimes you are unlucky, but this is an excellent phone. Solid performer. I'd recommend this.
Bought this device because I heard so much about it. Its so great I actually switched carriers to use it. Screen is great, quality of the phone is great.
reviews.review_header: Its so great I actually switched carriers to use it

reviews.review_text: Phone does not work with any of the Google Sync services. The Calendar Sync, Contacts sync, and Google Cards feature does not work. The camera quality is really terrible. Reaching out to Huawei US support has not helped. They asked me to try a couple of things, and both of them has not worked. Guess they were just trying to shoot in the dark. Unfortunately now that the Amazon return window has expired, I am just left with this piece of junk which I regret buying. To be fair - the only feature I like about this phone is the fingerprint sensor, which is really fast.
reviews.review_header: Terrible for an Android phone, and even more terrible Customer Support

reviews.review_text: I had Bluetooth issues which I have never experienced with any other phone. While connected to my Bluetooth headphones or bluetooth speakers and attempting to make phone calls, the call would work up until someone answered the phone on the other end, then the call will drop every time. Manipulating settings AND factory reset still did not solve this issue. I reached out to Huawei customer service, and they only offered to have me send the phone back to them. I would not recommend this phone.

This is a great phone within this price range. I bought this for my wife who needed a new phone fast since her previous phone broke due to water damage. She loves it. the fingerprint reader is extremely fast without a lag, the screen is really bright, and the best part is the battery. It lasts her well over a day, lasting up to two days on moderate use. On video and streaming use lasts all day with about 15% left at night. If you forget to charge your phone, no worries because this phone is equipped with fast charging and within minutes your ready to go. The overall build feels premium with the gold metal rear and glass front, and it's also sturdy with a few drops to the ground no scratches or dents yet. the only thing neither one of us are a huge fan of is the slight lag of the camera when taking pictures. The Honor comes with two lenses which helps capture really clear and bright colors... when the image is still and you don't move because of the camera lag, hard to take pictures of energetic baby on the move with a camera the lags since on my Galaxy S6 I can capture pictures quickly with out blur. but this phone is also not expensive, and for one small drawback the Honor 6x is an amazing phone for the price and performance. Definitely recommend.
reviews.review_header: High end features, long lasting battery, great price.

reviews.review_text: I got this phone about 3 months ago. While yes, this is a cheap phone, the quality is very poor. The system runs very slowly and most of my apps do not work efficiently with it. Often times the phone freezes and my apps force close. In particular, this phone is especially horrible when using snapchat. It forces close almost everytime, it lags taking photos, it lags sending photos, it lags opening the keyboard and typing, it doesn't sense when you use the drawing tool, and once snapchat stops working the whole phone stops working. In addition, the camera quality could be MUCH better. I recently experienced the phone being on volume despite the fact that I had it on silent and the headphones were in. The lock screen changes to an old lock screen and flips the image sideways when the system UI forces close (which is often especially after using snapchat) so that I have to restart it constantly. The only positive thing about this phone is the battery life which I have been noticing slowly decline (as most phones do) . This phone isn't worth the buy. Save yourself the $200 and buy a better phone.
reviews.review_header: the quality is very poor. The system runs very slowly and most of ...

reviews.review_text: I had high hopes for this phone, but I guess the saying "you get what you pay for" is true. This a bloatware riddled monstrosity that has degenerated into frustratingly slow, unresponsive piece of garbage in the span of 3 short months. It's dropping calls, not sending texts or delaying them to the point of uselessness, and constantly needs to either be rebooted or have apps manually and forcefully closed to allow any sort of normal use. I am by no means a power user with multiple apps running at any time either; this thing is just dog slow. Save your money for something better.

Really cool phone. It takes really good quality photos. Fingerprint is fast enough. The big issue is the proprietary OS that do not allow you to update to a better/newer version of Android + some custom unnecessary apps that you can not delete. It is better to add a SD card because internal space is not to big, and OS take a big chunk of disk.
reviews.review_header: Great phone if do not want to spend a lot of money (buy a SD card type 10 as well)

reviews.review_text: After two weeks of normal use I can say that I'm positively surprised with this device. It's fast even with the OTA update to Android 7, it looks very well made with its metal body, camera is pretty decent, fingerprint scanner is super fast, battery life is great (over 24hrs). Huawei EMUI5 looks slightly like iOS specially on the rounded icons and stuff which is something I don't like but I don't really care. It's a no brainier for the price and specs- go for it !
reviews.review_header: It's a no brainier for the price - go for it !

reviews.review_text: Amazing phone for the price ($200 at the time on amazon when I bought it). I switched to this as my old phone (LG G4) suffered from the notorious boot loop and this phone performs better than it in almost every way in my opinion despite what I read online. A great new phone to choose if you are looking to get away from the increasing price of the flagship phones.

I can't believe there are no reviews stating this. This phone is very good at doing what it says it will. All specs are on point. THIS PHONE ONLY WORKS ON SELCT NETWORKS IN THE US. The only network in the US (that I've found) that works with this phone is AT&T. So no Verizon, no sprint.
reviews.review_header: Careful If you live in the US!

reviews.review_text: I've had my phone for a month now and so far I love it. As a matter of fact, I bought two more for my girls because the price went way down on Black Friday deals. All three of us have the same phone in different colors. For the price, its exactly what you need in a phone. It has a lot of space, the camera is great and the finger print feature is awesome. The only problem is the ads that always pop up and I can't seem to get rid of them. Disturbing!! Other than that, better than any $1000 dollar phone.
reviews.review_header: Same as any $1000 phone out there

reviews.review_text: Good , inexpensive phone. Very good fingerprint reader. No stuttering to be seen. Good bluetooth and wifi. Calls are clear. Battery life is great. Only downside... emui skin, in my opinion, is too apple like. Put on nova or google now launcher, and shes good to go.

NIce phone, the camera quality is not too bad but not great in low light. Overall the Phone's performance is mid range as you would expect, sometimes its a bit slow but that is under heavy load like going through pictures with a game running. As for playing games, it runs games okay but higher end games above Asphalt 8 you might see slight frame rate dips. Good phone at a great price nonetheless!

Got it today, love it so far. Fast, excellent camera quality and the perfect size for my not very big hands. The gold isn't as bright as I expected but I do like it a lot. Got a cute case to accompany it as well. My cats a hater, ignore her lol💖

I had purchased a 5x for my father. He loves it. So I purchase this one for my mom. It was supposed to be a Christmas present. But I never got it. I'm still giving it 5 Stars because I know it's a good brand. I myself have a mediapad X2. It's been going on over a year now and the battery still runs strong. It lasts me all day. And when I'm bored I can watch at least three movies without the battery dying.
reviews.review_header: I'm still giving it 5 Stars because I know it's a good brand. I myself have a mediapad X2

reviews.review_text: This phone is a good product for the 200$ price-mark. Not the best phone out there, but good for daily use. What I like about this phone: 1. Battery-life is excellent. It easily goes 2 days without recharging. 2. Very good camera. What I don't like: 1. The phone comes with a pre-aattached screen guard. I like the touch of bare glass-screen. It's also more responsive.
reviews.review_header: This phone is a good product for the 200$ price-mark

reviews.review_text: I took a chance that this phone would work with AT&T and so far so great! The finger print reader is fast and seems to be accurate. The phone itself is super fast, with tons of space. It allows you to use 2 different SIM cards at the same time - that is some next level skullduggery and I need to start taking advantage of it. The screen is great, and big, and the Android system is so flexible. Its just great.
reviews.review_header: Great phone AND it works with AT&T no bubbles no troubles

reviews.review_text: Great phone! I was skeptical about getting this phone because my 1st amazon phone was not the best. I previously bought the Blu and it wasnt good for anything but phone calls. This is my 2nd Amazon phone I love it. I take a lot of pictures and videos of my little one so I needed something with lots of storage for that and apps. I highly recomend this one the Huawei Honor ^X Dual Camera!
reviews.review_header: Great phone! I was skeptical about getting this phone ...

reviews.review_text: The camera failed in less than a year. When sent in for it to be fixed, it was immediately sent back saying there was water damage. The water damage "indicator" is right below the audio port so any moisture from hands or pockets caused it to have "water damage" so the warranty was expired. Even though the phone works fine, except the camera, Huawei would not fix the camera, even if I paid, due to the supposed damage. They also would not sell the camera part so that we could fix it. The phone is basically dead due to moist hands. The phone NEVER was immersed or dropped in water. VERY DISAPPOINTED and frustrated with the lack of support and willingness to help us out. The phone should be able to handle moist hands and everyday use. The camera not working seems to be VERY common. Something inside "slips" causing the problem. The only temporary fix is to slap the phone hard. This will work from time to time.
reviews.review_header: Even though the phone works fine, except the camera

reviews.review_text: Pros: Good battery life, easily lasts me all day, even if i have the screen on for heavy use. Sounds great, even if a touch quiet for music. The camera looks good and has great options (ie panorama). Cons: The GPS died within a month, but Amazon did replace it free of charge

Everything is pretty good about this phone. I had the Honor 5X before this one and I can tell you the Wi-fi on my 5X worked better than on this one. The 6X is a little faster off Wi-fi and has some new settings that are pretty useful. Camara looks good for a phone this price. I liked the curved design and feel of this phone. Feels pretty strong made compared to other budget phones that are mainly plastic. I do wish the Wi-fi worked better, but overall it's a pretty slick looking phone.

For the money...this phone is amazing! You won't find anything better for the price point. About a week into this phone and I love it! Baterry life -incredible! Dual rear cameras - focus after the photo is taken....is a really cool feature. Basic andoid platform - very minimal amount of bloatware added in.

You can't really complain about much given the price, but a major feature of this phone is its excellent dual camera which is so glitchy that I actually avoid using it as much as I did when I had an iphone. Overall, the glitchiness is pretty consistent and workable, but the camera app really falls apart quite often.
reviews.review_header: but a major feature of this phone is its excellent dual camera which is so glitchy that I actually ...

reviews.review_text: For the price, this phone is great. However, I haven't noticed much difference from the BLU phones my family has bought. When I power the phone off and back on, all of the apps disappear and you have to put them back where you want them on the screen. It's so much cheaper than most phones in a store though, so I would recommend it over shopping retail. The camera is much better than a BLU phone.

I was tired of junk phones and came across this phone. I don't like how it keeps changing "in" to "if" and "has" to "had". That is a minor annoyance. It holds a charge for 2 days. Calls are clear. I don't like how it says I don't have my data on when I clearly do. So besides those minor issues, I like the phone and the big screen it has. Picture quality is decent as well.

Will hold it's own against most of the more mainstream $600-800.00 competitors. Stylish, fast and easy to use. My only advice is to get a sleeve for it when you purchase the phone so it's not so smooth (which in turn makes it slick and slippery) Other then that a definite winner!!

I just received it and I'm still settling up but i need to be honest the quality of that 12 mpixels camera impressed me. The phone is thin and well finished, the quality of images are awesome, fingerprint is very accurate, battery keep full after few hours, interfaces is simple and very bright, everything works fine and it's fast. Let's see after 6 months.
reviews.review_header: the quality of images are awesome, fingerprint is very accurate

reviews.review_text: I love this phone! the camera quality alone would make me love it..... it works perfectly. I'm not techno minded to give pixel this that or the other details, just suffice to say, everything works perfectly, fits the hand great, it's pretty and perfect.

This is probably the best phone I have ever owned. It is fast and great for all my needs. I love the cameras and it works great for the carrier I use which is T-mobile prepaid. I read all the reviews and decided to take a chance. Love it and the price that I paid was a third of what high end phones go for. Get this phone if you are looking for something good and inexpensive.

Phenomenal battery life, great camera during the day (gets fuzzy at night or in the dark), fast smooth processor, good graphics even with demanding games, nice screen, good brightness. My only gripes were the camera performance in low light (which is to be expected at this price point) and the colors on the IPS display looks a bit washed out compared to regular Amoled displays such as on Samsungs. Great phone overall. Btw I recommend choosing the version with the black front and grey back. It looks much better and premium than the other two. I think the white front version looks sort of cheap but that's just me.

Had this phone for close to a week and am very impressed so far. Performance is awesome, everything works well and photo quality is great, even in low light. For this price point, I can't imagine a better phone, compares with much more expensive models.
reviews.review_header: Performance is awesome, everything works well and photo quality is great

reviews.review_text: Great phone for my budget and I bought it when was $149. I recommend it if you don't want to spend more than $200. Great camera, great look, great watching videos and surfing the web and good sound( calls and music)

Great phone for minimal users, picky people with tear this phone apart, but for basic functionality, you almost cant beat this deal. Pros ** Fingerprint Scanner- Snappy fast high quality. * Camera - Slow to take pictures, and mid level results (that's great for something 250 and under) Decent battery life - I have recently fallen in love and I'm pretty much texting/calling all day. Usually lasts me a solid 12-16 hours. under 10 if calling/app hoarding. EMUI - not as bad as most people are saying. I actually enjoy many of the features they've included (some secret ones). -camera/calculator/flashlight from lock screen amazing. -notification bar swipe up and down with fingerprint scanner. amazing - secret apps (hidden from plain sight. AMAZING - others i forgot. PRETTY COOL IF I REMEMBERED WHAT THEY WERE. Screen- Again I'm a business user. Emails, docs, communication tools, money management apps, and barely any media use. This screen is more than pretty for my work phone. Speed- Just barely snappy enough for my daily needs. Battery management tools. Bang for buck - Nothing like a great bang for a buck. Cons- Not media friendly - Low volume so my on phone meetings are hard to hear in anything other than a quiet room Not game friendly - Don't really care, but different strokes for different blokes. 3gb ram - stops being snappy when 10+ applications are open Not for the flagship user - yeah, if you need the latest and greatest, go spend a grand on a phone. auto lighting isn't very good - i generally keep it low until I'm in a sunny area anyways, but this could matter to some people. no dual band wifi - pretty much my only REAL grip with phone.
