Overall, unless you're dead set on a One plus, this is the best deal for an 835 phone today. I highly recommend it if you want a good looking phone, with good battery life, and great sound.
reviews.review_header: Sleek, solid, beautiful phone at a (finally) good price.

reviews.review_text: It's one of the best phones at it's prices range. Hardware is probably in the premium range but the SW is still in it's infancy and the camera is sub par. Overall, it's great product but not in the league it was first thought to be in. Once u realize it's a mid ranger. It's probably one of the best mid rangers put there
reviews.review_header: It's one of the best phones at it's prices range

reviews.review_text: I bought this phone a month ago and activated it three weeks ago with Sprint. I really wanted to love the phone, but I had issues pretty much from the beginning. I've heard that the camera app has been much improved, but honestly, I found it almost unusable and had to download a third party camera app. Even with that, the picture quality and camera abilities are still disappointing. Within the first week of having the phone, it froze while I was using it for bluetooth music. I wasn't using it for anything else. It was stuck on the screen saver and was unresponsive for about ten minutes. Finally, it came back on and loaded like nothing happened. A week later, the same thing happened in the same situation. Unfortunately, the phone froze (while using it for bluetooth music) while I was on a road trip today and left me totally without directions. This time, it froze for two hours, then died and will not turn back on or hard reset. I contacted Amazon, and they say it's a defective battery and offered a replacement, but I will not take the chance that this happens again. Thankfully, they are allowing me to send the device back for a refund.

Réception parfaite sur l'île de la Réunion. Commandé le 28 décembre et reçu ce jour le 04 Janvier. Tout d'abord le smartphone est hyper beau. Un peu lourd mais rassurant en terme de tenue en mains. Il fait vraiment petit et ceux malgré ses 5,7 pouces. Il est pour cela très bien optimiser. Je n'ai pas encore testé en photos, mais sachez que les mises à jour correctives se font dès l'allumage de l'appareil et se font rapidement surtout. Niveau batterie je vais dire qu'elle est dans la moyenne mais rien d'exceptionnel. La charge je ne l'ai pas encore testé. Bref mes premières impressions sont de bonnes facture, rien à dire et à envier aux autres hauts de gamme qui sont parfois à un prix exorbitant.
reviews.review_header: Réception parfaite sur l'île de la Réunion. Commandé le ...

reviews.review_text: This phone is good. But I recommend saving your money to buy a Sony, or One Plus.. It also doesn't have good battery life.. ***UPDATE*** 4/22/18 So I repurchased this phone after the recent price cut. It is now worth it, considering the price cut. It now runs 8.1 so it seems the battery problems I had before are gone, it easily lasts all day with normal use.

I find this phone an absolute pleasure to live with. It feels like the most premium phone I have ever held, it looks great and most importantly runs stock Android. I have been pleasantly surprised by the camera too. After reading reviews I was a bit wary of the camera but it has achieved some epic shots, in black and white and also the portrait mode. One happy customer, great work Essential team :)
reviews.review_header: Solid phone, a joy to live with!!!!

reviews.review_text: THIS PHONE IS GREAT OVERALL *CALL QUALITY IS PHENOMENAL MY CARRIER IS METRO PCS *THE SPEAKER IS DEFINITELY LOUD ENOUGH TO WATCH YOUTUBE VIDEOS OR MUSIC *SCREEN BRIGHTNESS IS MORE THAN ENOUGH TO BE INDOOR OR OUTDOOR *BATTERY LIFE COULD LAST ME TWO FULL DAYS *THE CAMERA IS FAIRLY OKAY, BUT ESSENTIAL HAVE BEEN RELEASING UPDATES FOR CAMERA APP WHICH IS GOOD..IM CURRENTLY USING GOOGLE CAMERA APP APK *THERES NO GLITCHES OR SLOW DOWN ON THIS PHONE *MOST IMPORTANTLY ESSENTIAL IS KEEP UPDATING THIS PHONE AND THE APPS
reviews.review_header: THIS PHONE IS GREAT OVERALL *CALL QUALITY IS PHENOMENAL MY CARRIER IS METRO ...

reviews.review_text: Just buy it. It's half the price of anything comparable and after a solid 4 months of use I've had no issues. Recommending it to anyone in need of a new phone. Especially on Verizon.

It's early days with my new phone but after only a few days I can definitely say WOW! I absolutely love this phone, it looks great and is super fast And for anyone who's worried about importing to UK, don't be. I ordered the phone on Monday and it arrived Wednesday morning. All taxes and import duties were arranged by Amazon so it really was an excellent and simple service

After over a year away from Android, I am pleasantly surprised with how far this platform has come. Maybe it's the Snapdragon 835 with its 4gb of RAM, but I've never had a better Android experience. Everything is much more fluid than I remember. My first thoughts when I received the phone were about the quality of packaging. Essential did a good job. I was pleased with the presentation mostly for the unique box itself. It has a plastic wrap which was rather difficult to remove without the proper scalpel having only fingernails, but I managed to release the device from its plastic shroud. I found a pull tab on the label, which removing revealed the ingenious drawer-like box in a box form. Compared to your standard rectangular prism, the more square shape is refreshing. You open the box and everything is layed out in front of you. My only complaint as far as what's inside is that there is no USB A to C adapter included. For the price at present, in my opinion this is the best phone for money. With the updates to come both in the form of software and hardware, this phone will only get better. Great phone so far, after 48 hours. I'll try to update this in about a month.
reviews.review_header: First Impressions: Coming Back from an Android Hiatus

reviews.review_text: I love this phone. The feel is great. The weight and material just feel better than any other phone Ive encountered. It's fast and there is a ton of memory. At the price point where they sell it, this is an incredible deal. Plus, the clean operating system, bloatware free, is a massive advantage alone. At first I thought the lack of a headphone jack would bother me, but I adjusted quickly. This device is the best phone I've had by far.

The phone is literally too slick it slid out of my jacket pocket while sitting and cracked the screen (I have no clue as to get it repaired/replaced). My service coverage has significantly dropped since switching to this phone. I keep having issues with apps failing. I also, had a few issues with the phone freezing up all together with difficulty trying to hard reset the phone. I was ecstatic about the promise of this device, but am left disappointed. I have to continue to deal with this phone because, I cannot afford another.

I probably did more research and read and watched more reviews on this product than on any product I have ever purchased. And yet, I really did not know what to expect. This phone has exceeded my expectations in every aspect. It is a beautifully crafted phone, exudes quality, with a perfect size and shape. The software is pure android. No bloat or skins added to slow the phone down over time. The phone is very fast and smooth in daily operation. The speakers, both the earpiece and the bottom speaker are extremely clear. The specs are top notch and more than adequate for the majority of users. I highly recommend this phone. You won't find anything close to this at the new lowered price. I would definitely buy again.
reviews.review_header: Far exceeds any phone in or out of this price range!

reviews.review_text: We've had these phones for two months now and like them a lot. No carrier bloatware, the phones look good, charge quickly and have a great screen. I have seen some criticism that they were not ready for prime time, but by the time we got them, they worked great. Since then there have been several firmware updates both for security and to improve the camera among other things. I have no regrets about getting this phone.

Two days in and i'm very pleased with this phone. Simple and elegant design is so nice. Get a case or skin though because the ceramic back is slippery as heck! This thing will slide of of a flat table, ottoman, bed...etc.
reviews.review_header: Two days in and i'm very pleased with this phone

reviews.review_text: This phone is gorgeous. I've yet to run into any issues. UI is super smooth (on both Nougat and Oreo beta), the screen is absolutely killer. Android Oreo looks fantastic on this display. Camera with all the updates is pretty decent. If you want, go find the GCam ports (Google Pixel camera) on XDA Developers or /r/essential to really boost the quality. It's amazing how well that app does with just software (it uses only a single camera). For $450? It's a complete no-brainer unless you really, really want the best camera on the market. Stick with the big guns if you want that (Pixel 2, iPhone X, etc).
reviews.review_header: Fast, spectacular user interface on Android Oreo.

reviews.review_text: Been using it about a month, having bought it with the 360 camera during Cyber Monday sales. Applied all OTA updates and Store updates (camera, resources etc). Work flawlessly and fast. Battery last through the day. If you have the budget, do go buy premium phones like the Note 8/ iphoneX etc. But at <$500, around the same price range of Huawai/OnePlus, I would suggest getting this Essential phone. Loves the regular updates, which is non-existent with other phones, except for the Pixel... Great bargain!
reviews.review_header: A great bargain given the spec and price

reviews.review_text: The best phone I ever had. I am an Android phone lover and I am lucky to change my phone every year to a new flagship model from a brand. My previous one was the Nokia 8, and previously the Google Pixel. Before I had several models from Sony Xperia Z series. Only the Google Pixel is better in the camera, and the one from Essential is getting better and better. I have installed the Google Camera app and the results are great as well. On the other hand, I have never seen a more beautiful phone, so well made and so great materials. I bought as well the optional 360° camera and the integration is perfect.
reviews.review_header: Best Android phone in the market for the best price

reviews.review_text: Just received the phone today in Taiwan. Love the premium built quality and unique design that actually stands out very much to whomever sees it. I was going to wait for the 2. But my phone just died, so I had to get a phone. But I didn't expect this phone would be this pretty when I unbox it. Snapdragon 835 + 128 GB + best Android phone design at 449 USD is a very good deal...There aren't much to complains for me so far to be honest. Plus I love the stock Android experiences, hated the unnecessary apps that was preloaded in the most other Android phones. And it is just not the real Android experiences to me whenever I used them. I also think Essential phone choose to skip Android 8.0 upgrade is a good thing. Cause Android 8.0 have some issues that probably don't want to have. Look forward to the Essential Phone 2 in the future. Hope you guys will round some things out like waterproof.
reviews.review_header: Best looking Android phone hands down!

reviews.review_text: I've read several critical reviews, but I decided to try. Those who gave 1 or 2 stars to this phone: shame on you! I love this phone. Very good phone for the price. I have only one wish to the Essential company. Guys, we need a good case for the phone.

Great phone, I got it after the price drop in March.Here are my thoughts. PROS: All the camera issues people talked about are resolved from what I can tell due to the app and software update. Also I love the battery life, It gets me a solid 24 hours with regular social media scrolling and trolling, taking pictures and videos through out the day, and even streaming music to my speakers. I am guessing the battery life is so good because there is not any bloatware running programs in the background. The fingerprint and face recognition unlock work great. I love the how the screen extends all the way down and to the edges, and it is not too bulky. CONS The finish is so smooth, you will drop it if you don't put a case on it. There is no shortcut to turn the Location settings on and off. You have to go to the settings menu and scroll to the security and location tabs, open it up, and then turn it on or off. (too much work for me) Or ask the google assistant to do it. You can not change the set of Icons available in the top pull down status bar. Overall I love the phone, I hope that the last two cons I mentioned get addressed in a software update, but I have no regrets over this phone.

This must be my favorite phone yet. I love the stock Android and the great design. It feels heavier than your typical phone of the same size. The best thing about the phone is the screen. After experiencing this phone, It would be hard to go back to a phone with bezels. A lot of people complained about the camera. It is on the slow side, but the picture it takes are great. If you are tired of your typical brand phones (Samsung, Apple, Etc..), try this phone, it definitely feels "fresh".
reviews.review_header: This must be my favorite phone yet

reviews.review_text: The company work very hard to make the phone better. I received many updates and you can also download Oreo beta firmware from their website. (2018/02/26) Everything is good except the camera so far. but that's just because my previous phone was Galasy S8+. Daytime photos are good but night time/low light photos are so-so. However, camera app got much better than stock firmware though.
reviews.review_header: The company work very hard to make the phone better. I received many updates and you can also ...

reviews.review_text: Returned 1st phone as I could not receive incoming calls. Not a problem with this replacement. Battery lasts long as there is no bloatware. A little larger and heavier than a lot of Smartphones but are less costly: less than $500. I get a lot of complements on the appearance (I chose black). Satisfied so far (replaced a Galaxy S4) Will give another review after 90 days if opinion changes. Essential Phone 128 GB Unlocked with Full Display, Dual Camera - Black Moon
reviews.review_header: Does not come with instructions. You need to go online for those.

reviews.review_text: Very well built phone. Phone seemed a bit slow when first used but once I accessed developer options and turned off all animations, phone is incredibly fast. I don't care too much about the quality of pictures and haven't had any issues with the camera. The only thing I dislike about the phone is how unbelievably slippery it is. It slides off of everything and I will be putting a case on it. I have no regrets buying this phone, especially since I picked it up sub $300 on Cyber Monday (didn't want the 360 camera).
reviews.review_header: Very, very good phone so far.

reviews.review_text: I admit the lock button is a bit weird but you get used to it. and it is slippery you need a skin or case. I would love to see a version with a rubber mat finish on it. But outside of that, it's a pixel 2 xl, that is smaller and with an IPS screen. Note: The camera app is bad, But I use Open Cam, and sideload the google camera app for pixel's and that fixes the camera problems.

Its a good phone. Best part, pure android. I bought it in november, and had serious issues with TMobile connection. As such i had to return it. Recently i was checking reddit and it seems, they have found a trick/setting to get around connection issues. If that is the case, I might buy the phone again.
reviews.review_header: Its a good phone. Best part

reviews.review_text: I purchased this phone from Amazon warehouse deals in "Very Good" condition. It seems brand new to me. Just looks like the box was opened. Overall great phone. I switched from an iPhone 6s Plus and I'm loving it. I read and watched reviews on this phone for over a month and I don't see any of the issues that most people were talking about. I feel like the camera takes better pics than my iPhone did. Give it a shot! I love the no bloatware experience.

Switched from my trusty iPhones to this - this phone has been nothing short of awesome for me. No issues or snafus, works perfect and is extremely fast. I'm an average phone user and I regularly get two days on a charge. The screen is beautiful, as well as the rest of the phone.
reviews.review_header: First Android phone - This thing is a beast

reviews.review_text: Impressive phone, build with top hardware (Snapdragon 835, Adreno 540, 4 GB RAM), beautiful screen with 84.9% screen-to-body ratio (highest in the market), large storage space - 128 GB, best design on the flagship phones (titanium frame / ceramic back), the camera is just fine, the improvement with all the software updates is notorious, I really don't know how they can sell this phone for $450. I'm using the official oreo 8.1 beta and now this phone is a beast.

Bought it as a replacement for my second generation Moto X, but it didn't meet my expectations. The display is TFT and it totally sucks compared to AMOLED display of my 4 year old Moto X. Even though it has dual camera, it turned out to be not any better than a single camera my Moto X had. From the good things, I totally liked the build quality, and the full display. I with it was OLED, and the phone had a better camera...
reviews.review_header: I wish it had an OLED display and a better camera.

reviews.review_text: Sold my Galaxy s8 to get this phone and I absolutely LOVE IT! I do not regret the fact that I had a Galaxy and now I have a near stock Android experience. This is pretty much everything I wanted in a phone. Slap a tempered glass on this and a skin or maybe a case that has raised bumpers and voila! Did I mentioned I got this USED? I was missing the usb type C dongle but eh, it's not like I use headphones so it's all right. I use Bluetooth anyways. I made sure to get the Amazon certified product and not some product from another person though you know, that way I can someone to fall back on in case the product is deffective. So far so good, this phone has been performing well and I haven't charged it since yesterday after one full charge. Will give an update on this phone next month !

The phone is amazing and easy to use. Graphics are so crisp and gorgeous and the sound quality out of the phone is even amazing as well. I definitely recommend getting this phone if anyone wants a new phone that is massive in your hands. I upgraded from the Samsung Galaxy S6 and I would never want to go back. The Soft keys on the bottom of the screen is takes some getting used to, but if a new update allowed it to hide when we don't need it and we can swipe up from the bottom of the phone that would be amazingly perfect.

Essential phone turned out to be a great product defying most of the bad reviews. Portrait mode is one of the best things with the camera and this shows the commitment from the team for the updates that improved the camera quality since the launch. Phone is in great proportion and feels like breeze while using it.
reviews.review_header: Essential phone turned out to be a great product defying most of the bad reviews

reviews.review_text: Great phone, no problems at all getting it to work with Verizon network aside from having to turn off "Enhanced 4G LTE Mode" to make calls. Aside from that, Essential Support Staff is very quick to help and their follow-up is excellent. The phone itself is extremely well made, has a nice weight to it and is very durable. It fell off a table and slid along a hardwood floor on it's back and left zero marking on the surface. By far, my favorite part of the phone is the fact that it's Pure Android, meaning there are no excessive bloatware preloaded into the system that cannot be deleted. 100% Recommend purchasing this phone to anyone looking to get a great quality, high functioning, durable phone that does not require a contract
reviews.review_header: Great phone at a great price

reviews.review_text: First day with it and I already love that it has so much storage. Will update later

Awesome phone. Looks great, good build, really fast..what else could you want in a phone? Have yet to try out the camera, but already looks better than my old phone camera. Heard about lagging issues which have not effected me. One big reason is transferring apps from your old phone, so start off fresh. Wish all the best to this company, would highly recommend this phone to anyone.

Honestly this phone has been great. My last two phones were Moto xs unlocked with Pure being most recent and this seems like a continuation of that line or style. High end but not the price tags. Camera has been updated and is not bad at all. I got the most recent Moto x and I tried it out with this one and the two were not at all comparable. If I could give 4.5 I would. Also the 360 camera is a cool feature. Looking firward to what they will be outting out next.
reviews.review_header: Honestly this phone has been great. My last two phones were Moto xs unlocked ...

reviews.review_text: Been using this as my primary phone for about a month now and it's excellent. Camera is great for me.. Not sure why some of the others have issues. Battery is great. I love that it's stock Android. Only ding is a weak external speaker for music (compared to my old Nexus 6P) but it's fine for a speakerphone. I'd highly recommend the Essential PH-1!

Considering the display's size, this phone is a lot smaller than I anticipated. The design and build is excellent, as is the display. Using a SIM from an unlocked phone, I was able to make use of wifi calling and enhanced LTE without needing to call AT&T support. This phone is fast and since I managed to catch it on sale, I consider it an excellent buy.
reviews.review_header: The design and build is excellent, as is the display

reviews.review_text: The essential ph-1 is subtly elegant piece of technology. The android OS works fast and smooth. It fits excellent in the hand and is a perfect replacement to my Nexus 5x. I have switched between multiple different devices this past month to find a permanent replacement under 500 for my previous phone and so far this seems to be it. Im looking forward to essential home device when it is launched.
reviews.review_header: essential ph-1 is subtly elegant piece of technology

reviews.review_text: Great phone with very fast delivery. I am quite satisfied of this great phone. It looks really as flagman as it is. Pure stock android with customization as I want. Hiding navigation bar gives a real 5,7" display, bezelless, fitting perfectly in my hand and pockets. Just the best one.Thank you for the prompt delivery. PS: Week later after using the phone as the principal one, must say it is the winner between S8 galaxy which I left instantly as I had the essential. Quicker then S8, responding immediately, no bugs after all the updates arrived. Battery last day and half after a hard usage of calls, browsing, emails etc. No unusable application installed. By now the phone didn`t let me down as I work with, no freezing, the screen is just amazing.
reviews.review_header: Great phone with very fast delivery

reviews.review_text: Phone freezes and has bugs. Build and feel of the phone are superb. PD plug requires you to invest in the replacement of all your QC aftermarket chargers...
I really enjoy this phone. Top notch performance at a great price. And I really appreciate the basic Android system, just like I did with my old Nexus 6.
reviews.review_header: Top notch at a great price!

reviews.review_text: Coming from a year-old Nexus 6P, Essential Phone has been a solid upgrade. Solid build quality, smooth software and a unique looks are my favorite things about the phone. In terms of the camera, the stock application has gotten better since I received it ~1month ago. Compared to regular photos taken with auto settings in low light, I found the Nexus 6P to be better. However, using a port of the Gcam on the Essential captures indistinguishable results compared to the 6P. I was on the fence for some time, especially considering that reside in Scandinavia, but I have no regrets for buying this phone. PS: If you are sensitive to fingerprints, you are probably better off with another color.
I absolutely love this phone! I love the edge to edge display, and the ceramic back. I highly recommend the Essential Phone. It's now my favorite phone!

With the Oreo 8.1 release and bug fixes (scrolling lag). It feels that the phone finally got everything right. Beautiful beautiful design. Sturdy body. 128GB memory, Great fast stock android. stable and capable camera features, fast charging. Above all, the phone has its heart at the right place. Cannot wait to see the upcoming features and add-on for this phone. At this price, this is definitely a steal.
reviews.review_header: It has finally got it right.

reviews.review_text: This phone is incredible. Looks and feels like a luxury device. The price makes this phone worth it. Camera is eh better outside than inside. I've always had Apple and this stock Android feels just as fast as the new iPhones. I don't have a case and dropped it out my SUV onto jagad concrete. Titanium and ceramic held up just fine. I got the white because the black on shows fingerprints way too much. The charger symbol when off is a coffee cup filling up.

I've been looking to upgrade from an iPhone 6s. At this price, it made my decision easy. If you research the phone you'll see all the issues it had at launch. Essential has pushed several updates and from the short period of time I've used the phone, I'm extremely happy with it.
reviews.review_header: Best phone at this price point by far!

reviews.review_text: I've had this phone for about 3 weeks and so far so good. No bloatware, stock Android, at $450, it is a bargain. Battery life is probably 3 times better than my Nexus 5x. Loving the USB-C. The touch response can get a little glitchy when used outside during winter but that's probably because of my frozen fingers. Dropped it once on it's side from about 2 feet on a hard surface, still looks new. Shipping from Amazon US to Canada was super quick, 3 working days I believe.
reviews.review_header: Stock Android - Solid Hardware - Fast shipping to Canada

reviews.review_text: I purchased this phone on Cyber Monday and I'm so happy that I did! I love this phone! The phone is beautifully crafted, it feels amazing in the hand! The operation of this phone is very smooth and fast, they are updating constantly and the camera is great! Not a single issue so far. I'm hooked Essential.
It's good once you look past the negatives review from others website and YouTube.This a great phone I no complaint. It's looks good and feel nice on the hand
reviews.review_header: It's good once you look past the negatives review from others ...

reviews.review_text: I like this phone a lot. The form is interesting. Though it has a bit more heft than other phones, the sturdy materials make it worthwhile. The characteristic of having a lot of radio bands for network compatibility makes it a great phone for any country especially when travelling. The purchase is a good buy for anyone who likes a good and unique phone.

Previously a Pixel XL user; I find the build quality, fit and finish, to be superior in all respects. (The manufacturing tolerances must be measured in the .001 range.) It is impressive under magnification. True, the Camera and its supporting software is only average when compared to any other stock Android experience, but Essential has proven their commitment by promptly updating the device firmware to resolve initial release issues. Just using the Pixel Camera App improved picture quality substantially. Think of the Essential PH-1 as the new Sony PlayStation 5, rushed to the public with only 1 or two game titles, Pong being one of them; yes, it would disappointment, but given time to refine and update the release of new software and it will blow everything out of the water because the Hardware is "there"... There is no other device in the market that matches the choice of materials, build quality or design aesthetic. The software experience will improve regularly, and with Essential supporting the ROM community by releasing their Kernel Source, you can bet the sky will be the limit... so ignore the Camera, ignore the lean, lackluster software, ignore the yet to be experienced "lag" or "lock-ups". As it stands in its [Beta] form, it performs better than my Pixel, the S8+ and on par with the OnePlus 5 . -and in a few weeks, it should exceed any current device in terms of performance, as it already does in the context of hardware.
reviews.review_header: We're reviewing it all wrong... Its just the beginning.

reviews.review_text: Arrived today was sooo excited but am returning it, small chips out of white frame around screen and gap between frame and screen at top left of phone, not impressed!

One of the best ennovations this year coming from a fairy new company Essential PH 1. premium craftsmanship and excellent software only downside is the cameras need more improvements! Now Hat he price has dropped significantly it’s an awesome purchase.
reviews.review_header: One of the best ennovations this year coming from a fairy new company ...

reviews.review_text: Overall look and feel of the phone is great. There are times when phone does not respond to touch. Turn off and on screen (NOT reboot) to fix. Hopefully software fix and Oreo coming soon.

So, the Essential PH-1 has a few things going for it. The first and best is that it is pure stock Android with no bloat. It is unlocked to work on all four of the major carriers. The build and design are both beautiful and durable. The battery life is outstanding. It is equipped with 128GB of memory, which is more than adequate in most situations. Now, what is missing: The camera is among the worst I've ever seen on a phone. It is lacking badly on many fronts. The screen is definitely not the brightest, sharpest, or clearest. The phone, though beautiful, is notably heavier than others.

This phone is not an iPhone. It is not a Samsung Galaxy S8. It's not a Pixel. If you're considering any of those phones, this is not the phone for you. This is raw Android, in a quality-engineered titanium and ceramic hardware. This device is heavy, and it feels great. The back can be slick, but it's beautiful. Any reviews you've heard about this device missing the mark are from people that want to spend $1000 on a device because they think it's about status. But this phone is about getting the best, about having a pure Android device backed by a company that's constantly pushing updates and giving their customers the freedom to customize their phone and make it their own. This phone is for people that want a company that will support their device and their customers, and not lock it down. This is the first generation Essential PH-1, and there have been weird quirks and bugs, and that's to be expected, but Essential has done what no other modern device manufacturer does: updates and customer service. That in itself is work the price that's half of what you'd pay for another "flagship" device.

Incredible beautiful The bezel-less design looks gorgeous System running smoothly Under $500, 6 OTAs, 6 Play Store updates of the camera app in 4 months, since the launch of Essential Phone. Good job Essential Phone.
reviews.review_header: Incredible beautiful The bezel-less design looks gorgeous System running smoothly Under ...

reviews.review_text: A good phone that missed being great. There are some issues but no show stoppers. It is fast, beautiful, solid build, good display, latest OS, regular updates, pure Android (no bloatware), good storage (128GB) and a relatively good value for a flagship class phone.
reviews.review_header: A good phone that missed being great

reviews.review_text: Amazing build qaulity, and screen just as I wanted. Lackluster camera but I'm not a a frequent picture taker, so no big deal to me.

For the new reduced price, this phone cannot be beat. It is a solid nice looking phone, with a great design. The camera is pretty good, I have taken pictures and had them printed at the store without editing and they turned out very good. The monochrome camera takes excellent photos! The stock Android is also very responsive. Essential is actively updating it, just received the October security update. So hopefully they continue that support. The screen looks nice as well. Other thoughts, it's a slippery phone, so you will want a case and screen protector. It does collect finger prints as well, but you are holding the thing so get over it. I also tried the 360 degree camera, it is pretty cool, and easy to use. I wouldn't pay full asking price for it though. Amazon had the phone and 360 degree camera bundled for very cheap.
reviews.review_header: A awesome phone and at new lowered price

reviews.review_text: I did not get to use this product as it was not compatible with my carrier. I feel like this is a good product and it has a great future in the market place. Amazon was great in assisting me with the return and I ordered another product from Amazon in it's place.
reviews.review_header: Essential And Amazon - A great team partner

reviews.review_text: I haven’t been in love with a phone since Apple and I broke up. I’m happy to announce I’ve moved on and found love again. Thank you, Essential.
reviews.review_header: I haven’t been in love with a phone since Apple and I broke up

reviews.review_text: This phone is great...works well on Verizon, the battery life is great(easily getting two days)...with all the updates that essential is putting out this is the best phone for the $$. No crap ware put the aps that you want on there. The camera is fine and constantly being updated. The screen is super sharp and unique.
Great, but not perfect (as any other phone). I'm facing some software problems (not a big problem). I hope it will be fixed in future updates
reviews.review_header: Great, but not perfect (as any other phone)

reviews.review_text: It's a great phone for the new price tag. It has all the flagship phone hardware, like the Qualcomm Snapdragon 835 SoC, Great LCD Display, The Best Body to Screen ratio. Even the software is not perfect at this moment, but essential keep update the software and keep listening to the client and improve the user experience. You cannot expect it like other well-developed brand but I think it will be a killer smartphone brand if you give it an opportunity.

I've purchased the PH-1 a few day's ago. Shipment to Austria was without any issue. Thanks for that! Unfortunately since 2 day's the charger doesn't work anymore. Crosschecked the USB-C to UCB-C cable and (AUT) power adapter, all working fine. The charger itself is dead. It's quite sad, because it's new and the original rapid charge functionality with it's charger, is gone. Now I'm forced to purchase in addition a third party charger. Regards the phone itself, no complaints at all. Working without any flaws. More than satisfying! Can't complain about the camera quality. Can't agree on the bad reviews which can be found in different kind of posts, forums, ...
reviews.review_header: Phone - GREAT! Charger NOT WORKING ANYMORE!

reviews.review_text: Great Phone, coming from an iPhone 6S. Lots of storage space. Updates keep making the phone better. I've had no issues with signal strength in my area, actually it has better signal strength than my iPhone 6s. No issues using AT&T sim card from iPhone 6S. Also, had wifi calling enabled by default. Phone has a good heft to it, not too heavy but feels very solid.

Phone itself it's okay this phone crashed on me almost everyday now I believe this is due to the memory issue camera works okay a little bit too slow but functional image is not bad I don't want to give a very bad review because phone is actually okay to work with it just crashed on me more and more I only purchased this phone since December of 2017 I used it day for the last 2 months
the phone is so small for a 5.7 inch screen love it .was using a oneplus 5 but love the location of the fingerprint sensor.i ll do a better reveiw as time goes on but i love it so far.
reviews.review_header: 7 inch screen love it. was using a oneplus 5 but love ...

reviews.review_text: Aa a pure android person, starting with a Nexus 4, then a Nexus 5 and now having to replace my dead Nexus 5X; I wanted a "Pure Android" phone the Essential phone is great so far. I also wanted a phone that was new and receiving current updates, out of the box it quickly updated to Oreo (8.1.0). It is clean, fast and with only 3 days of use I am pleased with the purchase. As a t-mobile user, I was concerned about comments from other reviewers on connectivity issues, so far it looks like no difference in connectivity from my Nexus 5x.

At first,very well to use,smooth,and I like the design,it's cool,I gave charge once a day,the battery is enough...After almost 3month, when it shows battery is full,a night past,it could drop to only 50%,well,I don't know why...

Coming from a Galaxy s6 I thought this phone would not meet my expectations but I have not been dissapointed yet. I live how clean the system is. The camera app is not as polished as the Galaxy s6 was but I'm not a photo or selfy addict. It'll will get better with updates. So far after a few weeks I like the phone. One thing I was surprised by was that its able to screen mirror to my Samsung smart tv. Probably not a giant surprise but I am very glad. Great phone good job Essential!!!
reviews.review_header: It'll will get better with updates

reviews.review_text: Top quality phone! Classy finish, works seamlessly. Entirely happy with the Camera. I've not made a direct comparison to the latest competitor such as the Google Pixel 2, but the camera is still better than any of my previous phones which have included HTM One m7, (Samsung Galaxy previous gen.). Especially like that it has no bloatware and plenty of storage.
Update to the 8.1 beta and this phone rocks. Also download the Google camera. $319 got it for. Not a better phone for the price. Came from s8, also a great phone.
reviews.review_header: Not a better phone for the price

reviews.review_text: Beautiful phone with a very nice screen to go along with the edge to edge design. Top notch hardware specs and unmatched software support along with an active community of enthusiasts. The essential may not be for everyone, but it definitely does not disappoint. There are very few phones of this quality running up to date stock Android that aren't a Pixel. Battery life is off the charts and will last some users two days.

This is my initial review, but so far, bravo essential. Bravo. To start, the packaging, the accessories, all extremely high quality. The phone, it looks like a Cadillac, and runs like a Ferrari. Everything just seems so smooth. Even as I type this I'm impressed with the seamless operation. I don't know where all the negative all the negative posts are coming from. Maybe trolls from the flagships? The camera, the dreaded camera actually functions well. I played with it for like an hour straight before I got it to crash. The short, don't believe the negative hype. Get one, try it for yourself!

I've been using the phone for over 4 months at the time of this review. Love the processor, storage, and great screen for the sale price I paid for it. I hate that the phone slides off of anything and everything. Very annoying. Andy Rubin marketed this phone as not requiring a case. I purchased the phone on that premise. I didn't use cases with my prior phones and did not have issues. However, I couldn't get away without using a case and screen protector with this phone. Very happy with my phone.
reviews.review_header: Purchase a case and screen protector. Don't wait.

reviews.review_text: After much research, I brought a samsung s8, which after a month or so realised its not for me. Looked at many phones, and choose the Essential phone. Looked for a while for uk seller, but they wanted to much money, so checked Amazon U S A and took a gamble. Some how you think an american phone might be different to uk. After two weeks or so it turned up on the day I sold the s8. It arrived about a week early. It is a quality item, build is super solid , the soft wear experience is smooth with no clutter. I am so pleased I did this through Amazon. Many thanks
No bloat ware and a power packed phone, this is the best phone I've ever had and used. I am super picking and have high expectations of phones and this nails it!
reviews.review_header: Best phone I've ever had and used

reviews.review_text: Awesome design (better than any current cel phone) with it's titanium and ceramic materials and nearly full edge-to-edge display. It just needs wireless charging and OLED display. Then it'd be perfect.

I love this phone. After years of using iPhones, I decided to try out android and I must say that I love the stock Android experience. I got the phone 1st week of December and after experiencing the freezing issue for the first few days, the phone has been very stable and performance has been good for the apps that I use. The videos and pictures from the 360 camera are also very good.

Purchased bundle w/ 4k camera on cyber Monday. It's a great deal so far. I was targeting something in the 200-300$ range which more than likely would have suited my needs. As for the phone itself it's nice to see a home screen uncluttered. Phone looks good and the screen looks very nice. Runs smoothly. Works with total wireless

This was a gift and has been very good thus far. The camera keeps improving and Essential is quick to provide updates. I expect the Oreo update very soon. The material and contruction have also been better than expected.
reviews.review_header: This was a gift and has been very good thus far

reviews.review_text: Solid smart phone. Lost my S7 and replaced with Essential. My son offered to trade me his S7 and I thanked him and declined! So nice not to have all the vender and SP apps. Loaded my Google and outlook, never going back.
reviews.review_header: Solid smart phone. Lost my S7 and replaced with Essential

reviews.review_text: Excellent build quality. Just a great android phone and a solid alternative to Pixel 2 or Nexus 6p

Been using this phone without a case for almost 3 months now. Zero issues with dings and scratches even with a few tumbles here and there. Very durable front glass and ceramic back. Highly recommend this phone, especially for the price.
reviews.review_header: Pros: Durable, beautiful design, quick screen. Cons: Slippery, camera app improving but not as good as Pixel2 / iPhone X

reviews.review_text: Love this phone! Was very afraid after reading all the negative reviews, but none of the issues seem to have affected me. I only have had the phone for a couple of days, here are my initial observations: 1) The build quality is great and looks amazing. If I have to nitpick, the buttons could be made even better, looks cheap compared to everything else 2) The phone is so sleek, it pains me to say that it needs a phone case as it is a little slippery, unfortunately 3) Some have cell reception issues, but I am on T-mobile in NYC metro area and it seems similar to what I had before 4) Camera seems to be good, maybe not as good as pixel or iphone, but good enough for me. They even had a camera update enabling portrait mode 5) Touch sensitivity could be better, especially around edges, but doesn't seem to be a major issue. There is some jankiness, but the phone is so good to look at, you don't really notice it I bought it at $399 on Cyber Monday, so it was a steal. I really think if they had come out now rather than in August, they would have had much better reviews!

Contrary to a lot of bad press this phone has received in the early days, I've had it for just about a month now and it's been the best phone I've ever used. Reliable, good battery, not a single issue with any software or hardware, looks and feels amazing. Running Oreo beta the scrolling jitters are there but barely noticeable to me. You can't go with wrong with this thing!

Great product. Best smartphone design ever! Super snappy. Amazing battery life. I have been using this phone for the past 3 days and love it. I have ordered a Pixel 2 Xl which I am going to cancel. Only thing that can be improved is the camera which does not have optical image stabilization. It does have electronic image stabilization but does not work as good as OIS...it does not even compare to S7 edge which is over 2 years old product. For the price and overall design five star hands down.
reviews.review_header: Great product. Best smartphone design ever

reviews.review_text: incredibly classy looking phone and feels so good in the hand you'd think it's worth double its price. fast performance and the screen is amazing. everyone who saw it were amazed. it's a real eye catcher. the camera is a bit of a hit and miss and the app can be laggy sometimes but it'll get the job done for most people. ceramic back is premium and scratch resistant so you won't need a case or a skin to protect it. Believe me you don't want to hide it's design behind an ugly case.
reviews.review_header: incredibly classy looking phone and feels so good in the hand you'd think it's worth double its ...

reviews.review_text: This is one of the best phone I've used in years. While it has some quirks as expected with any new platform, it is refreshing to know that you own the phone that you bought unlike most of phones from big names that are either bloated with their app's that you have no control on or the platform itself that will not let you have control your phone itself. I hope this becomes the norm in the industry and breaks the status quo where consumers are taken for granted.
Love the phone itself! Hate the camera, the sotware experience is superb.
AMAZING PHONE FOR A CHEAP PRICE! Was going to get the Pixel 2 XL, but WHY????? This phone is the same specs and 1/2 the price.. 1000000% recommend this purchase to anyone.
reviews.review_header: AMAZING PHONE FOR A CHEAP PRICE

reviews.review_text: This phone is amazing. It works perfect and it's unlocked. It won't even get scratched. Super impressed on how good this phone is, being the price is so low. This phone is better than any iPhone or samsung hands down. Love the little camera you can add to it too for 360 pictures and 360 video and in 4k. You have nothing to loose here.
This phone is amazing. I came from the Huawei mate 9 and this is the same size screen, minus the bezel and size. Pure android is sleek and I am waiting to upgrade to oreo 8.1 beta
The phone is really well built and had a good weight to it. It feels really high end. Love the pure Android experience. Having the edge to edge screen gives the immersive experience.
reviews.review_header: Great phone at a great price

reviews.review_text: I had a Nexus 5, a myth. I think Essential is the modern heir of it, much better than Pixel 2 XL etc. etc... And if you want to shoot better photos, buy an Hasselblad camera. reviews.review_text: Upgrading from a g5, I absolutely love the phone. I've been using it daily for about a month now and it is so far one of my favorite phones I've ever owned. The camera app has been my only complaint, but it is getting upgraded with nearly every new software update (every couple of weeks or so) and has already seen several major improvements. However, going from a phone that had a wide viewing camera too (this one doesn't, it has a native black and white second camera that I rarely use), it has been quite an adjustment. My LG also had a double tap option to turn on the screen and a "flip the phone over" option to turn off the alarm, which I greatly miss, but I recognize those are only things I will find on LG anyways (which isn't worth it with the price). The battery life is phenomenal. Using it with 4G through the majority of my day I still typically have a good charge left when I go to sleep at night (after a 17 hour day that often starts with an hour of video watching). The signal is actually much better than expected (at least in Verizon) and areas where I experienced lost calls or bad signal now have no issues. The build quality is pretty great, although I still recommend a case. The phone is very quick and I love the option to use the cloud for my photos so that they don't take up any space on my phone. If you are an audiophile, the single bottom speaker may annoy you. It does get loud but doesn't carry very powerful sound if you're often using it as the only thing to listen to music. The screen is nice and bright, although I did receive a version that seemed too dark at first even on its brightest setting (Essential was happy to replace it with no extra cost). I appreciate the lack of bloatware and the quick software updates that are often either on par with or faster than the "name brands". The fingerprint reader is placed perfectly and incredibly snappy. The customization options are fabulous. Although there have been some issues with people receiving defective phones, Essential seems happy to stand behind their product and offer a replacement. I ordered mine on Amazon to ensure I also had Amazon backing and free returns should anything happen. So far, what I ordered as an "experiment" phone has proved itself as a very, very good (although not perfect) daily driver. Especially for the price. Overall the MAIN things that stood out are as follows. Pros: - wonderful battery life - very fast - quick software updates - Amazon/essential stand behind the product - great service (at least with Verizon) - nice build quality - good camera Cons - camera software - lack of wide-screen angle camera - occasionally defective products
reviews.review_header: Perfect Phone for the Price, A Challenge to the Name Brands

reviews.review_text: My first impression of this phone was great. It was beautiful. I loved the size, the screen, and the performance.... Very soon after receiving it, however, I noticed that when answering incoming call, (I was using it on Verizon Wireless), 90% of the time, I could not hear the caller, and the caller could not hear me. After 10-12 seconds, there was a slight but audible 'pop' from the phone, and then both sides could hear the call fine. The problem is, most of the time the person calling would have already hung up the phone after this long of a delay. I thought this problem might be related to my Martian mvoice watch, so I completely disabled it, but the problem persisted. Also, I have never experienced this problem when the Martian watch was used with a different phone... Finally, I returned the phone and ordered a replacement. The replacement arrived on a Friday and worked properly for the entire weekend, making me think that my first phone had just been defective. Monday morning, the exact same issue started happening again with the replacement phone. I reached out to Essential and received absolutely no help. No amount of factory resetting or installing all available updates would get the phone to work properly. I finally had to return the second phone to Amazon as well, and even though this phone COULD have been really nice, I would not recommend it....
reviews.review_header: I really WANTED to like this phone....

The biggest disappointment on this phone is the camera. Even after I did the update I felt it was still below average. I did install the Google camera app and the picture quality at least came out acceptable. I ended up returning mine as I didn't like the camera quality and the smaller form factor. Oh, and yes it's a 5.7 inch display but since it's 18:9 screen when watching videos it would shrink to 16:9 so you end up with black bars on the sides so the display looked more like 5 inches.

reviews.review_text: In an era of "Break the Bank or Hate Your Phone", the Essential Phone arrives at a perfect time. I was excited to see this phone arrive because I am one always looking out of the "norm" of what others do. This phone allows every carrier and is so easy to setup, pop in the SIM card and go. It feels so sturdy in your hand; although it may feel like it will slip a lot due to the all aluminum body and gorilla glass. But what I love about it, is not one scratch has occurred anywhere on the device; even dropping it a few times and removing the fingerprints on the back. There is no bloatware as others have mentioned, and that's wonderful. To have a beautiful phone and not need to buy a bulky case for it was such a dealbreaker. The only problem I have had with it is random Wifi connectivity drops, but a quick reboot and it's back to normal. I hope this is just software related, as it's running android 7.1.1.
reviews.review_header: In an era of "Break the Bank or Hate Your Phone"

reviews.review_text: Bought this phone with very high hopes, as a replacement for my Nexus 6P. From the very beginning, it was obvious that the signal reception was sub par, even compared to the over 2 year older Nexus 6P (I am on TMobile, and in an area where the Nexus works perfectly, always). However, I did not bother since both data and voice was fairly usable and with the 'hope' that future updates will fix the reception issues. Post several updates, and especially after the Android 8.1 upgrade, the signal reception has become even worse - same spots, unusable now. Restarts, resets and waste of several valuable hours troubleshooting did not help. I am back to my Nexus 6P for regular use and its as reliable as ever!! It's a shame on Essential that they failed so spectacularly; compare that to some other start ups that has done fairly well even with limited resources! Example: I handed over my 4 year old OnePlus One to a relative on the other side of the globe, and it still works. So, just stay away from Essential, at least folks who intend to continue with TMobile as your network.

As a tech enthusiast, and someone who is very much invested in the Google/Android ecosystem, when I first came across info regarding the Essential Ph-1, I was immediately interested. As hardware and design goes, the device is an love letter to the industry that Andy Rubin and his peers ( obviously the late Steve Jobs is another crucial figure ) founded. This smartphone screams premium to all human senses. It looks amazing, it feels amazing, I love the weight, the ergonomics. And for sure the LCD packeged with the phone comes as close to Amoled as an LCD can, so no complaints there. For a brand new company's first product of the caliber, it ticks all the right marks, as hardware and design goes. But for a smartphone that was sold at a premium when it first launched, the software was underbaked, making for an less than desirable day to day use, as per highly acclaimed tech reviewers on YouTube, and rightly so. Fast forward to January 2018, and several discounts, quality of life software updates, and continued support from the Essential team, have made this phone a steal for around $400 on Amazon. The software, a vanilla version of Android ( my go to version always ) fells well optimized now for the latest Qualcomm SoC. I don't care much for cameras on smartphones, as long as it's a decent shot. My issue was connectivity when I first turned on the phone. Living in NYC one expects good service most anywhere. But on T-Mobile it wasn't the case, at first. Yet after a quick Google/ YouTube search, I found the code needed to make the device stick with an always LTE connection. And as such, with LTE+ available for me, my speed tests range from 30 to 50mb download and upload, even with half the service bar available once in a while. So yeah, all in all, for some $400-500 (depending on the retailer), I feel this was an amazing purchase, and I certainly hope Essential as a company last long enough to prove they can be the next Samsung or Apple, or even surpass these two dinosaurs. Talent is for sure at the core of Essential. The smartphone gets 5* from me, in its current state, but mostly because I appreciate the attention to detail in the hardware design. As a whole, I'd normally give a 4* do to slight hickups here and there, software wise. As is, it's a very good daily driver for me so far. And with further optimization one a stable version of Android 8.1 rolls out, I'm confident many of the small issues still present will be ironed out. My advice is, once you decide to purchase this phone, and insert the SIM card of your carrier of choice, do a quick search on how to further optimize the phone on your on. Definitely let it do it's 4 updates, as of now. They improve quite a lot. And in the end you'll be holding what the Essential PH-1 was always meant to be. A love letter to the industry, now at half the price. Hope this helps! Take care!
reviews.review_header: A step in the right direction

Long-time nerd, love this device. Waited for months for the matte Gray color, finally gave up waiting when Amazon dropped to 450 for it in black. Nearly identical dimensions to my old HTC OneM9, notably heavier and significantly more screen real estate. So far I have zero complaints about performance, battery life very acceptable (18-28hrs with my typical use, charges in <2), GPS even faster ttff than OneM8. Minimal preinstalls beyond bare minimum for Android itself and device-specific support. (e.g. Camera) And every preinstall can be uninstalled. My only wish would be for official support of Root. (iptables firewall, adblock, Ti backup) Three OS updates out-of-box, multiple Essential-specific updates through Play (camera app mostly) and everything so far (2 weeks in) stable and consistently responsive. This is what Android should be - oustanding hardware, minimal cruft, smooth experience.
Got the Black Friday deal so worth a try - great hardware design, needs work on the software.

Nice phone, with some issues. I love the screen but the camera can't competit with s8 or iPhone 7/8. I also have some issues when I try plugging my headphone jack in the dongle. The phone doesn't always recognize my plugged in headphones. Dont know if it is a problem with the phone, my dongle of somesoftware issues.

This phone is gorgeous, unfortunately, it's also really flaky. Touch is not always responsive when nearing the edge of the screen. Sometimes it takes 2, or 3 "hits", before the touch registers. I've had it for like a week or 2 now, and it's already fully locked up 3 times. The WiFi to LTE hand-off is ... inconsistent.. Generally if i want it to work when i come off WiFi, or get onto WiFi, i need to reboot for it actually work. If i turn on my HotSpot, the WiFi doesn't automatically turn off... which means the hotspot doesnt work. So to enable the HotSpot i need to turn that on, and WiFi off each time. When WiFi is on, it shows 0 bars for phone service, yet calls still can go in and out. Signal strength is about half as good as previous phones (half as many bars on wifi and lte, in the same spot where other phones get full) Roughly half the time, at least half the time i bother to check, it says "Charging slowly" when plugged into the provided fast charger ( with included cord). Don't know why it says that.... Sometimes when i attempt to make a call, it will just sit there, not actually dial out. I will hit hang up, and it will automatically open up again, this time actually dialing out. The 360 phone is a fun novelty.. not something i would ever buy, but it came with the phone... it's pretty slow, and snapping it on to the phone was the cause of one of my complete lockups i mentioned before. The battery life is really good.. The camera is acceptable. Haven't dropped it yet, so can't speak to durability. Over all... if they can work out all the bugs, i'd be totally in love with this phone. Hardware wise, it's awesome. But now, i feel quite a bit of regret buying it.
reviews.review_header: Beauty sometimes is only skin deep

Contacted support and they had me give them a laundry list of things. They I was told the issue was because of the Oreo update for Droid and it should be fixed once it updated. That did fix anything. Then on April 5th April 6th oero had another update. Now my phone dismounts my sim card and my carrier is not listed. Contacted support and they tell me and send me the APN settings for my carrier. But it was the same things that is stored in the phone already. Then I was told that my imei number wasn't registered with the carrier. So I contact my carrier and guess what my imei is just fine. So I bought a new SIM to see if that worked...yeah no luck there. So most of the time this phone doesn't keep my carrier activitied. As a whole I'm very disappointed with the customer support. So if you are looking for a phone....I would not look at this one.

One month in and I must say that this phones lives up to all the expectations I had for it. Let's break it down: Pros: - Flagship build quality. - Mid-range price. - Feels solid, has a slight heft to it. - Size is right, fits the hand a lot better than the Nexus 6. - Stock (or close enough) Android. - Camera picture quality is good (caveat in the cons). - 128 GB of space. - Battery life. Easily getting at least 20 hours of regular use from it (streaming music on the daily commute, reading a little, playing a couple games, checking news and email, etc.) Cons: - Camera picture quality in low-light (likely fixable through software but not holding out for it). - Ceramic back and titanium bevels scratch easily. Nothing major but cosmeticly annoying. Screen is good. - Screen could use a little more "umph". Brightness is not quite up to expectations in sunlight. - Camera app is very... untefined. Not "essential," just doesn't feel like it was finished. Overall, I would (and have) recommended this phone to a lot of people. My wife likes it even though she is an Apple user, says it's a lot like her iPhone 6S. There is still a lot of detail work that needs to be done, especially with the camera app, but Essential has shown themselves more than willing and now it's just a waiting game. Looking forward to see what Essential does next. I would really love to see a tablet from them.

reviews.review_text: This is probably the best manufactured phone that I have ever owned, and I have used several iPhone models (including the new X) and multiple Android phones from Samsung and LG. The ceramic back is so durable, yet classic in appearance. The screen is great (I would love to see an OLED on the next model, but this one is plenty clear and bright). The single firing speaker is very loud and fairly clear without crackles. I have experienced only one or two app hang-ups my week with the phone, otherwise it performs quite smoothly. Charging the phone with the USB-C charger is very fast, and the battery life easily lasts me throughout a day of moderate use. The camera could use some improvements, and I wish that the company would make an official stance on hardware support down the road (currently they will not say how much a battery replacement will cost, or even if it will be offered), but at this price ($450 as of this post) I really have no regrets about my purchase.

Nice build quality, solid - but... I planned on using it as my daily phone in exchange for the iPhone 7, but it just has a way too poor camera. Decent quality in good light conditions, but extremely bad in darker surroundings. Even when it is sunny, the colors are a little dull. When it is just a little darker you have to cope with noise and washed out edges. Dynamic range is bad. All this in comparison to an more than one year old iPhone 7. It is slippery as hell. I recommend a skin for the back. Display size is great, i really love the form factor. The iPhone ore Samsung Galaxy are too narrow. Screen is bright enough and Android works good - no issues for me. But without a decent camera it just isn't going to be my daily phone. The fingerprint sensor is also not as good. I've dry fingertips and it is not a problem for the iPhone, but with the PH-1 I sometimes need 4 attempts to unlock the phone. I uploaded a pic as comparison. Left iPhone 7 right Ph-1 - bad light, just my desk. I have the latest updates installed (camera and phone) and I try'd the google camera (still not good enough). That review is in no means a vote for the iPhone, I really wanted it to be my new phone, but...

[Update] literally, right after I wrote this Essential updated the camera up. I haven't time to play with it a lot, but so far it's seems significantly better! So, for now, ignore the Camera comments below. This phone keeps getting better. If you're looking for a high end phone, but don't have the budget for similarly equipped phone. This is the phone you want. I've had the phone for a couple of months now. The good: Performance: it's fast for everything I do. Look/feel: it looks good and feels sturdy. It's actually heavier than a lot of phones out there. That's comforting Vanilla Android: No bloatware, fast updates Responsive support: I've had a couple of questions, they were answered within 24 hours. Battery life: I charge overnight, use the heck out of the phone all day with everything turned on (WiFi, Bluetooth, GPS, decent screen brightness) at the end of my day (midnight) I still have somewhere around 40% battery life left. I'm pretty sure if I were more aggressive about power management I could go 2 days on a charge. The not so good: It's a 1st generation phone, with first generation issues. (eg: Bluetooth turns off with no warning periodically) Mitigating that is that fast updates. The camera: There's no excuse for this camera really. It's slow, and the quality is poor. I've seen rumors that there's an upcoming software update that will make it better. But that hasn't made it yet. The 360 camera is fun to play with, but for me: no practical use. I keep reading about touch/scroll lag issues. But honestly: I haven't noticed that. If you're wanting a daily driver and can live with the camera being less than premium until they fix it, this is definitely the phone for you.

I've been using the PH-1 as my main phone for several months. Pros: * Minimal design * Good performance * Reasonable battery life * Very large storage capacity So-Sos: * Notch is sometimes intrusive, but Android seems to have plans to support it better. Cons: * Epic bad camera. Even after the updates, it is typically slow to focus, with tragically bad color rendering, and poor low light performance. I did not notice any benefits to the dual sensor design. It is definitely a price/performance contender based on the discounted price. It is NOT a flagship killer, though it is so close -- just fix the camera. Hopefully the next generation from Essential will bring the camera system up to or beyond the Galaxy/Pixel/iPhone level.

I've used this for about 24 hours now and want to get a review up quickly prior to the release date for those who are considering this. Here are the highlights. For reference, my current phone is a Samsung S7 edge on Verizon. Setup: piece of cake. Popped the sim card out of the S7e, popped it into the Essential, when through some setup steps on the phone, connected my Google accounts, and it was operational. It let me select which of my apps I wanted to re-download and installed them (could take all with one click, but I de-selected some that I don't use first). I used the Content Transfer app from Verizon (free in the Google Play store) to transfer message history, photos, videos, etc. I was up and running with everything I use without missing a beat. The only thing I didn't see an easy way to replicate was the icons and widgets I've selected for my desktop(s), so that's a bit of work to reposition everything the way I like it. Bonus: no required apps It was nice to deselect and not have to install some of the garbage apps that Samsung and/or Verizon required me to keep on my phone. Robustness: no case required The Essential feels rock solid. It's one of their key selling points (titanium case vs aluminum in other phones), and they have a section on drop tests and not needing a case on their website. While it's not my goal to test this point excessively, I already dropped it accidentally from about 4' onto a hard surface and it was unscratched. Assuming this holds up, and that it in fact doesn't need a case, this is a big win. It's funny how we look at phones in the store naked, admiring their size and design and weight, but then have to protect them in a bulky case. I'm looking forward to using this au naturel. Water resistance: downside The Essential makes no claim about water resistance so I assume it would drown. That's a downside vs. the S7e and other waterproof phones. I suppose the equalizer would be a waterproof case but that kills the prior point. If water resistance is a key issue for you then this would negate the benefits of robustness and size (below) Size: efficient design plus no case makes it nicely smaller (see photo) See the photo attached of the S7e and Essential. They have the same screen real estate but the essential cleverly gets rid of the entire top section (where the Samsung logo and camera are) making it more than 1/2" shorter, which is a nice gain at no cost. The Essential cleverly embeds the camera into the screen itself with no real downside since that's where the icon bar sits anyway, so the camera is basically taking up the space of one top icon. When you then add to that the lack of a case (see above), I'd estimate that it's about 20% smaller in overall area and 30% smaller in total volume. That's about the difference for it to be comfortable vs. uncomfortable in my back pocket. Design: minimalist It's slick and elegant - shiny with curved corners, but nothing flashy, including no logos. Screen: very good, but slightly less bright. The screen quality and resolution are very good and seems equal to the S7. Benefit of Essential is that the edge isn't curved - it gets the same amount of screen in the same width and keeps it flat which I prefer. At their respective brightest settings, the S7 is brighter though, which maybe helpful in daylight outdoor situations. GPS (with Endomondo for running) Accurate, with just a little wobble, same as S7 Headphones - no jack I'd prefer a regular headphone jack, but the supplied adapter worked fine and my regular headphones worked with it without issue. Fingerprint sensor - well done for 1-handed operation The sensor is positioned on the back, which turns out to be a very comfortable spot for 1-handed operation. I programmed it to read the index finger of either hand. This again speaks to it not needing a case - if a case were used you couldn't access the reader. The S7 is a little more awkward for 1-hand with the reader at the bottom of the front. Camera The built-in camera is solid, quick, good quality. The coming 360 camera promises to be a very cool addition. I'm looking forward to trying that out. Phone itself Sound quality is fine (on par with S7) for both hearing and speaking Dock for charging - coming soon (I hope!) The biggest missing item out of the gate for me, that I love with my S7, is the wireless charging dock. I have one at my desk and one by my bed for the S7, I use the Seneo which is great. I just drop the phone onto the dock and it sits at a perfect 60 degree angle as an alarm clock while charging. It's a step back to go back to plugging this in. The Essential website indicates that this is coming, although from the photos the dock appears to be just lying flat. I assume a 3rd party will come out with something to address this. Overall: This is a great option based on size, robustness, and lack of extra stuff. Downside (for me) is water resistance and lack of a wireless charging dock at least initially. Otherwise it's as good or better than alternatives in other respects, and I'm very happy with it. Edit #1 - 9/6/17 As of now, visual voicemail is not set up for this device with Verizon. Agent said that it typical of new devices so it shouldn't be a lasting issue. Regular voicemail (dial in) works fine.
reviews.review_header: A great option for size, robustness, and lack of unnecessary extras
